story:
Story of My Book

Ability Innovation gives information about innovation in housing for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

My name is Astri Doub and I am the author of Ability Innovation. I wrote this book because my family is currently looking for a housing option appropriate for my brother, and I wanted to educate myself and others on the positive approaches which can be used to create someone’s ideal housing option.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the vast variety of innovative approaches in the disability housing sector and how they are being implemented to benefit people with special needs. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for innovation in the disability sector. Ultimately I hope you will see this book as a tool to help you either in the process of finding or developing a housing plan or supporting someone who is looking for a home.

In this book, you'll learn about empathy-fueled innovation in the disability housing sector:

How finding someone who understood the need for improved disability housing development options helped Pam Blanton revolutionize finding a roommate in Washington state.

Why by challenging the very notion of caregiver/resident relationships, L’Arche sustains inclusive housing options.

What makes the live/work/play communities designed by LTO Ventures financially sustainable.

You will love this book not only if you have a family member or friend with IDDs who is currently or will eventually live in an assisted living setting, but also if you are an social innovator who wants to learn about opportunity in a market considered synonymous with crisis.
Ability Innovation is a non-fiction book that speaks to families of people with IDDs and disability entrepreneurs who are looking at innovation in housing and the process of developing a housing plan for the first time.
 

The Book - Ability Innovation


The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction and Chapters 1-4. In the introduction, I will discuss my experience with the disability housing industry and lay out the terms I use throughout the book. Then I will share a brief history of disability housing in the US, and the process of looking for housing / developing a housing plan.

Part 2 contains Chapters 5-7. It lays out unique uses of physical and procedural design to increase quality of life in group homes.

Part 3 focuses on relationships. Chapters 8-10 center around employee/resident relationships and positive techniques for finding and maintaining quality staff.

Part 4 focuses on community. Chapters 11-13 focus on how homes engage and utilize the wider community to improve their homes as a whole.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor with whom I will work to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December!
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback book. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish. In addition, you will receive the following:
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name for acknowledgment in the book’s Special Acknowledgements Section (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • Access to a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experience of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Because my older brother Robb has autism and Down Syndrome, I have been life-long disability advocate. I am the author of robbslife13.blogspot.com in which I discuss my amazing brother and our relationship, and I coach my brother in Special Olympics Swimming. I also started a sibling support group and have served on sibling panels for professionals at Kennedy Krieger and volunteers at PALS Programs. Additionally, I have published articles in the Mighty and on the Chesapeake Down Syndrome Parent Group’s website.

When my family began the process of finding a housing option right for Robb, we were thrown into a world of confusion and fear. I knew that I needed to understand how I could ensure the best experience possible for my brother, so I set out looking for the best approaches in the country which I will share with you all in this book.

Outside of working on this book, I’m singing along to bluegrass music with my brothers in the car, watching Spanish dramas (highly recommend El Internado and El Barco), and practicing Norwegian whenever I get the chance!

For more information, you can connect with me via email at astridoub@live.com or LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/astri-doub-46729116a/.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #AbilityInnovation and on LinkedIn and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Astri Doub

story:
Campaign Overview

The book provides ways to better understand China, it diffuses the common perception of China through angles of International Relations, recent topics of controversy and personal experiences. I wrote it because certain inaccuracies exist in the popular understanding of China as well as a growing narrative of fear in recent discourse. Through better understanding China and what is “lost in translation,” cooperation with China can be more easily achieved. My book will publish in February 2020.

Story of My Book

Empathize with China provides ways to better understand China, it diffuses the common perception of China through angles of International Relations, recent topics of controversy and personal experiences. Through better understanding China and what is “lost in translation,” cooperation with China can be more easily achieved.

My name is Annie Ye and I am the author of Empathize with China. I wrote this book because I found there is a general difficulty to acknowledge deep cultural, societal differences that China has with the Western world. And I think this difficulty leads to some uninformed foreign policies and media strategies vis-a-vis China.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover some common themes in the West’s perception of China, without the full cultural and societal picture, can be misleading and counterproductive. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for open-mindedness in learning about different cultures, societies, and places. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you not only understand China better, but also be more critical (nonetheless curious) about news events, and lastly be able to cooperate with others despite vast differences.

In this book, you'll learn about:

  • “media war” - the “war” phenomenon on Western and Chinese media
  • the notion of China as a civilization-state - how China’s history continues to shape China today. (Why is “human rights” a problem in China. hint: it’s a different concept)
  • youth in dialogue - how to approach “difficult” topics? Dialogue is the first step to mutual understanding and cooperation. It requires respect and open minds. 

You will love this book if you like a different perspective on China, if you’d like to know more about current global issues surrounding China’s rise, and want to know what the future will be in relation to world politics and events that will actually affect our daily life.

Empathize with China is a non-fiction book that speaks to people are interested in China, people who can see opportunities in the future working with China and are willing to refresh their view on China. 

The Book - Empathize with China


The book is written in three Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + 2 chapters, it covers how events in China’s modern memory shaped the Chinese mentality of itself. An abrupt tragic ending to the long historical imperial order and the Communist modern state made China seem truncated from its glorious past and a much-degraded civilization. Personal stories tell insight into some realities of the 1970s and 80s, private business of the 2000s, and how the younger Chinese generation think of their country’s democracy and future.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-5, which examine conceptual “areas of conflict” China has with Western liberal beliefs and an example of a scholarly perception of China that gives more justice. I draw upon my own experiences to make a case for cross-cultural cooperation and via learning others' lessons. For a past that I remember, US-China relationship was much more friendly, by contrast making the current trend of this relationship worrisome.

Part 3 contains Chapters 6-8, that provides different reactions to cross-cultural difficulties (if you would bear it with me seeing US-China relationship as one big difficult cross-cultural interaction with interests of money, power, and status.) Should we run away from misunderstandings and difficulties? Should we try to have dialogue and cooperate? At the same time, we will still compete with each other? Again, I bring in personal experiences to show how cooperation may be difficult but nonetheless indispensable.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author


Anlin "Annie" Ye is an aspiring lawyer, writer, peace-maker and conflict-resolver. She attended Tufts University in Medford, Massachusetts, while she was a member of three different choirs and found a weekend home in South-End Boston. During college, she also studied at the Hebrew University in Jerusalem, Israel for a year and advanced her Hebrew skills.  At heart, she remains a Shener and brings the longing for her hometown food to places far from home. She’s also become “mom” for her friends at hotpot gatherings.

Annie has written this book because there is an imbalance of her national+cultural identity as she travels far for education, she loves her home country and wants to share with her surrounding a normalized and fuller picture of China, at the same time she learns to grapples with perspectives different from her own. Annie has no fear of missing out on social events, or Instagram and Snapchat. She has quite a close relationship with her family dearly cherishes her old friends.

For more information, you can connect with Annie at anlin.ye@tufts.edu and LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges


The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #EmpathizewithChina and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Annie Ye

story:
Cordula, Kinderbuchautorin und Liebhaberin der kleinen Dinge des Lebens!

 

Die Abenteuer bester Freunde. Plüschnasen auf Abwegen

... auf den ersten Blick vielleicht ein Kinderbuch das anders aussieht als man sie sonst kennt. Auf den zweiten Blick, vorallem im lesen, zeigen sich tolle Geschichten über Freundschaft, Zusammenleben und darüber die Welt zu entdecken.
Die Plüschnasen: Maxifant ein grüner Elefant, Platsch eine kleine Flatterente, Tjard ein Teddy mit Herz, zwei Hasen namens Mucki und Mümmi und Bernie ein frecher Schimpanse, der die Geschichten erzählt. Zusammen erleben sie ganz schön viele Abenteuer. Sie toben gern im Garten, bauen am Strand Sandburgen oder spielen auf dem Dachboden verstecken (Altersempfehlung: 8 bis 11 Jahre).

Das eingenommene Geld macht es möglich, eine größere Anzahl an Büchern zu retten und zu einem nicht verlagsgebundenen Preis zu verkaufen. Somit kann das Kinderbuch über mich auch mit "kleinerem Geldbeutel" erworben werden.

story:
Please help us support Roma rights with this charity event on Romani literature and identity

 

Romani Literature, Identity… and You

a charity benefit by Trafika Europe

to support the European Roma Rights Centre

 

with an evening of new Roma writing, music, art, and discussion

at Conway Hall, London; Sunday, June 16th, 2013, from 7:00 pm

 

The plight of the Roma in Europe remains the continent's greatest human rights challenge.

 

This evening gala will include:

  • new and newly translated Romani fiction and poetry;
  • musical performance;
  • a modest charity art auction, and
  • an expert roundtable on issues of Roma identity in Europe.

 

Participants include:

George Szirtes, T.S. Eliot Prize-winning UK poet, who has just won Best Translated Book Award for 2013

David Morley, UK Roma poet and translator, with 14 literary awards

Nick Thorpe, BBC news correspondent, roundtable moderator

Hedina Sijerčić, Canadian-Bosnian Roma poet, novelist and journalist

Dezideriu Gergely, Executive Director, European Roma Rights Centre

Dan Doghi, Higher Education Program Manager, Roma Education Fund

 

. . . plus great additional work in translation:

 

  • poetry by Károly Bari;
  • a short film by poet and painter amigó (János Bogdán);
  • poetry by László Sárközi,
  • and an excerpt from Swiss Roma Mariella Mehr’s psychological novel, stoneage

 

A full musical programme during the evening will feature:

  • Roma jazz violinist László Váradi, from the Snétberger Musical Talent Centre in Hungary – helping gifted but underprivileged Roma musicians across Central Europe with world-class mentoring, support and professional development

  • … and the uplifting unplugged reggae sounds of Brina!

 

Historic Conway Hall has been a landmark of London cultural, ethical and intellectual life for much of the last century.

 

This is a charity event to benefit the European Roma Rights Centre (ERRC), a vital Roma human rights NGO too little-known outside their sphere of advocacy.

Since 1996, the ERRC has helped Roma communities combat discrimination and seek equal access to justice, education, housing, health care and public services, and has won numerous awards for its work advancing human rights for Roma.

 

Goals and context

Our aim with this event is to foster appreciation of new Romani writing, foreground social issues and raise regard of Romani contributions in the wider European community.

In spite of more than a decade of EU-funded initiatives, the context in several EU states has become less tolerant and more discriminatory in recent years. At the same time, economic depression has hit the poorest members of society – disproportionately represented by Roma – harder than anyone else. Consequently, the need to protect basic human rights for Romani people has become more pressing.

At the same time, Roma and related groups form the largest minority in Europe, with a rich literary and cultural heritage that is continually evolving and very little known.

Showcasing great Roma literature and how it fits in the family of European cultures can be a powerful aid in helping reshape public perception and push the dialogue in a more joyful and accepting direction.

In addition to new literature, our roundtable discussion will examine Roma identity and the social context behind the works presented.

We are hoping to attract English-language publishers to some of these great Roma writers, and we plan to make a DVD of the event with additional educational material, as a tool for advocacy and outreach to policy-makers.

 

Please help us support Roma rights in Europe with this event!

 

Now, here is a little about us…

Trafika Europe: a new space for European writing

Trafika Europe wants to help you find some of the best new writing from across Europe in fresh English translation, and to make a literate, creative space where writers, publishers, translators and readers can meet, share their work and interact, free of borders in the shared medium of English language.

We aim to introduce new voices, foster collaborations and create a kind of "community of communities" for European writing.

Trafika has a wonderful history. . .

Trafika Europe is the successor to Trafika Press, Inc. We published the quarterly print journal Trafika, out of Prague and New York, of new fiction and poetry from around the world in fresh English translation in the 1990s. All work was published for the first time in English, and special emphasis was placed on introducing the work of writers who were unknown or little-known to an English-language readership.

In seven issues, Trafika published the work of over 120 authors writing in over 30 languages. Contributors included: Czeslaw Milosz, Tomaz Salamun, Natasza Goerke, Don DeLillo, Mohammed Choukri, Ales Debeljak, Anna Swir, Gyorgy Konrad, Peter Nadas, Denis Johnson, Uche Nduka, Eleni Sikelianos, Yusef Komunyakaa, Martin M. Simecka, Hanoch Levin, Tor Ulven, Ilona Lackova, and Javiar Marias.

Trafika received glowing reviews in over 30 major newspapers, magazines and related media, including the New York Times and an interview on NBC nightly news with Tom Brokaw. The Washington Post wrote: "If magazines still exist 20 years from now, you can bet a lot more of them will be international. And the literary ones are likely to resemble an attractive new quarterly out of Prague called Trafika."

...and now an exciting new chapter is beginning!

So here it is 20 years later, and we’re putting a frame of Europe around Trafika and moving the conversation wholly online. We want to contribute this space where people can explore all the many wonderful cultures, issues, perspectives and voices which go toward making a European identity in literature.

Key features of the new Trafika Europe will include:

  • new writing in translation, reviews and essays in our online journal;
  • literary news, festival coverage and event listings from around Europe;
  • recommended reads, with links for purchasing works online,
  • …and introducing a great new innovation, Europe’s first online literary radio station!

Trafika Europe Radio

Trafika Europe will stream literary interviews and performances as well as play “literary” music from all over, cover events, and host listener- and partner-produced shows. Listen to your favourite authors, catch up on events around Europe, and tune in for some of the best new writing and literary discussion from across the continent!

Please help us get started by hosting this Romani literature event!

We really need help with our June 16th Romani literature event (both before and after the event!) in order to:

  • pay our Roma translators, writers, musicians and artists;
  • transport and acccommodate talent in London;
  • pay for the venue and related costs;
  • rent equipment and tech support for the performance and HD recording, and
  • make a DVD of the event with additional menu-driven educational material.

We know what’s possible – we have some great experience presenting quality fiction and poetry in English translation, – but we sure do need help in making this new initiative a reality. Please help us take the former Trafika to the next level with this pre-launch event, toward creating this new space online, exploring quality new literature and literary identity in Europe.

 

We can also use your help in other ways!

It’s difficult to be a new start-up, and we’re certainly happy for your help in getting the word out.

If you like what we’re about, won’t you take a moment to share the links to this campaign, to our Trafika Europe site and to our Facebook page with your friends? Thanks so much for helping us reach a wider audience in this time!

On our site you can purchase tickets for this Roma literary event, at Conway Hall in London, June 16th from 7:00 pm. Please know that you are supporting the European Roma Rights Centre with every ticket you buy.

And of course, please sign up for updates at our site. We will be happy to keep you in the loop with occasional updates as we approach our launch.

 

Trafika Europe is slated to launch at the end of 2013. We are a programme of the Dazzling Spark Arts Foundation, giving us UK not-for-profit status.

Dazzling Spark Arts Foundation sponsors and supports artistic, educational and community-building endeavours which promote peace, understanding and dialogue between different groups and identities, in pursuit of a wider unity which embraces respect for all traditions and cultures.

Our activities include:

  • providing learning opportunities through schools, academies, retreats, seminars, master classes, residences and web-based platforms;
  • creating and supporting innovative programs which foster excellence in the arts in service to humanity;
  • sponsoring and supporting activities which promote unity in diversity across a wide range of arts and media;
  • recognizing and encouraging artists who have made an outstanding contribution to their field, and
  • fundraising to widen individual participation and community engagement with the arts, especially with marginalized and disenfranchised groups and minorities.

 

Thank you!

Thank you so much for taking a moment with all this, for supporting Roma rights with this charity event, for helping us get on our feet – and for helping us bring you new literary voices from across Europe in fresh English translation.

We hope to see you at our site – or live in person in London on June 16th!

Thank you again, on behalf of our event team leaders:

     Andrew Singer, Trafika Europe

     Gordon Kerr, Dazzling Spark Arts Foundation

     Ailsa Spindler, European Roma Rights Centre
story_txt:
Please help us support Roma rights with this charity event on Romani literature and identity
 
Romani Literature, Identity… and You
a charity benefit by Trafika Europe
to support the European Roma Rights Centre
 
with an evening of new Roma writing, music, art, and discussion
at Conway Hall, London; Sunday, June 16th, 2013, from 7:00 pm
 
The plight of the Roma in Europe remains the continent's greatest human rights challenge.
 
This evening gala will include:

new and newly translated Romani fiction and poetry;
musical performance;
a modest charity art auction, and
an expert roundtable on issues of Roma identity in Europe.
 
Participants include:
George Szirtes, T.S. Eliot Prize-winning UK poet, who has just won Best Translated Book Award for 2013
David Morley, UK Roma poet and translator, with 14 literary awards
Nick Thorpe, BBC news correspondent, roundtable moderator
Hedina Sijerčić, Canadian-Bosnian Roma poet, novelist and journalist
Dezideriu Gergely, Executive Director, European Roma Rights Centre
Dan Doghi, Higher Education Program Manager, Roma Education Fund
 
. . . plus great additional work in translation:
 

poetry by Károly Bari;

a short film by poet and painter amigó (János Bogdán);

poetry by László Sárközi,

and an excerpt from Swiss Roma Mariella Mehr’s psychological novel, stoneage

 
A full musical programme during the evening will feature:

Roma jazz violinist László Váradi, from the Snétberger Musical Talent Centre in Hungary – helping gifted but underprivileged Roma musicians across Central Europe with world-class mentoring, support and professional development

… and the uplifting unplugged reggae sounds of Brina!
 
Historic Conway Hall has been a landmark of London cultural, ethical and intellectual life for much of the last century.
 
This is a charity event to benefit the European Roma Rights Centre (ERRC), a vital Roma human rights NGO too little-known outside their sphere of advocacy.
Since 1996, the ERRC has helped Roma communities combat discrimination and seek equal access to justice, education, housing, health care and public services, and has won numerous awards for its work advancing human rights for Roma.
 
Goals and context
Our aim with this event is to foster appreciation of new Romani writing, foreground social issues and raise regard of Romani contributions in the wider European community.
In spite of more than a decade of EU-funded initiatives, the context in several EU states has become less tolerant and more discriminatory in recent years. At the same time, economic depression has hit the poorest members of society – disproportionately represented by Roma – harder than anyone else. Consequently, the need to protect basic human rights for Romani people has become more pressing.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Jennifer and I am in a tough spot as my WCB ended and I am in between jobs.  Yesterday morning I broke my glasses which were on the floor under a teddy bear thanks to my 5 year old :)  I can't see very well right now and cannot afford a pair of glasses.  Ideally I would like to get a pair from a local retailer as I like to support local. 

I went up to a child that I thought was my son at the swimming pool!

I tried to keep things normal by taking my son swimming.  Everything was a blur.  I went up to a child that I *thought* was my son and was confused when a large tattooed man glared at me angrily.  I wondered why he was staring at me.  I thought he was a weirdo. It turns out I was about to kidnap someone else's child.  I realize that I can't go without glasses and unfortunately I don't even know how I am going to pay rent next month since I was suddenly and unexpectedly cut off from WCB on January 24th and have applied for social assistance but they have not gotten back to me.

What Can I do for You

I am lost without my sight and would be so grateful for any help that I can receive.  It is hard to do anything at all and I have severe headaches right now.  Anyone that wants a banner on Bee Green BC Online Magazine beegreen.ca and contributes $20 or more to this cause will receive a FREE BANNER DESIGN and 2 months on the site.  I can also do a cut and color/highlights when Grassroots Eco Salon opens in Fernwood on March 15th for donations of $100 or more.

story:
What We Need 

To fund our monthly writing workshop series for queer, trans, and non-binary youth of color, we need $6k to pay all fees associated with:

  • keeping the workshop free and accessible to youth,
  • paying for workshop spaces,
  • travel, lodging, and compensation for workshop hosts
  • metro cards for youth who cannot afford the commute
  • workshop supplies

What You Get

For your generous contribution, we have the following prizes + more:


Signed copy of J Mase III’s chapbook, “And Then I Got Fired: One Transqueer's Reflections on Grief, Unemployment &amp; Inappropriate Jokes About Death.” J Mase III is a black/trans/queer poet currently based in NYC. Creator of the traveling performance event Cupid Ain’t @#$%!: An Anti-Valentine’s Day Poetry Movement, he can be tracked on Facebook, twitter, or via his website at www.jmaseiii.com.

A signed copy of Saeed Jones' forthcoming poetry collection, PRELUDE TO BRUISE (Coffee House Press, 2014). A 2013 Pushcart Prize Winner, Jones is also the editor of Buzzfeed LGBT.

An autographed copy of Roxane Gay’s critically acclaimed novel, AN UNTAMED STATE (Grove/Atlantic, 2014). She has been widely published and is the co-editor of PANK and essays editor for The Rumpus. She teaches writing at Eastern Illinois University.

An autographed copy of Jericho Brown’s forthcoming collection THE NEW TESTAMENT (Copper Canyon Press, 2014). His first collection, PLEASE (New Issues, 2008), won the 2009 American Book Award.

A signed copy of Black Girl Dangerous creator Mia McKenzie's second book, Black Girl Dangerous on Race, Queerness, Class, and Gender, and her Lambda Literary Award Winning debut novel, The Summer We Got Free.


Signed copies of Danez Smith's first chapbook, Black Boy Be, and his latest collection, Hands on Ya Knees (Penmanship Press, 2013).


Consult with Kai Davis, esteemed slam poet, on three to five of your own original performance pieces. Davis been featured at the San Francisco Opera House, The Kimmel Center, and on CNN. In 2011, she was awarded the title of National Brave New Voices Grand Slam Champion; in 2012 she was the second ranked Youth Speaks Individual Slam Poet in the nation. Currently, she serves as the artistic director of Babel, Temple University's poetry collective, in addition to performing across the country.


A two-hour generative session with Safia Elhillo. An MFA Candidate at The New School, Safia is also a poetry editor at Kinfolks Quarterly, has appeared on Verses and Flow on TV1, and was a finalist in the 2011 Women of the World Poetry Slam. Her book of poems,The Life and Times of Susie Knuckles, is published by Well&Often Press.

Consult with Jericho Brown on 7-to-10 core one-page poems of your manuscript. Brown’s poems have appeared or are forthcoming in journals and anthologies including The American Poetry Review, The New Yorker, The New Republic, Oxford American, and The Best American Poetry. His first book, Please (New Issues), won the American Book Award. His second collection, The New Testament (Copper Canyon Press), will be published in September 2014.

Consult with Kiese Laymon on 10-to-20 core pages of your manuscript or short story. Laymon is an associate professor of English at Vassar University and is the author of Long Division and How to Slowly Kill Yourself and Others in America .

The Impact

"It is one thing to say we exist; it is another thing to show it. Art is political, art is about activism.” - Zanele Muholi

Every dollar you donate is an investment in the literary development of queer, trans, and gender-non-conforming youth. These funds also compensate queer/trans/non-binary adults, who are often unemployed or deftly underpaid, for hosting these workshops.

 By creating a community of youth and adult queer, trans, and gender-non-conforming writers, a support system is built, and writers whose stories are often  exploited, silenced, or mocked become valued thereby creating a much needed queering of writing.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is financially able to support us. But you are still valuable to this campaign and can help out by:

  • Re-posting this to your social media pages 
  • Sharing the link directly with persons who you know would be interested in investing in such a venture.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is financially able to support us. 
But you are still valuable to this campaign and can help out by: 

Re-posting this to your social media pages 
Sharing the link directly with persons who you know would be interested in investing in such a venture.

story:
The Idea

The year, 2012. May to be exact. I had just graduated from NYU with my M.S. in publishing, where I had spent the last two years studying the digital trends. My family came to visit me from California for the ceremony.

On their last day, my mom pulled me aside. "Now just remember, you need to come home for December 21. If the world ends, I want my family to be with me."

I thought this was silly. But then I started getting scared. What if the world ends this year? I thought. Where would I want to be? I tried to shake it off. Nah, that's ridiculous. I can't let fear dictate how I live.

Then the idea hit me. Maybe I could write a book about the Mayans and their end of the world prediction. It could be a thriller, and it might be a comforting way to deal with the doubts and fears. With any luck, people would read it and be reassured that the world will not actually end this year.

But how to go about it? Well, 2012 is a time of rapid change in the publishing industry, between creating new genres, to publishing digital shorts, to trying out new business models. Personally I love experimenting. Last year I co-founded a digital publishing company just so I could say I tried. For the 2012 ebook, I decided I wanted to try agile publishing. 

Agile publishing comes from the idea of agile software. In the startup world, entrepreneurs use the agile structure to quickly and effectively evolve to meet their customers needs, without wasting time or money. Some publishers, such as SourceBooks, are now using agile publishing to write books they know customers will want to read. 

For the 2012 ebook, I have created a website, http://the2012ebook.com. On this site, I plan to regularly post chapters of my book. Hopefully people will read the chapters and give me feedback in the comments. The more detailed feedback, the better! I want to incorporate the feedback as I go along, shaping the story into something I and other people would want to read.

The Video

Everything about the project is explained in the video, but there's also a little extra. I really love dinosaurs--if I could do it all over I think I would study palentology instead of communication/writing/publishing (though I do love that too...). So my friends and I made a short video involving some dinosaur hand puppets I got for Christmas. If you want to just watch that part of the video, skip ahead to the 1:38 mark. Enjoy!

What the 2012 EBook Needs & What You Get

Sometimes self-publishing gets a bad rap. This is because some people publish too early, without enough editing, or because they don't have the funds to effectively market, so not enough people see their work.

For the 2012 ebook to be successful, I will need funding for the following:

  • Editing.To make a high quality ebook, I will need to hire a high quality editor.
  • Marketing. It takes money to be successful. I will need to reach out to bloggers and reviewers, place ads, and more.
  • Cover Design. I'm not an artist, so ideally I'd like to hire someone to create my cover.
  • Miscellaneous. This includes registering copyright, researching metadata, etc. (Read more about self-publishing on my blog, http://digitalpubbing.com)

If, unfortunately, I don't meet my goal, then the funds I do get will be used for editing. I want to write the best book possible for readers to enjoy.

So what's in it for you? Well, a lot!

Depending on which perk you pick, you can get free marketing/advertising, discounts for restaurants, and even ebook conversions. If you're a writer, this is a great deal. Automatic ebook conversions often come out sloppy and jumbled, which will make readers angry. Angry readers means negative reviews, negative reviews means fewer sales, and it becomes a viscious cycle. I used to be an ebook developer at Simon & Schuster, and I'm the co-founder and publisher of FictionBrigade, where I produced flash fiction ebooks. Work with me and I'll ensure your ebook looks good.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like my project but can't contribute, no worries there are other ways you can help!

  • Get the word out about the 2012 ebook. Tell your friends, share the link, and make some noise!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for your support!

Then the idea hit me. Maybe I could write a book about the Mayans and their end of the world prediction. It could be a thriller, and it might be a comforting way to deal with the doubts and fears. With any luck, people would read it and be reassured that the world will not actually end this year.
But how to go about it? Well, 2012 is a time of rapid change in the publishing industry, between creating new genres, to publishing digital shorts, to trying out new business models. Personally I love experimenting. Last year I co-founded a digital publishing company just so I could say I tried. For the 2012 ebook, I decided I wanted to try agile publishing. 
Agile publishing comes from the idea of agile software. In the startup world, entrepreneurs use the agile structure to quickly and effectively evolve to meet their customers needs, without wasting time or money. Some publishers, such as SourceBooks, are now using agile publishing to write books they know customers will want to read. 
For the 2012 ebook, I have created a website, http://the2012ebook.com. On this site, I plan to regularly post chapters of my book. Hopefully people will read the chapters and give me feedback in the comments. The more detailed feedback, the better! I want to incorporate the feedback as I go along, shaping the story into something I and other people would want to read.
The Video
Everything about the project is explained in the video, but there's also a little extra. I really love dinosaurs--if I could do it all over I think I would study palentology instead of communication/writing/publishing (though I do love that too...). So my friends and I made a short video involving some dinosaur hand puppets I got for Christmas. If you want to just watch that part of the video, skip ahead to the 1:38 mark. Enjoy!


What the 2012 EBook Needs & What You Get
Sometimes self-publishing gets a bad rap. This is because some people publish too early, without enough editing, or because they don't have the funds to effectively market, so not enough people see their work.
For the 2012 ebook to be successful, I will need funding for the following:

Editing.To make a high quality ebook, I will need to hire a high quality editor.
Marketing. It takes money to be successful. I will need to reach out to bloggers and reviewers, place ads, and more.
Cover Design. I'm not an artist, so ideally I'd like to hire someone to create my cover.
Miscellaneous. This includes registering copyright, researching metadata, etc. (Read more about self-publishing on my blog, http://digitalpubbing.com)



If, unfortunately, I don't meet my goal, then the funds I do get will be used for editing. I want to write the best book possible for readers to enjoy.
So what's in it for you? Well, a lot!
Depending on which perk you pick, you can get free marketing/advertising, discounts for restaurants, and even ebook conversions. If you're a writer, this is a great deal. Automatic ebook conversions often come out sloppy and jumbled, which will make readers angry. Angry readers means negative reviews, negative reviews means fewer sales, and it becomes a viscious cycle. I used to be an ebook developer at Simon & Schuster, and I'm the co-founder and publisher of FictionBrigade, where I produced flash fiction ebooks. Work with me and I'll ensure your ebook looks good.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you like my project but can't contribute, no worries there are other ways you can help!

Get the word out about the 2012 ebook. Tell your friends, share the link, and make some noise!
Use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thanks for your support!

story:
Emerald is the first in a trilogy and tells the story of a world that is similar to our own but is tainted by darkness, one which we can't comprehend or engage with. If we were to be successful in either, no good could come from it. Emerald takes place in the fictional city of New Raven, home to one of the last known D-Hunters, a young woman named Tilder Asgrave, who's life has taken a bizarre turn and she must fight not only fight her own inner demons but ones that threaten the lives of everyone around her.


This is the story of good versus evil, redemption and unmasking what we believed to be true for so long. The world I've created, the characters I've spawned from my mind live in a world free from the usual influx of bigotry that the real world you and I, suffer. 

Women in Emerald are powerful, all races and creeds are equal and sexual orientation is not a topic that is spat upon by society. If you want to dive into a book that is a mix of mystery, noir, paranormal and real humanity while taking refuge from the annoyances of discrimination that is still breathing these days, then Emerald is for you. I sought to write a story that could be read in the dark, or on a train as you went to work and I found myself writing a story that also gave me hope of how the world could be.

This story is so much more than I can even describe right now.

No story can exist without having people to read it. This novel took me 5 years to perfect and the story doesn't just focus on genres and themes that I find entertaining, but contains allegories and creations that I realised over time were beginning to come from real life experiences and emotions.

With your contribution and generosity you will have helped someone realised their dream, their actual dream coming true. I can only imagine the feeling of some day seeing something I conjured and wrote sitting on a shelf with other copies and maybe being bought and read by someone. I can only imagine how wonderful it would feel to talk to people that read Emerald.

Even the smallest donation will receive a personalised thank you.

Aside from the much needed money, any help with the promotion of this page or accompanied links will be greatly appreciated, you have no idea how much so.

With donations received from IndieGoGo I can commission artwork to accompany my manuscript for submission to publishers and primarily I can afford to self publish this book. 

This page, as well as my blog will be updated periodically with artwork, progress and samples, including videos from the pages of Emerald.

My dream has always been to have something I cared about let free and this story, the novel is something I don't want to remain in a document folder for the rest of my life. I've written stories since I was a child and a few years ago I decided to write about something I believed in, something I could contribute to the literary world


Please don't hesitate to contact me at theemeraldbullet@live.ie about any queries, suggestions or even hellos :)

story:
I've been writing poetry and playing violin since I was 5. Till now, music has been my main focus and professional life, with poetry reserved for lovers, family and close friends... This year, as part of the culmination of many years of deep spiritual practice, I began writing a poem every day, and posting it on Facebook. The feedback has been overwhelmingly positive, with many requests for a book. The book is now complete, and ready for publication, through Balboa Press. This is a "Self-publishing" company, and requires cash outlay for the hard copy. 

I hear music inside all the time, that goes with the poetry. The Companion CD is an expression of this inner music, to gently accompany and give an ambience to the reading of the poems. Recording has begun, and a thousand copies will be ready for release with the publication of the book.

I'm offering discounted packages as a way to get this project funded and to get the poetry and music out to people. The book will retail for $23.99 and the CD for $15. For a $30 donation I'll send the combination with free shipping. This is a $15 discount...

It's my sincere belief that this poetry and music have the potential to heal and uplift any spirit. Thanks for your support, and may your journey be filled with love and joy!

story:
About Lamplighter Magazine

The Magazine!

Lamplighter is an alternative music & culture magazine, to be published quarterly. Focusing on New Jersey, the magazine intends to create a heading under which local music, art, poetry, and all alternative culture can collect and collaborate, for the purpose of supporting and expanding the scene.

 

The Staff!

We, the staff of Lamplighter Magazine, are a group of plucky graduates from William Paterson University, who has undertaken this project; we believe in its value, though it stands in the face of a difficult economic time. Starting simply as a website, we are expanding our operation into this quarterly publication.

 

The First Issue!

This first issue carries great value to us, because, unlike running a website, the print magazine will give people something to carry themselves. Being able to put pictures and articles, the words of local writers, and interesting stories into your hands is the most direct experience in which we can engage the community outside of bringing you to an art gallery or a poetry reading.

 

With your contribution, you will allow us to have this experience a thousand times! Your support will provide us with the funding to print 1000 copies of the first issue. This support will also extend itself into further issues as we begin to seek out advertisers, who want to know the community believes in our endeavor.


Our Goal & Your Rewards

Our only goal is to print exactly 1000 copies of the magazine. But the task of printing a magazine is no small item on the daily to-do list! As for this issue, including the perk rewards for the campaign, we need to pay for:

  • Printing the magazine
  • Shipping it to our headquarters
  • Mailing issues out to the happy people of NJ (and beyond!)
  • Mix CDs (it's a perk!)
  • Taxes, fees, etc.
 
Realistically, the $2000 goal just covers the cost of printing. We cannot pay our writers. We cannot pay our photographers or our designers. It doesn't pay for flyers or promotion needs. It doesn't cover the cost of our website. We aren't even throwing a pizza party. All of this is a passionate "goodness-of-our-hearts" work for the community. If we were to pay everyone fairly, we've estimated the true value of our work to be over $5000! But that is for another time, which can only happen with your help now.
 
Because you are so generous to contribute to our cause, we have a nice set of rewards depending on your donation level:
 
$1 - Karma Points
You may not have a lot of money, but you think we've got a good idea! For your donation, we'll thank you by putting your name in the magazine. You'll also get a digital copy, so you can see what you've supported.
 
$5 - The Poet
You love our magazine and have just enough money for a copy of your own! For your donation, you'll get karma points and we're going to mail you a copy.
 
$10 - The Artist
You've got a couple extra bucks and want to show us this magazine is important to you. For your donation, you'll get everything above plus a personalized note from us and a couple stickers!
 
$20 - The Musician
You're involved with the scene! We've seen you at shows! For your contribution of $20, you'll get the previous perks plus a mix CD of our favorite local music.
 
$50 - The Night Owl
You go out. Often. But today, you're giving up a night out to support our magazine. For your generous sacrifice, we're giving you all the previous perks, two more copies of the magazine, and an iChat (or skype) date with the owners of Lamplighter Magazine!
 
$100 - The Lamplighter
You are a king / queen of New Jersey culture, and want only the best for the garden state! For your generosity, we're giving you all the perks, and with permission, a half page ad in the magazine to support an artist, musician, or local business of your choosing.
  

What We'll Achieve

We are not your stereotypical, lazy twenty-somethings! In the short time that our website has been the focal point of this project, we have:

  • Developed a strong following of regular readers
  • Established a positive name and brand that has artists and musicians contacting us
  • Set a high standard for both quality writing and easily accessible content
 
None of that will be changing with the magazine! And, as more than just passive observers and journalists, we are members of the communities that we discuss, hosting events and participating in them. From organizing music performances to reading poetry at open-mic nights, we feed the creative community as much as we write about it. In turn, we've seen this forge strong relationships between people and create a more meaningful life as both writers and artists.
 

As a contributor, by supporting our project, you are allowing us to put the community back in the people's hands. No longer just a website or a passing press clip online, Lamplighter can now be passed from person to person, helping the most vital aspects of the community grow.

  

How To Help Us!

Regardless of whether or not you can contribute to our cause monetarily, you can always support us in other ways by spreading the word. Forward this campaign page to your friends and family. Post our project on Facebook and tell people why you think its important, or tweet about us. Anything to help build the discussion so that people will take note of our mission!

You can always like us on Facebook by going to http://Facebook.com/LamplighterNJ
 
or tweet with us by going to http://Twitter.com/LamplighterNJ
 
Of course, if you have a lot to say, send us an e-mail: info@LamplighterNJ.com
 
And don't forget to visit our homepage for updates about the campaign: http://LamplighterNJ.com

And don't forget to visit our homepage for updates about the campaign: http://LamplighterNJ.com

story:
My name is David and I’m a blog writer, public speaker and author (as well as a husband, father and grandfather). My first book was self published, called ‘A Book of Weeks’. The distribution has been a hand to hand/word of mouth kind of sales process. Whenever I am hired to speak, facilitate a workshop or leadership retreat I sell the book - I have not been able to get into stores, on radio or television to promote it. The feedback on the first book is good - it’s a self coaching book and people from all over the country are use it to change their lives to live better and be well.

 

My new book is called ‘slight adjustments’ and I need your help to publish, market and distribute this new book with an established book company. I’m looking at balboa press and the packages that I know will afford me the greatest promotional support will cost a total of $15,000. Your gift will put this book in the hands of a multitude of people, and consequently the people who will read & use the techniques and ideas in the book will experience new energy, direction, insight, understanding and inspiration for what they truly want to create. They will then be in a better position to impact their personal world of influence in positive and significant ways.

 

I am a recovered drug user who has been clean mentally, spiritually and physically for the last 32 years. In that former lifestyle I became a self hater, a fearful soul and an angry man. I regretted living but was too afraid to die. I blamed everyone and everything for my misery and surrounded myself with those who were even more miserable than I was so I could learn from them how to be more miserable - crazy right? Well that is what addiction is all about.

 

I made a deep choice to stop killing myself and turn the wheel-less raggedy wagon that was left of my life all the way around to possibility, health and finally freedom.

 

This series of books takes what I have used to become whole and shares it in terms of mental tools and ideas by asking questions for consideration and awakening awareness. This is a life lifting book of self coaching and fulfillment for anyone who is ready to change.

 

My mission is to get as many books in front of as many people as possible within the next few months.

 

My vision is to provide people with practical, user friendly thinking tools designed to widen their present possibilities and deepen their sense of ability and capability to do more, have more and be more.

 

My intention is to help people move from hurt, wounded-ness, addiction, fear, heartache or uncertainty to a life of healthy living, personal fulfillment, inner joy and financial abundance with a desire to make a difference in the lives of other people as well.

 

I would invite you to look at balboa press which is my publisher of choice and see that I’ve chosen the embark package for $999.

Then look at the marketing section where I’ve chosen the hay house online event package for $3,999.

Finally I’ve chosen the on-line newsmaker publicity campaign for $5,999.

 

Balboa press is a subsidiary of the famous hay house press that deals with authors like Louise Hay, Deepak Chopra, and Wayne Dyer. It is so exciting to be this close to being with balboa press as a yet internationally known author because it can be a gateway to hay house and its ‘invitation only’ agent driven process of almost guaranteed success.

story:
What is Strange Horizons? 

Strange Horizons is a weekly online magazine of and about speculative fiction—science fiction, fantasy, horror, slipstream, and all other flavors of imaginative fiction—and related non-fiction. Since September 2000, we have been publishing new issues every Monday, including fiction, poetry, reviews, essays, and interviews. 

We're entirely funded by voluntary contributions. We pay all our contributors fair market rates for their work, but our (frankly enormous) volunteer editorial team does it out of love.

Why support Strange Horizons?

Because we believe that in the twenty-first century, speculative fiction must be an open, global tradition. For over fifteen years we have showcased work that challenges us and delights us, by new and established writers from diverse backgrounds and with diverse concerns. 

Because we have a record of finding and supporting exciting new voices in SF: writers who got their start in Strange Horizons include N. K. Jemisin ("Cloud Dragon Skies," from 2005), Justine Larbalestier (" The Cruel Brother," from 2001), Ken Liu ("The Algorithms for Love," from 2004), Nnedi Okorafor ("The Palm Tree Bandit," from 2000), and John Scalzi ("Alien Animal Encounters," from 2001).

Because we're a multiple Hugo-shortlisted magazine and we've published stories that have been shortlisted for or won Hugo, Nebula, James Tiptree Jr., Theodore Sturgeon, and World Fantasy Awards.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need to raise:

  • We need $16,000 to fund the basic running costs of the magazine for 1 year
  • If we get to $17,000 we'll run a special issue packed with Arabic SFF
  • At $17,500 we'll create a rolling guest-edited column on the subject of resistance
  • At $20,000 we'll be running a special issue on SFF from the Southeastern USA
  • If we hit $21,500 we'll unlock the first of 2 super secret stretch goals
  • At $23,000 we'll unlock the other super secret goal!

What do you get out of this?

  • If you donate $25 you get access to all of 2017's Strange Horizons ebooks 
  • If you donate $40 you get the above and digital wallpaper of our 2017 artwork for your computer/phone/device.
  • If you donate $50 you get the above and a mug or t-shirt branded with the Strange Horizons logo
  • If you donate $75 you don't have to choose! You get a mug and a t-shirt as well as all lower tier rewards.
  • If you donate $100 you get all lower tier rewards and a set of art postcards, featuring all of the art from this year.
  • If you donate $150 you get one of our special limited edition Strange Horizons lapel pins and all the $75 rewards.

More than that, for each funding milestone that we reach, we'll publish more bonus content for you to enjoy:

- $1,500 - 2 bonus poems by Nin Harris and Valya Dudycz
- $3,000 - a bonus review by Erin Horáková
- $5,000 - bonus fiction by Aliya Whiteley
- $7,500 - bonus review by Vandana Singh
- $9,000 - translated fiction reprint by Chen Qiufan and Ken Liu
- $10,500 - bonus surprise non-fiction content
- $12,000 - 2 more bonus poems by Dimas Ilaw and Ryu Ando
- $13,500 - more bonus fiction by Helena Bell
- $15,000 - podcasts of all fiction and poetry
- $16,000 - fund drive goal! Fund drive e-books for everyone who donated!

Other Ways You Can Help

Tweet about the fund drive! Tell everyone you know what you love about Strange Horizons and why we're worth supporting.

Ask people to read the magazine!

We're entirely funded by voluntary contributions. We pay all our contributors fair market rates for their work, but our (frankly enormous) volunteer editorial team does it out of love.
Why support Strange Horizons?
Because we believe that in the twenty-first century, speculative fiction must be an open, global tradition. For over fifteen years we have showcased work that challenges us and delights us, by new and established writers from diverse backgrounds and with diverse concerns. Because we have a record of finding and supporting exciting new voices in SF: writers who got their start in Strange Horizons include N. K. Jemisin ("Cloud Dragon Skies," from 2005), Justine Larbalestier (" The Cruel Brother," from 2001), Ken Liu ("The Algorithms for Love," from 2004), Nnedi Okorafor ("The Palm Tree Bandit," from 2000), and John Scalzi ("Alien Animal Encounters," from 2001).Because we're a multiple Hugo-shortlisted magazine and we've published stories that have been shortlisted for or won Hugo, Nebula, James Tiptree Jr., Theodore Sturgeon, and World Fantasy Awards.

What We Need & What You Get
What we need to raise:

We need $16,000 to fund the basic running costs of the magazine for 1 year
If we get to $17,000 we'll run a special issue packed with Arabic SFF
At $17,500 we'll create a rolling guest-edited column on the subject of resistance
At $20,000 we'll be running a special issue on SFF from the Southeastern USA
If we hit $21,500 we'll unlock the first of 2 super secret stretch goals
At $23,000 we'll unlock the other super secret goal!

What do you get out of this?

If you donate $25 you get access to all of 2017's Strange Horizons ebooks 
If you donate $40 you get the above and digital wallpaper of our 2017 artwork for your computer/phone/device.
If you donate $50 you get the above and a mug or t-shirt branded with the Strange Horizons logo
If you donate $75 you don't have to choose! You get a mug and a t-shirt as well as all lower tier rewards.
If you donate $100 you get all lower tier rewards and a set of art postcards, featuring all of the art from this year.
If you donate $150 you get one of our special limited edition Strange Horizons lapel pins and all the $75 rewards.

More than that, for each funding milestone that we reach, we'll publish more bonus content for you to enjoy:
- $1,500 - 2 bonus poems by Nin Harris and Valya Dudycz- $3,000 - a bonus review by Erin Horáková- $5,000 - bonus fiction by Aliya Whiteley- $7,500 - bonus review by Vandana Singh- $9,000 - translated fiction reprint by Chen Qiufan and Ken Liu- $10,500 - bonus surprise non-fiction content- $12,000 - 2 more bonus poems by Dimas Ilaw and Ryu Ando- $13,500 - more bonus fiction by Helena Bell- $15,000 - podcasts of all fiction and poetry- $16,000 - fund drive goal! Fund drive e-books for everyone who donated!

Other Ways You Can Help
Tweet about the fund drive! Tell everyone you know what you love about Strange Horizons and why we're worth supporting.
Ask people to read the magazine!

story:
The Journey is the Destination: The Case for Holistic, Restorative Education is my storied take on how education must transform in order to meet the needs of young people in today’s globalized and precarious world. Rather than being mired in test scores and returns-on-investment, education has to recognize the forces which threaten civilization itself: global inequality and climate change. In response to these macro-trends, education must center the whole student and prepare them to be problem-solvers, change makers, and responsible citizens of the modern world. Unfortunately, there is no more time to waste.

I drew inspiration to write this book from my journey through public, private, charter, and magnet schools. After attending high school in Las Vegas, I went to Georgetown University, and this transition put me face-to-face with the scope of economic inequality in the modern United States. My high school was surrounded by convenience stores, liquor stores, and apartment complexes, whereas my college was a billion-dollar school in the nation’s capital with towering stone and brick buildings.

I had reached the promised land my parents had wished for me; with a Georgetown degree, I would probably never struggle to find work. And yet, despite earning a high GPA, I struggled with loneliness, anxiety, and depression throughout college. I was a Gilded Student; golden grades and a golden smile enabled me to hide my struggle from my peers and professors.

Meanwhile, I studied the ails of society in the classroom—from climate change to global racism—thereby adding an existential twinge to my daily stresses. Eventually, I came to realize that my struggles with mental health, my façade resume, and the problems facing the world were all engaged in a tragic and dissonant dance. Although my reckoning with the education system may seem melodramatic, it is common for many struggling with mental health issues—especially in the age of social media, which is linked to rising depression and anxiety rates. Each of us is introduced to the path to personal excellence, wealth, and social status—all while knowing that global forces threaten our future.

Fortunately, I believe that changing our core educational framework can provide leverage for change in the rest of society. By prioritizing both student-flourishing and community wellbeing education can evolve into a training ground for democracy, a hub for innovative solutions, and a bastion for equality.

In these pages, we’ll explore how we can cultivate a new form of education which channels the individual talents of young people into careers and lifestyles that will lead to both personal fulfillment and global problem-solving. Specifically, we’ll see:

  • How project-based learning might help revive our democracy.
  • How social media and climate change is turning Gen Z (those born between 1997 and 2012) into the “Doomer Generation.”

If you’ve ever questioned the point of education, or believe in its power as a transformative force for good, you will definitely like this book. Regardless of your beliefs, my biggest hope is that you’ll feel a newfound appreciation for education, learning, and growth.

What I Need & What You'll Get

New Degree Press will be publishing my book. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the publishing costs. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the pages of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

As soon as I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I’ll publish a paperback and ebook. At 150 copies, I’ll publish a hardcover. At 200, I’ll publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

If you pre-order I’ll give you a huge thanks and these added perks!

Personally signed copy of my book when published.

Your name in the Acknowledgments section.

Early access to the Intro and other excerpts and a chance to give me your early feedback.

Opportunity to help me select my cover and title.

Invitation to join my Author Community, where you’ll see the behind-the-scenes of the publishing process.

And more! :)

About the Author

Michael Pasimio is a Las Vegas native and attends Georgetown University, where he studies in the School of Foreign Service. He works at The Hub for Equity and Innovation in Higher Education and serves as Co-Chair of the Student Experience Committee. Throughout his time at Georgetown, he’s worked closely to organize and promote equity and diversity initiatives. He’s also partnered with various organizations around education and youth development, including Gentlemen By Choice and the International Youth Foundation.

His passion for education comes from his personal journey through private, public, magnet, and charter schools in Las Vegas, which are consistently at the bottom of national rankings. In 2018, Michael enrolled in Georgetown, and in his first year, the school made national news during the 2019 college admissions bribery scandal, but he learned firsthand how the scandal only scratched the surface of the faults within the education system. He took it upon himself to find solutions to these problems by providing college counseling to students from his high school at no cost and promoting educational equity among the student body. Michael also joined The Pivotal Network at Georgetown to help make college more affordable and accessible to first-generation and lower-income students.

In his free time, Michael reads, watches anime, walks his dogs, and hosts education brainstorming sessions with his friends. He always finds ways to attend events and meet new people, and he loves it when other people share their stories.

You can connect with Michael at mvp36@georgetown.edu and follow him on Instagram @mic.pasimio.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk of publishing a book is mailing a physical copy to my supporters. Fortunately, I’ve included the cost of mailing and shipping into my pre-order goals, so we don’t have to worry.

This risk itself depends a lot on the publisher, but New Degree Press is extremely reliable in making sure that all the perks of pre-order are delivered ASAP. I’ll keep all my supporters in the loop on my book publishing date, and you’ll know when you can expect the physical book to be in your hands.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #EduJourney and tag me (@mic.pasimio) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press (@newdegreepress), so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Send me words of encouragement or ask to review some of my content!

Thank you so much for all the support you’ve given me already.

Sincerely,

Michael

story:
About:

Sometimes Blue Daddi-O was written for young readers who have loved ones that struggle with mental illness, anxiety, or depression.  Children will be empowered as they are assured that the illness and its effects are not their fault, nor should they feel pressure to adopt the surrounding emotions and behaviors as their own.  Families are encouraged and freed to create a powerful environment of hope, joy, and thankfulness.

This is a story about a sweet family of three birds whose joyful song is woven throughout their daily lives.  The beloved father’s reoccurring blue moods threaten that song and the young daughter becomes hurt and confused, not knowing how to cope.  Her mother must make an important choice about how to rescue their melody.  

This storyline was inspired by my childhood, as my father has struggled with mental illness and depression the majority of his life.  I wrote it to honor my family and to encourage others who are encountering the same battle.  I believe this book will encourage discussion and bring support to many kids who also have loved ones who suffer from a mental illness.  Thank you for partnering with me and making this book a reality!  

 

What You Get:

Your pre-order of this self-published book will include these rewards: 

  • A signed copy of the book
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note
  • Early access to the digital copy of the book
  • An exclusive zoom session where I read the book live to you or loved ones 
  • Access to my mailing list where I will personally share about the publishing journey

And more...

Money raised will go toward the following:

  • 50% goes to printing
  • 21% goes to distribution and fulfillment costs through amazon, storage, and shipping
  • 17% goes to administrative costs to navigate the publishing process
  • 7.5% goes to the layout design for the cover & interior of my book (physical copy and e-book formats)

  • The remainder will go to the marketing costs, promotion efforts, and fees after the book is launched.

*In addition, this book is part of The Noteworthy Family series, which includes a lullaby that I have already written and illustrated but is also waiting to be published.  If I exceed my goal, the additional funds will go towards printing this lullaby and other books in the series.  Plus, everyone will receive bonus "stretch goal" perks.

Stretch Goals:

It will take around 130 presales to fulfill the minimum requirement to produce this book, but if I sell more, then I will upgrade everyone's gift.

  • Upon reaching 200 presales, everyone will receive a hardcover instead of a softcover. 
  • Upon reaching 230 presales, everyone will also receive a digital copy of my second book when released. 
  • Upon reaching 280 presales, everyone will also receive a physical copy of my second book when released. 

The Impact:

One of my mentors once said, "If you go through something hard, then you should write a book about it." So, that’s exactly what I did!  My dad has struggled with anxiety and depression most of his life.  Consequently, I wrote this book for kids who may have a parent or loved one that suffers from similar disorders.  I have the book written, illustrated, formatted, and ready to go.  Now, all I need is your help to get it launched and into the hands of kids who need it!     

 

Risks & Challenges:

One of the biggest challenges with publishing a book is delivering the finished product to the backer, meaning the mailing of this book to you.  I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies within each pre-order tier.

The cost of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use.  I will be working closely with Above The Sun Media to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed copy to you.  We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone.  You will be notified via email as to when the pre-ordered copy of your book is expected to ship.

*Note:  Currently, we are only shipping in the United States.  We can hold your book for you until you visit again or send an e-mail to mjdittrich@gmail.com to discuss other options.    

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

Please share my Sometimes Blue Daddi-O pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends and family.  Please use the hashtag #sometimesbluedaddio and tag me so that we can get this book into the hands of the families who need it! You can tag me on Facebook or Instagram as Melissa Joy Dittrich.  You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of this page.

I am incredibly thankful for all of your love and support!


Your beloved author & illustrator, 


Melissa Joy Dittrich

You can tag me on Facebook or Instagram as Melissa Joy Dittrich.  You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of this page.
