Melissa Joy Dittrich

story:
Story of My Book

A Bump in the Road is about me and my family’s battle with a rare genetic cancer called Familial Adenomatous Polyposis. In my book I talk about what it took mentally and physically to overcome my illness, and the growth I achieved along the way. 


My name is Michael Caprio and I am the author of A Bump In The Road. I wrote this book because I feel it is important to share my story with the world so that others in similar circumstances don’t have to feel like they are alone. In reading this book, you will learn more about my rare condition and similar digestive diseases, as well as the importance of overcoming adversity. My hope is to share with you the mental tools that I have learned along the way which helped me overcome the obstacles within my life. I aim to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I now have for my health, both mentally and physically. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you overcome adversity, not just health issues. 

In this book, you'll learn about the ugliness of hitting rock bottom and dealing with depression. You will see ways to help you navigate depression with more balance, as well as find the importance of having good people around you, a positive attitude, and being patient with yourself. You'll hear stories such as:

  • My eleven days in the hospital after my first nine-hour operation, and my battle to deal with the raw emotions that came with my drastically different reality.
  • How my depression affected my loved ones, not just myself, and when I realized the exact moment where I had to pull it together so that I didn’t hurt my family.
  • How my positive attitude changed my moms life, and the lives of those around me.

A Bump in the Road pertains to anyone who is struggling to overcome a challenge and will appeal to those with health issues but can be applied to any life struggles. This book will be a welcome addition to anyone’s library who is interested in rare diseases, stories of overcoming adversity, and journey’s about the human condition. 

A Bump in the Road is a nonfiction book that speaks to people dealing with adversity and people who like comeback stories with perspective on mental health and perseverance.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April,2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. After I reach my publishing goals, 100% of my profits will be donated to the New Jersey Chapter of the Crohns and Colitis Foundation.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Michael Caprio is a senior communications/journalism Major at Ramapo College of New Jersey. He believes that maintaining a positive attitude and being patient can not only change your life circumstances but those around you as well. His passions are reading, writing, watching the Yankees and Giants, exercising and connecting with others. 

Michael Caprio wrote this book to bring awareness to his rare condition, and to also help others with the mental tools he learned from his experiences. His biggest passion is being able to connect with and help others. He hopes his book can bring awareness to his rare condition and conditions that are similar. His curiosity lies in just how many people he can help, hopefully producing a positive domino effect. 

When Michael isn’t reading or writing, he enjoys watching some of his favorite shows and movies such as Goodfellas and Breaking Bad. 

For more information, you can connect with Michael Caprio at mcaprio1@ramapo.edu and at mikecaprio_author on Instagram. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ABumpInTheRoad and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via IndieGoGo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Michael Caprio

I wrote this book because I feel it is important to share my story with the world so that others in similar circumstances don’t have to feel like they are alone. In reading this book, you will learn more about my rare condition and similar digestive diseases, as well as the importance of overcoming adversity. My hope is to share with you the mental tools that I have learned along the way which helped me overcome the obstacles within my life. I aim to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I now have for my health, both mentally and physically. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you overcome adversity, not just health issues. In this book, you'll learn about the ugliness of hitting rock bottom and dealing with depression. You will see ways to help you navigate depression with more balance, as well as find the importance of having good people around you, a positive attitude, and being patient with yourself. You'll hear stories such as:

My eleven days in the hospital after my first nine-hour operation, and my battle to deal with the raw emotions that came with my drastically different reality.
How my depression affected my loved ones, not just myself, and when I realized the exact moment where I had to pull it together so that I didn’t hurt my family.
How my positive attitude changed my moms life, and the lives of those around me.

A Bump in the Road pertains to anyone who is struggling to overcome a challenge and will appeal to those with health issues but can be applied to any life struggles. This book will be a welcome addition to anyone’s library who is interested in rare diseases, stories of overcoming adversity, and journey’s about the human condition. A Bump in the Road is a nonfiction book that speaks to people dealing with adversity and people who like comeback stories with perspective on mental health and perseverance.
What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April,2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. After I reach my publishing goals, 100% of my profits will be donated to the New Jersey Chapter of the Crohns and Colitis Foundation.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!
About the Author
Michael Caprio is a senior communications/journalism Major at Ramapo College of New Jersey. He believes that maintaining a positive attitude and being patient can not only change your life circumstances but those around you as well. His passions are reading, writing, watching the Yankees and Giants, exercising and connecting with others. Michael Caprio wrote this book to bring awareness to his rare condition, and to also help others with the mental tools he learned from his experiences. His biggest passion is being able to connect with and help others. He hopes his book can bring awareness to his rare condition and conditions that are similar. His curiosity lies in just how many people he can help, hopefully producing a positive domino effect. When Michael isn’t reading or writing, he enjoys watching some of his favorite shows and movies such as Goodfellas and Breaking Bad. For more information, you can connect with Michael Caprio at mcaprio1@ramapo.edu and at mikecaprio_author on Instagram. 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ABumpInTheRoad and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via IndieGoGo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Michael Caprio

story:
Short Summary

Living with 2020 Vision: The Mental Health Awakening in the Black Community is a book that highlights how the compounding traumatic events of 2020 ultimately sparked a mental health awakening in the Black community. 

My name is Tiara Johnson, and I am the author of Living with 2020 Vision: The Mental Health Awakening in the Black Community. I wrote this book because there is an obvious mental health crisis happening in the African American community. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, regardless of race, you will discover a more empathetic view toward mental health experiences in the Black community. In this book, I also hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for mental health awareness and education. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better empathize with the mental health experiences of the African American community and other minorities. 

In this book, you'll learn about various vulnerable and even traumatic experiences from brave members of the Black community and how it affected their mental health in 2020. You'll hear stories such as the following...

  • The “Black Male Trauma” chapter is a vulnerable story that rarely gets heard because of the stigmas attached to Black males feel about mental health. One man details his experience and trauma after witnessing the violence against George Floyd. 
  • The “Coping” chapter tells a feel-good story of college friends who met in the 80s and reconnect in 2020. Due to the isolation caused by the pandemic, they decided to reconnect through Zoom and ultimately were able to help one another cope with their personal mental health issues. Even though they were many miles away, Zoom allowed them to support each other through their struggles with mental health in 2020. 
  • The “Election Anxiety” chapter, details the pressure I felt as a Black woman living in Georgia during the 2020 elections. The Trump era, particularly in 2020, had a definite effect on the mental health of the Black community. I didn’t realize it in the moment, but I was dealing with election anxiety, which I described as nervousness and uncertainty about the outcome of the election. 

You will love this book if you are interested in the current mental health crisis, if you’re curious about the complex relationship between the Black community and mental health awareness, and if you’ve ever had to address any mental health issues. 

Living with 2020 Vision: The Mental Health Awakening in the Black Community is a nonfiction book that speaks to the Black community and mental health professionals who want to look at the mental health crisis and awareness in a new light and begin to take a realistic approach to finding a better path forward for all of us. When one part of our community struggles, we all struggle.

The Book - Living with 2020 Vision: The Mental Health Awakening in the Black Community
The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 2-3. In these sections, the reader will receive foundational knowledge about the history of trauma in the Black community and the science behind empathy. I want readers, regardless of race, to walk away with a more empathetic view of the Black community, so it is important to understand what empathy truly is and how it can be taught to others. 

Part 2 contains chapters 4-9. In this section, each chapter tells a different but unique experience of various African Americans in 2020. You will read about how COVID and virtual learning had an effect on Black public school teachers and students and about how racism in 2020 had an advance effect on the Black trans community. The five chapters within this section are set up so they can be read and learned from individually. 

Part 3 contains chapters 10-12. The last section is dedicated to providing the reader with expert insight about the various mental health themes discussed in the earlier chapters. It was important for me to interview experts within the the mental health space. I talked to Alison Malmon, CEO and Founder of Active Minds, 2021 American Psychological Association (APA) President, Dr. Jennifer Kelly, and Georgetown crisis communications professor, Matthew Charles, among other local experts. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Tiara Johnson is a graduate student at Georgetown University studying PR and Corporate Communications. Her love for constant learning has helped her find her new passion for crisis communications and mental health awareness. 

Tiara recently launched the mental health awareness organization Embrace MH LLC, where she hosts her own podcast and interacts with others through her blog. 

Tiara felt compelled to write this book because of her newfound passion for mental health awareness and advocacy in 2020. After experiencing her own struggles with mental health and watching others close to her experience similar feelings, she knew this book would help serve a bigger purpose in the mental health industry. Ultimately, she hopes to bring more awareness to the mental health crisis in the minority community through empathetic storytelling. 

When Tiara isn’t writing or studying, she has time to enjoy her real true love.... Netflix. She is a TV and film enthusiast and an expert in choosing the best shows and films at any given time. 

For more information, you can connect with Tiara at embracemh.llc@gmail.comand at @trulywritten_ on Instagram. 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Livingwith2020Visionand tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tiara Johnson

story:
Who is David and what is Cooking with Magic: the Psilocybin Cookbook?

David Connell is a United States Air Force Veteran, writer, cook, and psychedelic medicine advocate living in the US. Raised in the rural West Virginia Appalachian region, he now lives in Knoxville TN with his wonderful partner, and their dog Athena. Six months ago while Dave and Branden were at an event with friends and his now publisher Douglas McDaniel of Storyhaus media, Dave was inspired to work on this book, Cooking with Magic: The Psilocybin Cookbook. The book is a comprehensive recipe and how-to guide for cooking with and preparing food and drink using psilocybin mushrooms.

David's main inspiration for this book was and is Psilocybin's positive impact in his life, and how adopting this powerful fungal ally into his weekly routine may have literally saved Dave's life. When he separated from the US Air Force in late 2016 David entered a civilian world that he was not prepared for. Plagued by depression, anxiety, and PTSD, David found himself on a series of anti-depressant and anti-anxiety medications that did him little good.  So he began to look for alternatives.

This is where Branden comes into this mushroom-filled picture. Branden introduced Dave to psilocybin for the first time, and after a few months of supervised theraputic use, and frequent guided trips Dave found himself in an entirely different and significantly healthier mental state. Now the pair spend their days concocting new and interesting ways to incorporate magic mushroom into their diet.

So what's this book all about?  

As all mushroom fans know, eating little fun-guys, as Dave and his partner Branden and I like to call them, can be a trying experience. As much as we love and appreciate them, neither of them enjoys the sensation of chewing on dried out, fibrous fungi stalks.  Our experiences learning to integrate small, measured quantities of shrooms into food and drink inspired us to collaborate in our kitchen on this definitive guide to cooking with psilocybin contaiing mushrooms. 

They hope that this book helps you experience your fun-guys in new, healthful and meaningful ways. With that in mind, they have decided to make all the recipes as health-conscious as possible—while still being delicious and a little indulgent from time to time. You’ll find that everything here has no added sugars and is lactose-free; we have also included gluten-free substitutions throughout.  Happy cooking, and many best wishes as you embark on your journey with food and fungi!

What's up with cooking with Magic Mushrooms?

The main way Dave explores and uses Magic Mushrooms is through food. He believes that by connecting psilocybin usage to cooking, we deepen the spiritual and emotional aspects of using this potent psychedelic. This is backed up by history itself. For at least as long as we have had fire, man has consumed Magic Mushrooms in various forms, whether it was Dionysian wines, brewed teas, or other ways lost to the ages.

It makes sense that we should take the act of feeding yourself, your friends, and your family, something that for thousands of years was not only an act of necessity, but of love and sharing with your community, and bind our use of psychedelics to the purely human ritual of cooking and sharing food. In fact, Branden and Dave have grown quite fond of adapting their daily microdosing routine into the creation of pies, main dishes, drinks, and more. I have selected a handful of these recipes to share with the hope that it will inspire others to do the same.

Why launch a crowdfund for the book?

To put it simply, getting a book published is expensive, especially one with as many illustrations, and with as much color as this particular tome. So Dave is asking for your help. If you're interested in learning more about magic mushrooms, and how to prepare them in various dishes, drinks, concoctions, and cocktails then this is the book for you. By pre-ordering here you are helping dave and his team at Storyhaus Media get the book finished and sent to the printer for a worldwide release. 

By contributing to this campaign you are not just securing yourself a copy of the book, you're ensuring the success of s small indie Publishing company, and you're helping Dave get the word out that psilocybin is a powerful, natural medicine that should be readily available for research into its vast medical capabilities.  You also get some neat and delicious recipes of course. As well as a helpful section covering ten common types of psychedelic mushrooms, and this guide to deadly mushrooms you should always avoid. 

What's our goal, and what do you receive?

Our goal is simple, we are trying to raise $6000.00 to cover the cost of finishing layout and design, printing, and ordering the first batch of copies.  If we can hit our goal then we will be able to get our book to print by the first week of December 2019. 

So what do you get in return? Well, first and foremost you have Dave's sincere thanks and appreciation for your help. Second, you can select a variety of things from an E-Book, the physical copy of the book at over 30% retail, and posters or prints of original art in the book. With over 18 illustrations, some of which is Alice in Wonderland themed chapter art and some mushroom phylogeny, you will be guaranteed to get something you'll love.  

What are the risks?

There's always the chance that any sort of crowdfunding campaign will fail. Even if it does we will get this book published. If that means Dave takes out a small loan or goes print on demand we guarantee you will get your copy of Cooking with Magic: The Psilocybin Cookbook. 

Other ways to help?

We get it, not everyone who's interested is in the financial situation to make a contribution. There are plenty of other ways to help out, share this campaign page on your social media, with your friends, family, and fellow psychonauts. Posting about it on Facebook, Reddit or Instagram makes a huge impact.

Visit your local bookstore!

Another great way to help us out is by visiting your local book store, and requesting that they carry the book. If as little as three people request our book in the same store they will start to carry it. Not only does this help us out with retail orders but it also spreads awareness of this book and potentially other psilocybin and psychedelic publications. 

Shoutout to the Reddit Community!

Dave and Branden would like to thank the amazing people on Reddit who were among the first backers of his book. Without them, and communities like r/shrooms this fundraiser would have never happened!

So, with your support for this campaign, I hope to present to you, my friends and fellow life wanderers with:

Author David Connell 
Cooking with Magic: The Psilocybin Cookbook

All funds raised from this campaign will go toward the design, layout, production, and marketing of our cookbook. 

Update: Poster Art is Online!

Below are the finalized images we have selected for the posters. Please note the Harm Reduction Dodo is also available but has not been finalized.

Without them, and communities like r/shrooms this fundraiser would have never happened!So, with your support for this campaign, I hope to present to you, my friends and fellow life wanderers with:Author David Connell Cooking with Magic: The Psilocybin CookbookAll funds raised from this campaign will go toward the design, layout, production, and marketing of our cookbook. Update: Poster Art is Online!Below are the finalized images we have selected for the posters. Please note the Harm Reduction Dodo is also available but has not been finalized.

story:
Me:  BrunetteBabe 2016  Single female interested in finding

a good guy with small town values in a big city!

You:  A contributor to help fund this book and inspire women all over the nation! 

(Sound familiar?) Yes, that's me Antonia Kasper (aka Rachel Yardley --the main character of the book) met 50 men in 3 months through the internet over a cup of coffee! 

I came to New York to pursue theatre but my priorities changed when I hit 38.  Suddenly, I wanted a husband and if it wasn't too late...a baby!  My biological clock was exploding but even more importantly, I wanted to find a life-time companion and "live happily ever after!"  Was there such a thing?

This book isn't just a funny book about all my "bad dates" but is a tribute to help inspire women by overcoming their own obstacles in order to find a healthy, loving, and committed relationship!


          

What we need:  $7,200 Total

  • $2,000 for an amazing editor 
  • $1,000 for professional photography and layout
  • $500 for artwork 
  • $500 for logo design
  • $1,200 for manufacturing and printing of books (including ISBN and the first 150 books) and website
  • $2,000 for publicist to help sell 45CoffeeDates and setup book release party and signings  

 

Percolating PERKS

What you get!

  • Magnet with Inspiring Fun Quotes from the book!
  • Signed Copy of the Book- 45 Coffee Dates!
  • Starbucks Gift Card ($5-$30)
  • Custom Coffee Cup (with inspiring quotes from the book)!
  • Private Consultation (1 hour consultation w/ Antonia over the phone or in person to help you overhaul your online profile to attract more potential mates)
  • A Special Secret Perk  (for a select few that donate quickly and generously)
  • A 90 minute workshop event "The Rachel Yardley Dating Smart Series" (for a group of 5-15) hosted by Kasper.  The most popular workshop is "The ABC's of Internet Dating!"   Kasper helps singles (men & women) with better pictures, profiles, and essays in her informative and entertaining workshops! Includes signed copies of her book! (Location not provided.  Must be in the NYC region)
  • A 2 hour workshop event "The Rachel Yardley Dating Smart Series" (for a group of 20-50) hosted by Kasper.  Choice of any of her popular workshops. (Location not provided.  Must be in the NYC region) Kasper helps singles (men & women) with better pictures, profiles, and essays in her informative and entertaining workshops! Includes (20-50) signed copies of her book! 
  • A 3 hour (or less) workshop event "The Rachel Yardley Dating Smart Series" (for a group of 50 or more)  hosted by Kasper.  Choice of any of her popular workshops. (Location not provided campaign.  Must be in the NYC region or airfare/housing provided ) Kasper helps singles (men & women) with better pictures, profiles, and essays in her informative and entertaining workshops! Includes (50) signed copies of her book! 

The Impact you will make:

Did you know that the total number of single people in the U.S. is  54,250,000 (that's about 55 million people)

And the total number of people in the U.S. who have tried online dating is approximately 49,250,000 (that's about 50 million) 

In other words, either you or someone you know has online dated. 

This book also explores various subtopics:  such as co-dependency/ positive thinking and creative visualization/body image/and the daughter-father relationship

The Subtopic of Daughter and Father Relationships

Ever wonder why single women or women in unfulfilling and even abusive relationships usually have abandonment or abusive issues with their father or male role model? 

Studies have shown that well-fathered daughters are more likely to have relationships with men that are emotionally intimate and fulfilling whereas daughters of inadequate fathers tend to attract men like their fathers---unavailable or verbally/emotionally and sometimes even physically abusive.  Not only do fathers have great impact on their daughters’ relationships with men, but they generally have more impact than mothers do. Research also shows that dads may shape their daughters’ mental health and relationships in adulthood.

Risks & Challenges:

There are always risks and challenges in any project.  However, I do have the experience to follow through.  It took Kasper three years to write this book in (you guessed it) a Starbucks.  She spent one year developing the One Woman Show based on the book (only after she read excerpts from the book and people constantly urged her to develop her book into a show)---but she needs to get the book out already!  She is determined as ever!

What if we don't raise the goal amount?---The money we do raise will be used to get the ball rolling!  The hardest part is over.  Completion of the book.  Right now, its 115,000 words and Kasper really needs a good editor to chop it down to about 95,000 words.  So, the first step is the editing.  If anything that's where we will start.  However,  obtaining great photos/logo/artwork and manufacturing is our goal.  A publicist is last on our agenda but is viable to help sell the book and get the word out!   

Kasper is fully committed to having book in hand and for people to purchase by the 12/2017 possibly sooner!  She will be sure to keep you posted on the progress along the way!  

If you can't contribute at this time, you can still help!

Please share this important funding campaign :

On your Facebook Page.

Tweet about us!

Or email a friend about us! 

USE OUR INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION!

story:
Story of My Book

Notice & Wonder is a non-fiction book that explores the intersection of feedback and resilience. It provides insights into the layers and characteristics of effective feedback spaces and conversations in order to connect intention with impact and action. 

My name is Mark Joy and I am the author of Notice & Wonder. I wrote this book because when I was growing up, I often found myself in situations where I needed to give or receive feedback but I never learned how to do so effectively. Over the years, I've gathered useful tools and tactics from hands on experience and I now want to share and name what I’ve found to be aspects that support effective feedback conversations.

We all know feedback is important for growth and improvement. However, we’ve all been in situations where we felt overwhelmed by needing to give it, or experienced the uncomfortable pit in your stomach when receiving it. Notice & Wonder is rooted in a resilient-based approach to engaging feedback.

Resilient-based feedback is:

  • Expansive in approach and thinking
  • Persistent in conversation and communication
  • Inclusive by design which ensures a sense of belonging
  • Compassionate in how listening happens


My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a new perspective and angle on how to navigate moments of giving or receiving feedback. In this book, I hope to share with you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for meaningful and effective communication. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you explore the ripple effects of feedback.

In this book, you'll learn about resilient-based feedback, a framework for collaboration and community that stretches boundaries of creative possibility and strengthens the ability to adapt when giving or receiving input. It’s crucial to design with this framework in mind to ensure feedback spaces are rooted in expansive thinking, persistent conversation, inclusion and awareness, and compassionate listening.

You'll hear stories such as...

  • How an expert in child-friendly cities engages and empowers children in the designing of public spaces.
  • How an executive coaching thought leader intentionally creates contexts based on shared understanding of definitions and expectations.
  • How a mentor of mine infuses accountability and awareness in feedback spaces, and connects intention with impact.


You will love this book if you want to explore the neurological and psychological reactions associated with engaging feedback, to build awareness and capacity to expand your boundaries in these moments, and to gain insight into how resilient-based feedback gets its power from community and collaboration.

Notice & Wonder is a nonfiction book that speaks to early career professionals and educators who want to look at building up their feedback muscles and exploring what makes for effective input, in a new way.
 

The Book - Notice & Wonder

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. Part 1 explores why feedback often times is ineffective, how my experience with workplace bullying connects to feedback, and how taking a resilient-based approach to feedback can deepen the impact of it. Readers will learn about feedback’s history, barriers, and a framework to overcome these barriers.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-7. Part 2 explores the layers and characteristics of what go into meaningful and actionable input. Readers will gain insight into the resilient-based framework, and how the framework characteristics fit together and compliment one another.

Part 3 contains chapters 8-9. Part 3 focuses on how to apply resilient-based practices. Students/early career professionals will learn how to build up their feedback muscles, and educators/managers will learn how to ensure alignment between feedback intention and impact.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
     

Campaign Goal

Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover (paperback) editions get published (this is the minimum needed)

 

About the Author

Mark Joy is a Senior Research & Programs Associate for the Red House at Georgetown University. The Red House is a discovery and design unit at Georgetown that focuses on the connection between equity and innovation in education.

When Mark was growing up, he often found himself in situations where he needed to give or receive feedback but he never learned how to do so effectively. Over the years, he’s gathered useful tools and tactics from hands on experience and he now wants to share and name what he’s found to be aspects that support effective feedback conversations.

Outside of writing, Mark loves to spend time with his partner, Emma, play basketball, and hike with their cat, Winnie.

For more information, you can connect with Mark Joy at mark.joy15@gmail.com and on LinkedIn or Instagram.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help

  • Please use #NoticeandWonder and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Tag: 
Instragram - @markjoy_author / @newdegreepress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

- Mark Joy

story:
Short Summary

Be the DJ of Your Career is a book that walks the reader through a series of interview-style conversations with random people about what they are doing to manage their careers. The reference to DJs is my fascination and belief that they, for the most part, seem to live, breathe, sleep, and re-awaken with relentless ingenuity, grit, and resourcefulness in a way that grows and compounds success in their career, and this book touches upon that during the myriad of random conversations.

My name is Rodney Jenkins and I am the author of Be the DJ of Your Career. I wrote this book because I have been inspired by the amazing, creative, positive, and resourceful wizardry of DJs and other people that I have interviewed to manage their careers successfully while being true to their values. As a volunteer career coach for many years, I feel that there is a great need for more inspiring and creative stories to awaken the “working“ reader to the reality that they have more power than they realize to transform, energize, and move their career forward or move it into a new direction.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you control the music, you have the ability to influence others (DJ's would say move the crowd), and you have the power to move your career in new directions. It is the creative, resourceful, gritty, “out of box” thinker, aka “the inner DJ”, that needs to take residence in your mind and soul to help you reach deeper into yourself to guide you on taking the right steps to manage your career. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to be a fly on the wall so that you can witness purpose-driven conversations about managing careers with many fascinating people, escape the mundane of what you know, and let’s learn something from a few DJs and other engaging personalities that you will be able to learn alongside as you read the book to gain important career advice.
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor that I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a e-book and softcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BetheDJofYourCareer and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

        Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
And more...


 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BetheDJofYourCareer and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

        Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

story:
Story of My Book

Journey of an Expat focuses on the trials and triumphs of living abroad. It takes you through the adventures and misadventures of life as a foreigner and helps you truly understand what it means to be a global citizen in today’s world. 

My name is Daisy Bugarin and I am the author of Journey of an Expat. I wrote this book because I found that the struggles I faced living abroad were not unique to me. The more people I connected with, the more common I realized these problems were and the more I wondered why no one ever talks about them. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it means to be a well-rounded member of the global community. Through this guide, I wish to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for cross-cultural exploration and understanding. Ultimately, I hope that you will learn from us—the people who have lived abroad for years or even decades. We want you to learn from our experiences so that you don’t end up making the same mistakes.

In this book, you'll learn about the insider mindset and how to connect to your new community in a meaningful way. You'll hear stories such as...
  • Connecting with a veteran from the Japanese Imperial Army. 
  • Raising third-culture kids in the horn of Africa
  • Discovering life off of autopilot in Chinese Venice. 

 

You will love this book if you are:

  • Anyone who wants to become an overseas professional
  • A student who wants to study abroad
  • A person who wants to one day move far away from home (even if it’s in the same state, but in a place that feels completely foreign to you). 

Journey of an Expat is a nonfiction book that speaks to overseas professionals and expat-hopefuls who want to understand how to connect to their new community in a meaningful way and make the most of their time abroad. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring. 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Daisy Bugarin is the daughter of Mexican immigrants, a first-generation high school graduate from the Illinois Math and Science Academy, and a first-gen college student at New York University’s Shanghai campus. 

From a young age, Bugarin has always fostered a passion for learning, and a genuine fascination with the world that was never satisfied in her hometown. After moving to China for university, she discovered life as a foreigner was both wonderful and grueling; she hopes to teach the next generation of global citizens the valuable lessons she learned the hard way. 

When she is not writing, Bugarin loves to play with her Senegal Parrot, Joan, and watch cute animal videos on Facebook. Joan enjoys sitting attentively on the kitchen counter and watching Bugarin attempt to bake cookies. 

For more information, you can connect with Daisy Bugarin at daisybugarin98@gmail.com and at @daisy_bugarin (Twitter).
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ExpatJourney and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
  • Thank you so much for all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Daisy Bugarin

story:
UPDATE FOR OUR PLEDGERS! The Indiegogo campaign has now ended, BUT you can still pledge and pre-order a copy of Tom's book via our website. For those of you who have already given THANK YOU SO MUCH we still get to keep what we have raised on Indiegogo, and in the next few months will continue to search for the final funding - our new target is to make $20,000 and print 1000 copies of the book. In the meantime, all of your money will be saved in the book’s dedicated bank account until we go on press in the summer.
Please encourage people who might like to support Tom's book to visit our website, as every pledge still counts!



“What do I want from this life? What makes you happy is not enough. All the things that satisfy our instincts only satisfy the animal in us. I want to be proud of myself. I want more. I want to look up to myself and when I die, I want to smile because of the things I have done, not cry for the things I haven’t done.”
Tom Hurndall

“A brave man who stood alone. If only the world had listened to him... I wish I had met him because – looking back over the history of that terrible war – Hurndall’s journals (soon to be published) show a remarkable man of remarkable principle.”
Robert Fisk

TOM HURNDALL'S STORY

Tom Hurndall, a young British photojournalist and peace worker, was shot in the head in Gaza in April 2003 whilst carrying a small group of stranded Palestinian children to safety. He died nine months later in a London hospital. This book follows his journals and begins on 15th February 2003 in London, where the huge demonstration by millions in the run up to the Iraq war had given 21-year-old Tom an increased curiosity and desire to journey to the Middle East. Soon afterwards, initially as an observer alongside the Human Shields, he left with a passion to make a difference, to record and photograph the truth for himself.

 

We follow his journey first from Baghdad, then to Amman and the Al-Rweished refugee camp in Jordan, to Jerusalem, and finally on to the town of Rafah in southern Gaza close to the Egyptian border, where US peaceworker Rachel Corrie had been killed just weeks previously. On April 11th, unarmed and wearing an internationally recognizable orange peacekeeper jacket, he was severely wounded, never to regain consciousness.

 

The book we are publishing follows Tom’s life and thoughts in the final weeks leading up to the shooting, through his photographs and extracts from his diary, emails and poems. It is realised through collaboration with the Hurndall family, and the Publication Date of the book will be April 2011, to coincide with the eighth anniversary of the shooting.  Tom’s story has touched many, and the important publication of his journals also follows the BAFTA-nominated 2008 Channel 4 film-documentary ‘The Shooting of Thomas Hurndall’. His work has also been published in the international press including the Guardian, The Independent and the Times.

 

The esteemed writer on the Middle East Robert Fisk has already written the preface to the book, which was published in The Independent newspaper in 2009. Read HERE



WHAT WE NEED...

We are looking for $34,000 (£21,660, €25,500) to cover the cost of printing 3,000 copies of the book ‘The Middle East Journals of Tom Hurndall’, which we will then distribute internationally. As a small independent publisher of photography and photojournalism titles, Trolley Books often struggle to fund production due to the high cost of printing, and because many of the books are not commercially viable enough to support themselves. Trolley has decided for the first time to launch a crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo, as we really believe that Tom's book will appeal to all those interested in not just Tom's personal and tragic story, but in photography, photojournalism, politics & poetry, and hopefully some of you who know our books and want to support the work of Trolley too.


...& WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN

We are extremely thankful to everyone who pledges towards making this book happen, and to show our appreciation we would like to offer some fantastic rewards!

We are hoping that many of you will pledge at least $35 (£22.50, €26) as this is effectively pre-ordering a copy of the book, and you will be the very first to receive a copy of the book when it is printed.  We are also offering pdf copies of the book, printed credits in the book itself, the Limited Edition of 1-50 with a print, a selection of classic books from Trolley's catalogue, exclusive invitations to the book launch and other special events relating to the book, as well as unique opportunities to join us during production, from the design process and learning about how books are put together with us in London, to going on press to see the book printed at our printers near Venice, Italy.

We hope as many people as possible will find want to become part of making Tom’s journals a reality.


WHAT WE HAVE DONE SO FAR

On Friday 26th November 2010, the day before what would have been Tom’s 29th birthday, we organised a panel talk at the Arab British Chamber of Commerce in London, to discuss Tom's work and the importance of publishing his book.

The panel included:

• Jocelyn Hurndall – Tom’s mother
• John Sweeney (chair) - BBC Panorama journalist of 2003 documentary ‘When Killing is Easy’ and The Independent article Silenced Witnesses
• Anthony Hurndall – Tom’s father
• Mohammed Qeshta - who was with Tom when we was shot and worked for the International Solidarity Movement in Gaza
• Rowan Joffe and Simon Block - Director and Screenwriter of Channel 4 BAFTA-nominated film documentary The Shooting of Thomas Hurndall

• Gigi Giannuzzi - publisher and founder of Trolley Books
Below are some extracts from the talk, you can watch the unedited version of the talk on our blog here, 

 

Tom had this eye, this way of looking at things, this way of understanding things and he set out to observe, to look at something - but to understand it in a truthful way....Tom was an unusual person and he was a risk taker and I think we learn so much from risk takers.

I’ve learnt so much through looking through Tom’s eyes, and I hope other people who aren’t so familiar with the situation in the Middle East will try to look through Tom’s eyes.

Jocelyn Hurndall

 

Tom started on this journey to be a photojournalist, and he was really excited about it. Photography and journalism, going out there and recording and bringing back the story was something that he thought was going to be his future.....The way he reacted was not just as a photojournalist but as a human being. The very fact that his last moment of consciousness was as a human being responding to the needs of a child in desperate danger is so telling, and so much at the heart of Tom and at the heart of this book.

Anthony Hurndall


As filmmakers, what’s uniquely inspiring to me about books of this ilk is that they are real people, in real moments, and significant moments, moments of suffering, or moments of injustice, moments that are crying out to be recorded.....Some of the greatest photographers in the world have been war photographers and photojournalists and I think Tom probably set out in some way to follow in those footsteps and it’s something which is honoured in the book. And I think that what’s unique about this is you’re not just buying a book you’re kind of investing in the continuation of photoreportage, and I think that’s a fantastically important thing to do.

Rowan Joffe

 

This is an almost rare pearl in terms of how integrated the photography is with the work done with text. We met with the parents of Tom 3 or 4 years ago, and we’ve been working on this for a long time. Unfortunately effectively what happens is that as you can imagine these are not best-sellers, and they are the most difficult niche of books to produce and make it happen in terms of cost; printing in four colours its not just a book of text in one colour. But when I came across this material and Tom’s story I felt really obliged to get in touch and do my best.

Gigi Giannuzzi

THE BOOK:

ISBN: 978-1-904563-51-8
Photography / Current Affairs
Hardback, 196 pp
190 x 260 mm, 7.48 x 10.24 in.
100 colour and b/w
Design: Fruitmachine
£24.99 / $40 / €29.95
Publication Date April 2011

Here is a dummy of the book so far (designed by our designers Martin and Wai at Fruitmachine). Nothing is final, it's just to give you an idea...
 


WHO ARE TROLLEY BOOKS?

Trolley Books have worked with some of the most respected photojournalists in the world, often focusing on underexposed issues and abuses of power around the world, from conflicts to unique stories in photojournalism. Most notably Trolley has published books by Philip Jones Griffiths, famous for his work in Viet Nam and on Agent Orange in particular, and other Magnum photographers Alex Majoli, Paolo Pellegrin, Thomas Dworzak, Carl de Keyzer, as well as Stanley Greene, Tom Stoddart, and Nina Berman and others. In 2005 Trolley Books received a special commendation from the Kraszna-Krausz Book Awards for its outstanding contribution to photography book publishing. This year Alixandra Fazzina, the author of Trolley's most recent publication 'A Million Shillings - Escape from Somalia', was awarded the UNHCR Nansen Award, the highest accolade they award for work with refugees and the first time it has ever been given to a journalist or photographer.

 

FINANCES

The campaign will receive pledges in US dollars but Indiegogo is a completely international platform so that people from anywhere around the world can campaign and pledge, you do not need to have a US bank account. All pledges will then be converted into British Pounds in our Paypal account. Trolley has set up a dedicated UK bank account specifically for this campaign, which will receive all the pledges made on this page securely via Paypal, so you know that every single penny and dollar will be put towards making this book happen.

 

Thank for your support so far, with your help we can completely raise the $34,000 needed to cover the cost of printing 3000 copies of the book. If we don’t reach this target then the book will not be able to go into these next stages of production, so please pledge all you can, but if we do not reach our target we will aim to print less copies and keep looking for funds to print the book. For example

2000 copies can be printed with $27,840
1000 copies can be printed with $22,170


However the less copies that are made the more expensive per book it becomes, as well as significantly reducing the number of copies that can enter worldwide distribution. 3000 copies is our target! Should we raise more than this, as well as any small profit made from the book sales once it is in the shops, we will donate the money to the Trolley Charitable Trust, our charity which supports long-term photojournalistic projects and helps the development of photographers such as Tom.

 

We have some fantastic pledges for everyone, so please watch out for more updates for the campaign, and please start pledging and see the rewards involved in becoming part of this important book.


Many thanks!


Gigi Giannuzzi, Publisher and Founder

& Hannah Watson, Managing Editor

and everyone at Trolley Books


WWW.TROLLEYBOOKS.COM


FOLLOW US ON FACEBOOK

TROLLEY BOOKS

THE MIDDLE EAST JOURNALS OF TOM HURNDALL


AND TWITTER

 

Testimonials from the International Press for Trolley Books:

 

“Trolley consistently marry profound content to elevated, respectful design, producing photography books that are elegant, educational, and most of all, important.”

PhotoEye magazine

 

 “Trolley’s output is impressive…[they] have us look at things we’d normally avert our gaze from.”

James Collard, The Times magazine

 

“Trolley’s instinctive, enthusiastic approach to publishing should be applauded”

Design Week

worked with some of the most respected photojournalists in the world, often
focusing on underexposed issues and abuses of power around the world, from
conflicts to unique stories in photojournalism. Most notably Trolley has published books by Philip Jones Griffiths, famous for his work in Viet Nam and on Agent Orange in particular, and other
Magnum photographers Alex
Majoli, Paolo Pellegrin, Thomas Dworzak, Carl de Keyzer, as well as Stanley Greene, Tom Stoddart, and Nina Berman and others. In 2005
Trolley Books received a special commendation from the Kraszna-Krausz Book
Awards for its outstanding contribution to photography book publishing. This
year Alixandra Fazzina, the author of Trolley's most recent publication 'A
Million Shillings - Escape from Somalia', was awarded the UNHCR Nansen Award,
the highest accolade they award for work with refugees and the first time it
has ever been given to a journalist or photographer.

 
FINANCES
The campaign will
receive pledges in US dollars but Indiegogo is a completely international platform
so that people from anywhere around the world can campaign and pledge, you do not need to have a US bank account. All pledges will then be converted into British Pounds in our Paypal account. Trolley
has set up a dedicated UK bank account specifically for this campaign, which
will receive all the pledges made on this page securely via Paypal, so you know that every single
penny and dollar will be put towards making this book happen.
 
Thank for your
support so far, with your help we can completely raise the $34,000 
 needed to
cover the cost of printing 3000 copies of the book. If we don’t reach this
target then the book will not be able to go into these next stages of
production, so please pledge all you can, but if we do not reach our target we will aim to print less copies and keep looking for funds to print the book. For example 2000 copies can be printed with $27,840 1000 copies can be printed with $22,170However the less copies that are made the more expensive per book it becomes, as well as significantly reducing the number of copies that can enter worldwide distribution. 3000 copies is our target! Should we raise more than this, as well as any small profit made from the book sales once it is in the shops, we will donate the money to the Trolley Charitable Trust, our charity which supports long-term photojournalistic projects and helps the development of photographers such as Tom.
 
We have some fantastic
pledges for everyone, so please watch out for more updates for the campaign, and please start pledging and see the rewards
involved in becoming part of this important book.
Many thanks!Gigi Giannuzzi, Publisher and Founder& Hannah Watson, Managing Editorand everyone at Trolley BooksWWW.TROLLEYBOOKS.COMFOLLOW US ON FACEBOOK TROLLEY BOOKSTHE MIDDLE EAST JOURNALS OF TOM HURNDALLAND TWITTER
 
Testimonials
from the International Press for Trolley Books:
 
“Trolley
consistently marry profound content to elevated, respectful design, producing
photography books that are elegant, educational, and most of all, important.”
PhotoEye
magazine
 
 “Trolley’s output is impressive…[they]
have us look at things we’d normally avert our gaze from.”
James
Collard, The Times magazine
 
“Trolley’s
instinctive, enthusiastic approach to publishing should be applauded”
Design
Week

story:
Short Summary

Hi! 

I'm Jennifer Young, Andy's step-daughter, (Jacci's oldest). I have been driving myself crazy trying to think of some way to help my mom and Andy out while they are going through this very hard time, emotionally, mentally, physically, and financially. That's when I stumbled across this website and thought to myself, "HEY! Maybe this will be my answer! I'll give it a try!"

For those of you that aren't familiar with my mom and Andy's predicament here is an overview:

Andy had a massive heart attack at my mom's side of the family family reunion at a State Park outside of Atlanta in a cabin in the woods. Needless to say they hardly had any phone reception and had an awful time tring to explain to the 911 dispatcher exactly where they were. They dispatched a helicopter to get him to the ER faster but at the time Andy weighed too much to fly. When they finally got to the ER he was already dead but the AMAZING ER staff at Emory managed to bring him back to us. Once they had his heart pumping again he was in a coma for 16 days and Doctor's didn't expect him to live through the night.. About a month later he came home and was doing better. This was 4 years ago. 

Since then he has had several problems, including a few more heart attacks and a few strokes. Just recently they put him on the waiting list for a heart after a 4 year wait. Two months ago they put a LVAD in to pump his heart for him. Last week, he had a few small strokes so the Doctor's decided yesterday (9/5/13) to bump him up to the top of the list for a heart. 

Seeing how they live in Savannah and have to travel to Atlanta often; their funds are pretty much exasperated since my mom obviously can't work a steady job because she has be with him and they only get so much a month from his Military retirement. 

What We Need 

  • My goal is set at $2500. But ANY amount will help! 
  • Gas to get back and forth
  • Bills for their house here in Savannah (power, rent, water, etc.)
  • Cell phone bill
  • Food
  • Housing while they are in Atlanta, etc. 

The Impact

Any amount will take some of the weight off of their shoulders as they already have enough to worry about!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, there are still ways to help out:

  • Ask folks to get the word out about this campaign.
  • Share Indiegogo on your Facebook and Twitter!!!

Thank you all so very much for your time, cooperation, and support! 


-Jennifer Young

story:
Why write this book?

I have spent the last 35 years of my life working for peace between the State of Israel and its neighbors.  This has been a work of passion, a calling, a sense of duty.  I have done it with all of the frustrations and disappointments always with a continued sense of opportunity and possibility, even during the darkest times of violence and rage. I have been called an inspirational optimist, an accusation that I accept wholeheartedly. I often respond, quoting a great man, the late Dr. Yehuda Paz, that it is a genetic defect, I simply cannot help it. It’s in my DNA. But in reality it goes beyond that. We choose how to live our lives.  We make choices every day. I have chosen to see the positive, the hopeful, the opportunities, and the chances that greet me on my path of life.

It is often said that a pessimist is an optimist with experience.  I prefer to say that an optimist is a realist with compelling demands in a reality that requires a positive outlook.  Every morning I wake up with a renewed belief that peace is possible. Hard to imagine, but I honestly believe that Israel can make peace with her neighbors. I know it is possible. I know that the Israeli-Palestinian conflict is resolvable.  I also know that I can help the Israelis and the Palestinians to make peace.

Never accept no for an answer! It is never too early to work for peace.  These are two mottos that have accompanied me throughout my life long journey on the road to peace. From my childhood through my adult life, I have been actively seeking peace. My life has been dedicated to working for peace.   This is the story I want to tell.

This is the planned contents:

Contents

Why write this book?

Working for the Israeli Government

Inventing IPCRI

Becoming a security threat

How do I get off this list?

The Magical Kingdom

From security list to advisor to the Prime Minister

The Israeli army drafts me

A Day in the Life of an Israeli Peace Activist

Bringing security to the table

The Issue of settlements and security

Some interesting letters

Education for Peace

What Triggered the Al-Aqsa Intifada?

Dilemmas of a Peacemaker

My Views on Arafat

Near Death Experiences - Taking risks and living through them

The Oslo Peace Process – Lessons Learned or lessons that should have been learned.

Peace Efforts – Presenting new ideas to save the peace process and to save lives

Personalities

Peace Proposals, Peace Ideas

Basic Guidelines

Freeing prisoners

I need your support so that I can spend time writing this book.

Thank you in advance

Gershon

story:
After entering into preliminary discussions with a publisher to bring to market our second book on innovation, we thought … no. That model is 200 years old. Today’s creative, fast-moving business world is built on customized service and direct relationships. We decided to apply innovation not only to the content of our new book, but also to the way in which we distribute it. When you call your book Cause a Disturbance, you have to do things differently.  

So we are crowd-funding the book into being, along with its related products, keynotes and workshops. You can buy the book, or multiple books, workshops, or one-on-one interactions with the authors. You can determine how close you want to get to Cause a Disturbance – all at low, pre-publication prices! 

Make no mistake: Cause a Disturbance is more than a book, or even a keynote or workshop. It’s a way of seeing the world, a formula for low-cost, continuous innovation that will change the way you work and transform your organization into a market leader. 

The theme of Cause a Disturbance is straightforward and empowering: Anyone can be an innovator! If you can slice melon or make a right-hand turn, you can learn to create new, breakthrough products and services that will upend your market and help make your organization an industry leader. It's a simple, empowering message that has been inspiring business audiences – from solopreneurs to Fortune 500 executives – since 2010. 

So, which innovation model would you like your team to subscribe to? A commodity publishing model created for Victorian England? Or one that harnesses the power of crowd-sourcing, the most disruptive new tool in business today, to create more personalized experiences and more memorable impacts?

Remember – some quantities will be limited. When they’re gone, they’re gone!  

 

Thinking innovation?  Think Cause a Disturbance.

story:
What We Need

Funds for our first year operating budget to include:

  • Payment for authors and artists plus two small staff salaries.
  • Web and hosting fees, nominal marketing budget.
  • To produce 4 issues in 2014, we'll need $2500.

When we started The Midnight Diner, options to publish this sort of story were few and very, very far between. We filled a gap by publishing unsanitized stories of faith with a genre bent. This kind of publication is still necessary and you'll be a game-changer by coming alongside of our vision.

 

What You Get

We are excited to partner with you! Our various levels of incentives include:

  • FREE Digital Back Issues of the Diner!
  • Yearly Digital Subscriptions to the NEW Diner!
  • Become a Character in our Year One Serial Novella!
  • Edit/Critique of Your Own Written Work by our Editors!

 

The Impact

  • Christians need a publishing outlet like The Diner. We have a history of publishing the cream of the crop and our authors and interns have gone on to publishing contracts and jobs at New York publishers!
  • We might be small, but we know how to make an impact!
  • We're authentic. What you see is what you get. Our stories reflect that. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't support us financially, doesn't mean you can't support us at all!!

  • Help us get the word out and blog or share this on Facebook or Twitter!
  • Pray for us, that we will strive for excellence and that God will meet our funding needs.
