story:
Story for your book:

We're all Marketers shares the principles of marketing behind the top marketers and how you can leverage these principles to achieve success in your brand, movement or company.

My name is Nico De Bruyn and I am the author of We're All Marketers. I wrote this book because I was a college student who decided that I wasn’t passionate about what I was studying anymore, which was healthcare. Lost in the sea of possibilities I tried many different industries and finally stumbled into marketing. I loved the industry and was instantly hooked on the massive impact that I could have. However, I couldn't find any practical resource that broke down marketing into easily understandable basics. I decided if this doesn’t exist, then I have to create that what I needed. The more I explored, I stumbled a set of principles that have made the top marketers successful.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that there are a set of principles that anyone can apply to become a successful marketer. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for marketing in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you market more effectively and comfortably online.

In this book, you'll learn about marketing and branding in the modern digital ecosystem:

The way that VaynerMedia’s CCO finds a brands role in culture.

How to use analytical storytelling from world renowned digital marketer Dennis Yu.

Utilizing practical philosophy to achieve your key performance indicators from Wendy Stevens.


You will love this book if you have been curious on how to leverage digital media to amplify your brand, movement or company but have been deadlocked because of not knowing where to start.

We're all Marketers is a non-fiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs and new marketers who are searching for the tools to enable them to successfully market and brand for the first time.

 

The Book - We're All Marketers

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. In this part you will learn about how to establish and build a strong foundation for your brand. A strong foundation is pivotal for success and these chapters offer a list of principles that will discuss topics such as how to identify a market niche, discover what your role in a that specific niche is and where to find gain audiences attention.

Part 2 focuses on building out the marketing strategy and developing your brands equity. This will include some principles that are often overlooked but have been essential in my marketing journey such as how to create content that is bold, marketing with the end goal in mind and creating marketing that lasts.

In Part 3, you will learn how the brand that we have established and breakdown the principles that will help you to scale. Principles here will touch about ow to use story telling to connect deeper with your audience and use analytics to refine and improve to ensure constant growth.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2019

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Nico De Bruyn is the Chief Growth Hacker for an innovative startup based in Phoenix, Arizona. He is also the co-founder of Boundless Branding, a boutique agency that focuses on creating and scaling c-level executives brands.

Nico became fascinated about marketing but couldn’t find any resource that broke down the subject in a simple and easily understandable way. This sparked a burning desire to find out directly from the source what made a successful marketer and take that to apply to his own life.

Outside of this book Nico works full time doing marketing and aims to leave every single person he meets online or off, better than he found them.

For more information you can connect with Nico at ndebruyn@asu.edu (EMAIL) and follow him on all social media platforms @nicodebruyn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Wereallmarketers and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nico De Bruyn
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nico De Bruyn

story:
*If you contribute more than $40, you will still receive a book even though the "perk" is not selected. Thanks!*

Who Am I?

I am a 26 year old who has dealt with irritable bowel syndrome my entire life. I have always been challenged by vacationing, backpacking, and exercising, because I will never know how my gut will react. I thought I was "ready" for the rigor of the John Muir Trail, a 211-mile through-hike, but my stomach issues were prevalent in full force. I was enlightened by this challenge to see just how inaccessible "the outdoors" are for so many people. I care deeply about making the outdoor community more accessible and anti-racist.

I am writing this book as a memoir of my experience with chronic pain and will include photos, packing lists, maps, and tips for my readers so they too can find ways to get out in nature safely and comfortably.

What I Need

I am raising money to get my book edited, published, and marketed. I am currently in Grad School so don't have lots of money to spare for these costs. This book isn't for me: 80% of all book sales will go towards non-profits. This book will inspire many people to access the outdoors and give back to organizations that ensure such access.

What You Get

  • $1 will fund 100 words to be edited. Every small amount counts!

  • If you donate $5 or more, you will be written into the "Special Thanks" Section.

  • If you donate $40 or more, you will also receive an original freshly-printed copy as soon as it is produced!

  • If I have left over money for producing costs, I will reach back out to all my donors so they can choose where their money will be donated.

The Impact

As I said before, 80% of all book sales will be donated to non-profits. Every buyer gets to choose where their money goes. There are three types of organizations one can donate to:

  1. Non-Profits that preserve the outdoors (Ex. Audubon, Sierra Club, Access Fund)
  2. Non-Profits that aim to bring children and minorities to the outdoors (Ex. Brown Girl Surf, Flashy Fox)
  3. Indigenous Rights Groups (Ex. Cultural Survival, NARF)

Once my book is available for purchase, buyers will decide where their purchase will impact on my book website! Funding the production of my book now means more donated money later!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate to my project, you can donate time by editing my book, helping with cover art, or creating comics that demonstrate my outdoors tips at the end of my book! If you have packing lists, maps, or outdoor tips, I am happy to learn and listen as well and possibly add them to my book; just contact me through IndieGogo where it says "Ask A Question".

story:
Story of My Book

When The Going Gets Tough: A framework to help medical error survivors make their voice heard in the Patient Safety community and empowers them to move the healthcare system towards a future with less medical errors.

My name is Berenda Sayadof and I am the author of When The Going Gets Tough. I wrote it because I’m very passionate about improving healthcare for patients and I strongly believe that patients can be part of the solution to lessening medical errors in the system. I’m a firm believer that the healthcare system and patients can work together to create a better tomorrow and the stories I cover in my book are testimonies to do just that.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that one person can change the fate of a complex system simply with determination. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for Patient Safety in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you make the change you want in the healthcare system so that the next person after you that goes into the system won’t fall victim to the same medical error.

In this book, you'll learn about how the system and patients can work in unison for a more improved reality of patient safety, and how other individuals thrived in different types of hardships to get them to a place of peace and closure. You'll read many interesting stories including:

  • Donna Penner - A patient from Manitoba, Canada, shows us how her determination after a traumatic medical error helped her get through barriers that were holding down her maximum potential in making a change in the system, eventually breaking through the barriers and finding her own voice in Patient Safety.
  • Dr. Amy Nakajima - This physician from Ontario, Canada failed to recognize a rare condition that a new mother who had just given birth had, and the death of that patient almost led Dr. Nakajima to give up the entire career ahead of her. Instead, Dr. Nakajima spoke up on the fear and stigma associated with healthcare providers admitting to mistakes and now is an advocate for Patient Safety and is encouraging more discussions on medical error.
  • Sue Sheridan - A mother from Idaho, U.S., endured the loss of her husband due to a late cancer diagnosis and witnessed her newborn son develop cerebral palsy after constant negligence from healthcare providers about her concerns. These onsets of medical errors didn’t stop Sue from forming a community of mothers with similar cases and testifying before the U.S. Senate Finance Committee, demanding better testing of newborns for symptoms leading up to cerebral palsy. Her fierceness and passion is worth noting and looking up to for inspiration on your own unique situation.

You will love this book if you have a story to put out there and want to do something about it! When The Going Gets Tough is a non-fiction book that speaks to medical error survivors and fellow Patient Safety advocates who are looking at finding a voice in healthcare and making a dent in the system for the first time. The key, however, is remembering to work with the system and not against it, and this book will explain just how to do that.

The Book - When the Going Gets Tough

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters 1 to 4. This section introduces my reasons for wanting to raise more awareness on patient safety among patients as well as breaks down common misconceptions that patients can have before they start their advocating journeys. As well, I explain theories and research that has been going on behind patient safety in the last 40 years so you can be prepped with as much knowledge about the nuts and bolts of the healthcare system and Patient Safety as a whole.

Part 2 contains Chapters 5-8. This section introduces the patient portion of Patient Safety and is where you’ll start hearing about patient stories. The stories found here revolve around grief, and the different forms of grief that I’ve found to linger after medical error. You will have the opportunity to not only learn about how patients got through their own types of grief after the medical error they experienced, but you’ll also recognize the space within yourself to grow and take action based on your own grief and other feelings that came about after your medical error experience. Forgiveness, strength and acceptance are some of the many takeaways from this section, and each chapters offers an entire experience of healing.

Part 3 contains Chapters 9-11. This part of the book is where exciting transformations are already beginning to take place! By this point you will have a new and improved outlook on the healthcare system and you’ll learn about ways in which you can take part in advocating for Patient Safety. This empowering section talks about the importance of vulnerability and how to embrace your medical error experience in a way that can charge you to move forward. I highlight the importance of having faith in the system even after a negative experience with it, so that this newfound faith will open doors for you to become an advocate and leader in Patient Safety.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter 2019

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About The Author

Berenda Sayadof is a graduate from Queen’s University with a Bachelor of Science in Biology but she is a writer and advocate for Patient Safety at heart. She is looking to extend her studies into a Master’s for Quality Improvement to broaden her knowledge on Patient Safety and use it as a tool to make a deeper, positive impact in hospitals and medical settings nation-wide. Berenda is always looking for ways to raise awareness on the world of Patient Safety and loves to discuss different perspectives in the field, so if you have a couple of hours at hand and a knack for quality improvement, reach out to her and be part of the discussion!

Berenda wrote this book initially out of frustration as to why she hadn’t heard about Patient Safety much earlier than she did. She then vowed to raise more awareness about it. Her main source of inspiration was To Err Is Human: A Patient Safety Documentary, a documentary highlighting Sue Sheridan’s story, a mother who lost her husband and endured the journey of her son developing cerebral palsy all due to preventative medical errors. What started off simply as Berenda hoping that someone out there would write a book raising awareness on more patient stories, ended up being her own passion project that she’s been working on since January 2019.

If she’s not talking about ways to lessen medical error in hospitals and medicine, Berenda is most likely talking about the the Global Fisheries Crisis, the beauty of sloths, or her toy poodle, Pumpkin: Berenda’s pride and joy. She is a writer at heart and truly believes in the power of words. One of the best experiences she had on her journey of publishing this book was the opportunity to combine her passions of writing and patient safety to create something that has the power to impact people’s lives for the better.

For more information you can connect with Berenda at bsayadof@gmail.com and https://www.linkedin.com/in/berendas-001/.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #WhenTheGoingGetsTough and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Berenda Sayadof

story:
Hello, ITC!

Some of you may know me from 2013's Integral Theory Conference in San Francisco. I was the formal blogger for that conference, meaning I attended the event and did my best to cover as much of the goings on as I could. I'm very honored to have been invited back by the folks from Meta Integral to blog ITC 2015: "Using Integrative Meta Theories to Catalyze Effective Change." 

For those of you who don't know me: 

  • I'm a writer and researcher living on Long Island, New York. 
  • I'm an editor for Reality Sandwich and IT specialist and community manager for Evolver's Learning Lab.

I research things like the modern consciousness culture, integral theories, and the evolution of consciousness.

I'm also passionate about the idea of a "planetary culture." We have a long way to go til' we're there, but I've spent the past few years of my writing and research exploring the communities and literature – often called "Transformative Culture(s)" – dedicated to furthering that potential.

I've found myself personally invested in the notion of a "trans-lineage" integral worldview – building on the Kosmopolitan theme from ITC 2013 – exploring the meaning of "integral" in the writings of Sri Aurobindo, Jean Gebser, Ken Wilber and further in writers like William Irwin Thompson, Haridas Chauduri and the Jesuit theologian Teilhard de Chardin. I believe in the philosophical, spiritual and imaginative possibilities of an "integral" consciousness. Yet, I also believe such an emergent worldview mustn't be assimilative, but an assemblage. It must shine forth. Show itself in the disparate parts as a rhizome. My hunch, if you could call it that, is that an "integral worldview" is traceable in the moments of utmost fluidity and "in-betweenness."

The folks at Meta Integral are using this conference as an opportunity to call into question the notion of a "meta theory," proper. That's why I'm very excited to be blogging ITC 2015 once again, and you can see my inaugural post, "The Unthinkable Present: Blogging at ITC 2015." 

I plan on using this time before the conference to conduct interviews and thoughtful articles instigated by conversations with panelists and conference organizers. 

In short, I plan to blog my heart out: before, during, and after this conference.

But I'm going to need your help getting there.

For a few bucks, you can help get me (literally) off the ground and over to Sonoma University come July.

What Your Fundraising Does

Your funds help get me to conference – a skip and a jump from New York City to San Francisco, and from there, Sonoma County. That's why I'm asking for a funding goal of $500 to cover transportation expenses. 

Your funding this project gives me more precious time to write, edit, and publish content before and during ITC 2015. It makes this all possible.

A few things you can expect from me as the ITC blogger:

  • 3 Interviews precipitating the actual conference. Published between my homepage and Reality Sandwich magazine.
  • At least 2 more articles examining the thematics of "Integral Impacts."
  • Daily live blogs and a plethora of interviews and conversations each day while I'm at ITC2015  at Sonoma State (as much as I can humanly do. I may be a quick witted blogger, blogging about "Meta" theories, but I am not, myself, a "meta person." Whatever that may be. Sounds like that would help).

What Any Additional Funds Will Go To:

  • Continuing to publish the stores of content – interviews, podcasts, photography– I will have sitting on my hard drive after the event.
  • Basic homepage maintenance. Domain name renewal.
  • Website improvements.
  • More content! Integral related articles, essays, interviews, podcasts!

Some Perks

I met a lot of brilliant, shining folks at ITC2013 – especially through my fundraising campaign. I intend to thank everyone who assists in whatever way they feel is right. But, I see this as an opportunity to connect with you. So...

  • I'd like to host Google Hangouts (dates TBA) before, during and after the conference. This will especially be for folks who cannot attend the live event.
  • My email is always open for integral conversations, editorial work and professional inquiries: jeremy (at) evolver (dot) net.

Other Ways You Can Help

There's more than one way you can help, of course, such as:

  • If Indie GoGo is a no-go, you can also help me directly via Paypal.
  • ...Or via my burgeoning Patreon account. If you enjoy my writing, consider supporting me via this subscription based method. I'd be much obliged.
  • Please share this campaign with as many conference goers and interested peers as you can. 
Now, before you go...

More Things to Check Out

  • ITC 2013 blogging was hosted on my site, Evolutionary Landscapes. You can still browse the posts starting with the inaugural piece: "Everything That Rises: Or Synthetic Thought, Florilegium and the Networked Age."
  • A vlog I did post ITC 2013 summarizing my thoughts on the event (Do forgive that haircut).
  • William Harryman of Integral Options Cafe was kind enough to reblog that piece with some additional commentary.
  • My last IndieGoGo fundraiser – a massive, humbling success. Thanks to all who made that possible.
  • Please see my CV to learn more about me.
  • Check out my essays and academic work on Academia.edu
  • You can read more of what I've been writing on my Publications page.

Thank You

Any contribution, financial or otherwise, is deeply appreciated. 
Thank you for supporting this one, integral writer. Here's to a wonderful journey of intellectual, spiritual, and diaphanous gleanings.

If Indie GoGo is a no-go, you can also help me directly via Paypal.
...Or via my burgeoning Patreon account. If you enjoy my writing, consider supporting me via this subscription based method. I'd be much obliged.
Please share this campaign with as many conference goers and interested peers as you can. 

Now, before you go...

More Things to Check Out


ITC 2013 blogging was hosted on my site, Evolutionary Landscapes. You can still browse the posts starting with the inaugural piece: "Everything That Rises: Or Synthetic Thought, Florilegium and the Networked Age."


A vlog I did post ITC 2013 summarizing my thoughts on the event (Do forgive that haircut).


William Harryman of Integral Options Cafe was kind enough to reblog that piece with some additional commentary.


My last IndieGoGo fundraiser – a massive, humbling success. Thanks to all who made that possible.


Please see my CV to learn more about me.

Check out my essays and academic work on Academia.edu

You can read more of what I've been writing on my Publications page.



Thank You
Any contribution, financial or otherwise, is deeply appreciated. 
Thank you for supporting this one, integral writer. Here's to a wonderful journey of intellectual, spiritual, and diaphanous gleanings.

story:
WHO WE ARE & WHAT WE'RE DOING

RAINCOAT is a community of musicians, writers, visual artists, filmmakers, and more.  We champion the work of womyn and the nurturing of safe, dynamic spaces that encourage its creation and distribution.

RAINCOAT first came into being as a space where womyn could feel welcome to create work, have their projects read by fellow womyn editors, be an artist amongst a community of other womyn artists, and finally have their pieces published by a space that was concerned with their visibility.  Because we wanted to see more diverse work from more diverse womyn, work that went beyond what was being made available to us online or in print, RAINCOAT was established as a place where these projects and their creators could be nourished and supported. 

In January of 2015, we launched the first issue of RAINCOAT and have since published four additional issues on our website, raincoatmag.com.  Each month, our contributors submit pieces ranging from personal essays and poems to digital art pieces, original comics, and mixtapes.  Rooted in a DIY aesthetic and a desire to champion the work of womyn from all backgrounds, RAINCOAT prides itself on publishing pieces that are just as diverse as our contributors.  While we’ve only been live for five short months, we’ve already garnered over 1500 Facebook likes and a slew of dedicated readers, a testament to RAINCOAT’s unique voice and perspective. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

HELP US FUND OUR FIRST EVER PRINT ISSUE!

In order to thank our contributors and continue establishing connections with and within our community, we’re hoping to launch our first ever print issue, featuring highlights from our first five publications.  In addition to providing our contributors with a tangible acknowledgment of their hard work, we plan to distribute copies of the zine to local booksellers and community spaces in and around Los Angeles, where many of our contributors are based, in order to reach members of our community who might not have interacted with our online platform.

In order to make this dream a reality, we need your help to raise $2,000, which will fund the costs associated with printing and distributing the zine.  Should we exceed our goal, your contribution will also go toward RAINCOAT grants, which will help fund ambitious creative projects that our contributors wish to pursue for the zine. 

YOU GET COOL STUFF

Perks! Perks! Perks!

To thank you for your support, we want to give you tokens of our appreciation, made entirely by RAINCOAT contributors and staff.

While our perks run the gamut of creations, from hand-dyed socks and custom jewelry to animal beanies and love songs, all of our perks, like the zine itself, are made with love.

Plus, all donors who contribute $25 USD or more are guaranteed a copy of the printed zine.

WHY THIS IS IMPORTANT

We would love to have a print issue in order to further increase the visibility of both our zine and our incredible contributors. We are tremendously proud to digitally publish the work they submit each month via our online platform, and your contribution will directly help us physically publish their work in hardcopy form as a print zine. There is something so special about holding your own work in your own hands, and we would love to be able to put a copy of RAINCOAT in your hands, the hands of our dedicated contributors, and (hopefully) many more!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

#GoRaincoat!  Share this campaign with your friends, family, and others in your community who are dedicated to fostering safe and vibrant spaces in which the creative endeavors of womyn are nourished and championed.  Post it, tweet it, share it, send it in an email, or shout it from the rooftops!  And don’t forget to like us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to continue receiving daily content from our contributors.

You can also support RAINCOAT by reading our work, telling your friends, or even contributing yourself!  We accept submissions from womyn around the world.  If you’re interested in getting involved, email us at editor@raincoatmag.com!

THANK YOU!

Over the past five months, our contributors have poured their hearts and souls into their pieces for RAINCOAT.  We are so excited to share their work with you and our community through this print issue, and we can't thank you enough for your contribution!

story:
The launch of Psych2Go Magazine Issue #6

The Psych2Go Magazine is a quarterly magazine released in March, June, September and December. It is 80 pages long, and contains a wide range of content. The articles are based on psychology research but written in an easy to understand manner. This magazine is by students, for students. There are also amazing art pieces to go with each article, as well as many opportunities for community submissions. There are also fun quizzes in each issue.

Let's start with the rewards first since you probably already know us and that's why you were able to find this campaign. 

Here are the rewards: 
1. For $1, you get a put on a thank you list on our tumblr and website (Psych2Go.net)

2. For $10 (excluding shipping) you can buy a physical copy of Issue 6. 

3. For $20 (excluding shipping) you can buy a physical copy of Issue 5 & 6 (limited to 40 copies).

4. For $20 (excluding shipping) you can buy two physical copies of issue 6.

5. For $42 (excluding shipping) you can buy five physical copies of issue 6.

6. For $3 you can pre-order a digital copy of issue 6.

7. For $10 you can pre-order a 2017 digital subscription.

8. For $100 we will do an individual thank you post, including any link you'd wish to advertise, on our tumblr and facebook.

We greatly appreciate any donation or purchase you make! 


Who exactly are Psych2Go? 

Psych2Go is small media publishing company geared towards providing accessible psychology content to millennials by millennials. The vision of Psych2Go is to bring together young people with an interest in psychology together to pool in knowledge, resources, and support.

There are various Facebook Groups created through Psych2Go to get people involved in supporting each other, sharing ideas, thoughts and just freely expressing their questions or concerns related to mental health and psychology. 


Psych2Go started on Tumblr, and currently has a humble following of 9000 subscribers, Facebook Page of 30, 000 likes, and a website that dedicates to providing full text and educational psychology content to supplement the Tumblr posts (psych2go.net). 

BUT what sets “Psych2Go” apart from other psychology companies out there? 

YOU GUYS! Without you guys, there’d be no point in what we do. The best part of this whole endeavour, has been the relationship that were established between members of the Psych2Go community because of you all. 

Where are the funds from this Campaign going towards? 

It goes towards manufacturing the cost of the digital magazine, shipping, packaging, and other operational expenses, and hopefully attracting potential investors in the future to help finance and grow psych2go further. 

The vision of Psych2Go is to become a psychology news site, in which we can explain complex psychological findings and concepts at a level that anyone, be they psychology students or just the general public, can understand. We also want to create opportunities for aspiring psychologists to become more engaged with psychology as a whole. 

 

Along with your purchase of the physical copy of our magazine, you will have the opportunity to participate in our "Community Challenge" that allows you to send in your photos where you have the chance to express your creativity and help to spread the word about Psych2Go by taking a photo with your Psych2Go Magazine or with someone else or some other scenario (it would be so cool to see in a classroom!) We want to see you get involved in our community! Feel free to send your picture to Teresa, the Editor-in-chief: teresajohnso3@gmail.com

story:
This is a movie themed activity book for teens to adult. 
The book came about when I bought a Heavy Mental fun times activity book for a friend of mine. It was such a big hit I wanted to get a movie themed one for myself, but discovered there aren't any. So I decided to make one. 
It took a lot more time then I had first anticipated, from doing all the reshearch, to desiging all the puzzles and drawing all the graphics. All up it was around 9 months in the making.
I wanted to make it so even if you haven't see the movie you could still enjoy and do the puzzles. I think I have accomplished that. But if you get stuck there is always google.
The activities range from Donkie Darlo, Star Wars, Toy Story, Mayilyn Monroe and even Austin Powers joins the party.
It's finally finished and now I want to get it out into the world for people to enjoy. It's a fun quirky book that will bring you loads of entertainment.
 

THE ASK

     With this campaign I am hoping to $15,000 to pay for the cost of printing the book, 1,500 books and producing all the perks everyone will receive and covering the Indiegogo fee (that will take 4-9%), the PayPal fee (that will take 3,5% of what's left) and bank fees.


In exchange for your support, you'll be able to choose between some basic rewards and some really amazing packages. Also besides getting the perks, if you support me, you will get an awesome feeling inside your belly and heart knowing you have helped me bring this project life and that you where apart of the first Movie Activity Book ever made.

Alice In Wonderland set

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute, or you don't want any of my precious perks, you can still make a huge difference by sharing this link of my indiegogo page on Face Book, Twitter or via email, Spread the word on all the hundreds of social media sites. Thank you.

story:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_tZdC2P2RJ8

Mi madre tiene fibromialgia y cada día que la veo me muero d pena. Tiene 53 años es una mujer hermosa, y hasta hace poco también valiente y positiva pero cada día la enfermedad va a más y la ayuda a menos y temo por que se la agoten las fuerzas y se rinda.
Lleva con esta maligna enfermedad más de 15 años y no hay nada, que la apacigüe el dolor que siente.
Necesito q nos ayudéis, que seáis parte de la voz que llegue a  la gente q pueda hacer algo. No tiene pensión, ninguna, después de llevar mas de 20 años trabajando.

Con Indiegogo la meta que nos marcamos es habilitar el patio y crear allí su habitación con un pequeño aseo para que no tenga que subir 23 escaleras cada vez que se pone mala o cada vez que tiene que ir al aseo por que es agotador.

Muchos días sube y ya no tiene fuerzas para bajar y tiene que quedarse agotada en la cama. Algo tan sencillo para todos como es ir al aseo a ella se le convierte en una odisea.

La fibromialgia no es una enfermedad reconocida por la Seguridad Social , asique nadie te ayuda. 0 euros al mes que hacen que la presión y el dolor sea mucho mayor por solo creer dar problemas. Es una enfermedad incomprendida pese a todos los síntomas dolorosísimos que tiene.

La fibromialgia no sabes como te va a despertar cada día, hay días que no puedes menearte de la cama, otros puedes levantarte pero al cabo de un par de horas ya estas agotada y tienes que volver a la cama.

No te avisa ,te sorprende sin mas. El otro día llegue a casa de mi madre y estaba tirada en el suelo, llevaba horas sin poder moverse, se había caído y no tenía fuerzas para levantarse.

Su habitación esta arriba y fue imposible subirla para acostarla en la cama hasta las 8 de la tarde que llego mi padre de trabajar. 

 Yo estoy embarazada mi bebé llega en julio y para ella es su única ilusión, cree que mi hija le va a dar la fuerza  que necesita pero yo necesito que alguien más la recompensé el esfuerzo que hace cada día por sonreír cuando me ve la barriga. Necesito que la abran una puerta a la esperanza. Ella es una mujer impresionante y no puedo dejar q se la agoten las fuerzas por que la necesito y su nieta también.

story:
FREEWAY IS NOW AVAILABLE!

The "Freeway: A Not-So-Perfect Guide To Freedom" small group curriculum is now available!

FREEWAY MAIN PAGE

BUY THE WORKBOOK HERE.

BUY THE DVD HERE.

WHOA! And you won't believe how it turned out and what pastors, leaders, experts and passionate world changers are saying about it!


IMPORTANT! CAMPAIGN ENDS TODAY!

We are sooooo close to hitting our goal of $20,000 with only a few hours left remaining in the campaign. We would love for you to participate and be a part of making this project a reality! Thanks again!

OUR CAMPAIGN  

People of the Second Chance is raising $20,000 in 25 days to fund its new project called "Freeway: Six Steps To Freedom." By selecting one of our awesome reward perks in the right side column, your investment will allow us to finish, design, print and duplicate the Freeway workbook and DVD.

We are a verified and recognized 501-c3 non profit organization and 100% of the funds go to completing the Freeway project. 


ABOUT PEOPLE OF THE SECOND CHANCE

 People of the Second Chance helps people find beauty and purpose in their story of struggle. We create fresh pathways to God's radical grace through simple products & extraordinary people. 

  "Freeway: A Not-So-Perfect Guide To Freedom" will be our primary resource used to transform lives through a small group experience.

For more information People of the Second Chance, click here.

SO WHAT IS FREEWAY?

Freeway is an innovative small group study (workbook and DVD) that helps you encounter God's radical grace in your life.

Unlike any other small group study, Freeway is unique in how you learn about yourself and the love of God. The workbook and DVD delivers creative excercises, experiential activities, spiritual assessments, and a engaging group study you do every week with your small group.

Freeway is hard hitting, deep soul searching work made simple. It's not academic, complicated or self-help mumbo jumbo. It's premise is simple: through admitting our hurts and struggles, God can make us whole and free.   

LEARN HOW TO...

-Kick perfectionism to the curb and learn to be OK with being OK.

-Decide to let your identity and value be shaped by a loving God.

-Stop focusing on your hurt and embrace your opportunity to give back.

-Break cycles of shame and feeling like you're "never enough."

-Discover how pain, fear and our hurts hijack our God story.

-Finally allow yourself to be loved by the one who loves you most.

 

1 WORKBOOK

We've blown up the typical, boring small group study guide and created something fresh and fun. Inside the Freeway workbook is everything you need to do the 6 week study. Unlike any other workbook, this 100 page, full color guide leads you through each session and will be filled with your thoughts and words and personal discoveries. Filled with innovative exercises, simple personal assessments, engaging small group questions, and a space to journal, scribble and draw your discoveries.

6 SHORT TEACHING VIDEOS

Mike Foster kicks off your small group gathering in a relaxed and chill way. Forget the typical religious expert and Mr. know-it-all stuff, Mike shares some simple ideas and stories from his Freeway group to get the conversation flowing. Filmed in San Diego, CA by Prolifik Films with music by Grammy award winner David Hodges (Evanescence, Kelli Clarkson, Christina Perri)  and Ryan O'Neal from Sleeping At Last (Twilight)

HOW YOU CAN HELP

We believe everyone can be a part of this campaign. Here are some ways you can help:

1. BECOME AN INVESTOR:

Pick one of the exciting levels of rewards options and become an investor using your credit card. Big or small, all donations make a huge difference. Because your donation goes directly to our non-profit, a portion of your donation is tax deductible and can be part of your year end giving. 

2. GIVE THROUGH YOUR GROUP, CHURCH OR BUSINESS:

We love individual giving but that's not the only way to support this project. Your church, business or small group can also give to our campaign. Many of our perks have been specifically created for group giving. Have your church or business become a "founding member" or take advantage of some of the reward incentives to help your cause or mission. Have your small group become an investor and be the first to go through the Freeway study.

3. GIVE AS A GIFT TO A FRIEND FOR CHRISTMAS

Though the rewards won't be available till 2013, you can give your perk as a Christmas gift to another recipient. We will provide a specially designed downloadable Christmas certificate. Or if you would like to give in memory of a family member or friend we have reward incentives just for this too.

4. SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN ON TWITTER & FACEBOOK:

A quick tweet or status update with a link to our Indiegogo page is super important. Donate your online influence and let people know why you're supporting us. Make sure to tag it #potscfreeway

WHAT DOES $20,000 PAY FOR?

Subtract the campaign fees (10%) and fulfillment of the investor rewards packages and this is what $20,000 allows us to do:

-3000 copies of the Freeway workbook. Printing and shipping.

-500 Freeway DVD copies. Printing and shipping.

-Design and layout of the Freeway workbook.

-Miscellaneous video shoot expenses and location fees.

$20,000 is the rock bottom minimum we need to pay for the final hard costs and finish the project. Honestly, it just covers the most basic needs.


IF WE RAISE $30,000 WE CAN:

-Build out an interactive online experience.

-Build out additional church and small group leaders materials.

-Adequately market and advertise the product.

-Improve the overall Freeway experience.

-Complete the project faster.


WHO IS INVOLVED IN THE FREEWAY PROJECT?

People of the Second Chance is building Freeway with awesomely talented friends and experts, many who are donating their time and talent. 

Mike Foster: Creator & Author. Co-founder of People of the Second Chance www.SecondChance.org

Garry Poole: Content Designer and Author. (Willowcreek & Groups Expert)

Jason Jaggard: Content Designer (Spark Good and Mosaic) www.SparkGood.com

Tom Rinks: Creative Director (Co-founder of Nooma)

Prolifik Films: Video and Visual Design. www.Prolifik.co

PlainJoe Studios: Design and Brand. www.PlainJoe.net

David Hodges: Music and Beautiful sounds. (Evanescence, Kelly Clarkson) www.DavidHodgesMusic.com

Ryan O'Neal: Music and Beautiful sounds (Sleeping At Last, Twilight Soundtrack) www.SleepingAtLast.com 

Daley Hake: Photography www.DaleyHake.com
story_txt:
FREEWAY IS NOW AVAILABLE!The "Freeway: A Not-So-Perfect Guide To Freedom" small group curriculum is now available!FREEWAY MAIN PAGEBUY THE WORKBOOK HERE.BUY THE DVD HERE.WHOA! And you won't believe how it turned out and what pastors, leaders, experts and passionate world changers are saying about it!IMPORTANT! CAMPAIGN ENDS TODAY!
We are sooooo close to hitting our goal of $20,000 with only a few hours left remaining in the campaign. We would love for you to participate and be a part of making this project a reality! Thanks again!
OUR CAMPAIGN  
People of the Second Chance is raising $20,000 in 25 days to fund its new project called "Freeway: Six Steps To Freedom." By selecting one of our awesome reward perks in the right side column, your investment will allow us to finish, design, print and duplicate the Freeway workbook and DVD.
We are a verified and recognized 501-c3 non profit organization and 100% of the funds go to completing the Freeway project. 

ABOUT PEOPLE OF THE SECOND CHANCE

 People of the Second Chance helps people find beauty and purpose in their story of struggle. We create fresh pathways to God's radical grace through simple products & extraordinary people. 
  "Freeway: A Not-So-Perfect Guide To Freedom" will be our primary resource used to transform lives through a small group experience.
For more information People of the Second Chance, click here.
SO WHAT IS FREEWAY?
Freeway is an innovative small group study (workbook and DVD) that helps you encounter God's radical grace in your life.
Unlike any other small group study, Freeway is unique in how you learn about yourself and the love of God. The workbook and DVD delivers creative excercises, experiential activities, spiritual assessments, and a engaging group study you do every week with your small group.
Freeway is hard hitting, deep soul searching work made simple. It's not academic, complicated or self-help mumbo jumbo. It's premise is simple: through admitting our hurts and struggles, God can make us whole and free.   
LEARN HOW TO...
-Kick perfectionism to the curb and learn to be OK with being OK.
-Decide to let your identity and value be shaped by a loving God.
-Stop focusing on your hurt and embrace your opportunity to give back.
-Break cycles of shame and feeling like you're "never enough."
-Discover how pain, fear and our hurts hijack our God story.
-Finally allow yourself to be loved by the one who loves you most. 
1 WORKBOOK
We've blown up the typical, boring small group study guide and created something fresh and fun. Inside the Freeway workbook is everything you need to do the 6 week study. Unlike any other workbook, this 100 page, full color guide leads you through each session and will be filled with your thoughts and words and personal discoveries. Filled with innovative exercises, simple personal assessments, engaging small group questions, and a space to journal, scribble and draw your discoveries.
6 SHORT TEACHING VIDEOS
Mike Foster kicks off your small group gathering in a relaxed and chill way. Forget the typical religious expert and Mr. know-it-all stuff, Mike shares some simple ideas and stories from his Freeway group to get the conversation flowing. Filmed in San Diego, CA by Prolifik Films with music by Grammy award winner David Hodges (Evanescence, Kelli Clarkson, Christina Perri)  and Ryan O'Neal from Sleeping At Last (Twilight)

HOW YOU CAN HELP
We believe everyone can be a part of this campaign. Here are some ways you can help:
1. BECOME AN INVESTOR:
Pick one of the exciting levels of rewards options and become an investor using your credit card. Big or small, all donations make a huge difference. Because your donation goes directly to our non-profit, a portion of your donation is tax deductible and can be part of your year end giving. 
2. GIVE THROUGH YOUR GROUP, CHURCH OR BUSINESS:
We love individual giving but that's not the only way to support this project. Your church, business or small group can also give to our campaign. Many of our perks have been specifically created for group giving. Have your church or business become a "founding member" or take advantage of some of the reward incentives to help your cause or mission. Have your small group become an investor and be the first to go through the Freeway study.
3. GIVE AS A GIFT TO A FRIEND FOR CHRISTMAS
Though the rewards won't be available till 2013, you can give your perk as a Christmas gift to another recipient. We will provide a specially designed downloadable Christmas certificate. Or if you would like to give in memory of a family member or friend we have reward incentives just for this too.
4. SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN ON TWITTER & FACEBOOK:
A quick tweet or status update with a link to our Indiegogo page is super important. Donate your online influence and let people know why you're supporting us. Make sure to tag it #potscfreeway

WHAT DOES $20,000 PAY FOR?
Subtract the campaign fees (10%) and fulfillment of the investor rewards packages and this is what $20,000 allows us to do:
-3000 copies of the Freeway workbook. Printing and shipping.
-500 Freeway DVD copies. Printing and shipping.
-Design and layout of the Freeway workbook.
-Miscellaneous video shoot expenses and location fees.
$20,000 is the rock bottom minimum we need to pay for the final hard costs and finish the project. Honestly, it just covers the most basic needs.

IF WE RAISE $30,000 WE CAN:
-Build out an interactive online experience.
-Build out additional church and small group leaders materials.
-Adequately market and advertise the product.
-Improve the overall Freeway experience.
-Complete the project faster.
WHO IS INVOLVED IN THE FREEWAY PROJECT?
People of the Second Chance is building Freeway with awesomely talented friends and experts, many who are donating their time and talent. 
Mike Foster: Creator & Author. Co-founder of People of the Second Chance www.SecondChance.org
Garry Poole: Content Designer and Author. (Willowcreek & Groups Expert)
Jason Jaggard: Content Designer (Spark Good and Mosaic) www.SparkGood.com
Tom Rinks: Creative Director (Co-founder of Nooma)
Prolifik Films: Video and Visual Design. www.Prolifik.co
PlainJoe Studios: Design and Brand. www.PlainJoe.net
David Hodges: Music and Beautiful sounds. (Evanescence, Kelly Clarkson) www.DavidHodgesMusic.com
Ryan O'Neal: Music and Beautiful sounds (Sleeping At Last, Twilight Soundtrack) www.SleepingAtLast.com 
Daley Hake: Photography www.DaleyHake.com

story:
My name is Angie and I'm a author!

Hello, everyone my name is Angela Peters I am the author of Heavenly poems books and memorbillia.  I was born with cerebral palsy and through a series of challenging events I was temporarily left broken and unmotivated to try to succeede but God had a bigger plan for me and the he awakend the desire to find success and happiness in my life.  It is through God that I have gained the drive and been blessed with people who have eagerly supported me and my endevarors that I now have hope for a better future. I now run a micro business where I create and publish my own books, I sell heavenly poem related merchandise and I travel throughout the community reading my heavenly poems poetry in hopes that I may effect the lives of those I meet in such a uplifiting fashion as those who have worked with and blessed me.

 

What I do:

It's been a difficult joureny but after learning to believe in myself and the potenential that I possess, I have, with the help of loved ones, created my own micro business called Heavenly Poems.  Through Heavenly Poems I am able to reach out to many people with my poetry books, motivational book marks and other prouducts.  Creating Heavenly Poems has taught me that my life is just as valuable as anyone eles's and I can achieve happiness despite any physical limitations.  This is a belief that I hope to protray in all my poetry, books etc.  I want others to know that they can have a purpose driven life and not a life of mediocrity based on any pre-condition or attitude.  The ability to change is in you!

 

 

Goal: 

Traveling with cerebral palsy is very challenging and traveling in an average vehicle is impossible for me, so I travel via "Your Ride" or handicap accessible vehicle's that can hold me and my chair.  Sometimes I can also get the assitance for traveling out of the city with the help of the local ambulance service but that too is very costly.  Costing around $60.00 per trip!  Needless to say, I need my goal to be reched in order to travel to various locations to both read my poetry and sell my Heavenly Poems prodcuts. 

 

Printing-on-demand.

Aside from traveling exspenses I also need to raise funds to publish and print my books, book marks and other various products I've created.  I work with an independent Print-on-demand company and I pay everything out of my own personal finances which is very limited. 

 

Expenses:

Handicap accessible vehicles: $60-100 per transport.

printing cost: $50 to cover cost for supplies and printing cost.

 

Prizes:

I created a variety of prizes to let you know that what you donate is appreciated.  I can't continue my dream without the support of great people like you. So please donate from the heart and check out the great prizes listed! I'm looking forward to sending out the rewards!

 

Note:  Due to my lack of my mobility I will require the assitance of my loved ones and staff to assist me in printing and mailing the prizes once the fundraising is complete. So please be patient with me.

story:
Short Summary

Schaeffer Cox, 30, is a husband and father of two young children. He is a political activist. In 2008, Cox ran for the Alaska House of Representatives. His platform was simple:

  • The government needs to follow the Constitution because it's the law.
Cox argued that when the government disregards the law and tramples on others, simply because they are powerful enough to do so and get away with it, it hurts them as a Nation. He went on to point out that that sort of heavy handed disregard for their basic obligations costs the government their stability at home and their credibility abroad. His message was well received by the people and local government. After the election, Schaeffer Cox spent time traveling and gave speeches outlying a peaceful way to reclaim individual liberty. His message continued to warn the people attending his speeches that the Federal Government's current behavior was unsustainable. He contended, that the responsibility would fall back on to the shoulders of the people who had created the  Government and let it run off its rails.As Schaeffer Cox continued to give speeches, the crowds grew. This caught the attention of the Federal Government. Cox now had the world's most powerful government as an enemy. For the next several months, Cox and his family now had the force of the Federal Government against them. The FBI played a key role in trying to provoke Cox and when those attempts failed, the FBI began tearing apart the family.

What turned out to be a nightmare, continues. Schaeffer Cox is currently serving a 26 year sentence. The charges the Federal Government came up with range from conspiracy to murder federal workers to weapons charges. He is being held in a communications management unit (CMU, also known as Little Guantanamo) in Marion, IL. 

Schaeffer Cox is an example of the tyrannical grip the Federal Government has on the people and their thoughts. There is no injured party; there was no crime. At what point has the overreaching grip of the Federal Government gone too far? If someone does not think the way the Federal Government wants them to or challenges the policies, the person is considered a threat.
 

Thank you for your generous contribution and your support!

What We Need

  • The immediate need of $29,000 will pay part of the outstanding attorney fees totaling $29,000*.
  • *To date, of the $34,000 owed, $5,000 has been raised between our last Indiegogo campaign and private donations, leaving a balance of $29,000 owed.
  • Funds raised above $29,000 will be be used for the appeal process.

The Impact

The importance of this case is critical for the whole of humanity. This case is not only about this very articulate young man, it's about all of us. This case is about due process and the rule of law. When a government decides what we can eat, what we must buy and what we are allowed to think, we no longer have life. Thomas Jefferson wrote:

  • "To preserve the freedom of the human mind... and freedom of the press, every spirit should be ready to devote itself to martyrdom; for as long as we may think as we will and speak as we think, the condition of man will proceed in improvement." Thomas Jefferson to William Green Munford, 1799

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign often amongst your friends, family and groups you belong to. The Indiegogo platform makes it simple to share on social media platforms. 
  • Become familiar with how you can take back your individual liberty by viewing the speech Schaeffer Cox delivered to a group in Hamilton, MT: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6iWqTEWB-aM

story:
No Cell Phone Day is a children’s picture book written by world-renowned NEA Jazz Master and Grammy award-winning producer, Delfeayo Marsalis, and illustrated by award-winning Harlem artist, Reginald W. Butler.

The book playfully addresses the idea of imposing technology and how it affects our relationships with loved ones. In the book, Delfeayo and his daughter decide to put down their cell phones for a day to explore their hometown of New Orleans! Along the way, they see the sites, hear the sounds and enjoy all the great things The Big Easy has to offer. Most importantly, they spend quality time TOGETHER!

By contributing to this campaign, you’ll be helping us share this book and our message of quality family time, with kids and parents around the world. There are some really good rewards and two of them put books directly into the hands of students and schools in New Orleans. You can also get t-shirts, bookmarks, autographed copies of the book, personalized voicemail messages and private performances by Delfeayo himself. If we don’t reach our goal, we will still print as many books as possible and donate designated books to students and schools in The Big Easy.

story:
WHO WE ARE

My partner, Dr. Diego Giubertoni, and I more than a year ago, made a website (Writing’s Home) where people can download for free e-books fallen into the Public domain through the expiration of the terms of authorial protection, as well as the e-books uploaded by users (the uploader must be the author). Actually, we allow people to publish everything they have written: first of all people have to create a Writing's Home account then they can publish online all their writings so everyone can read them all over the world. In case there are some writings particularly interesting both for Writing’s Home and for other users of the site we will offer to the author a publishing contract, so he can earn money doing what he likes. This is how it works: anyone interested has the opportunity to put their ad in the users' writings, in this way the most successful writers will have the opportunity to make money thanks to the advertisement that will be inserted inside their works.

WRITING’S HOME PURPOSE

As you understand, the purpose of Writing’s Home is to allow anyone to publish his writings for free and allow readers to download and read for free all the files uploaded on the website.

WRITING’S HOME DATA

Now, on our website we have more than 400 e-books, (half in English and half in Italian), most of them are classics fallen into the Public domain (for example we have all Shakespeare’s literary works), but the e-books uploaded by the user are growing, in effect we are working hard to discover new talent to publish their writings. The accesses to Writing’s Home are rising day by day (in January 1412 single users visited www.writingshome.com, accesses in February increased by 30% compared to January and in March accesses are increasing by 30% compared to February), so we decided to improve the website.

HOW TO IMPROVE WRITING’S HOME

We would like to do over the layout. We believe the accesses and the uploads will increase if the site is graphically more beautiful. For these reasons we need to hire a web designer (we are not able to make better graphic), we chose Mrs. Laura Gargiulo who made these websites: (i) http://www.vetrotec.com/; (ii) http://www.neurostemcell.org/; and much more.

This work is very expensive and we don’t have enough money to pay the web designer, so if you believe in our project and if you would like to contribute to increase the accesses, therefore people upload a lot of e-book and you can read for free new e-books, please make a donation, we appreciate your amazing act!

If we raise extra money we will use them to buy ad on Google and on Facebook, consequently Writing’s Home will be more popular and there will be a lot of e-books to download and to read for free.

For further details please visit www.writingshome.com!

story:
Story of My Book

Imagination Mindset is a collection of stories from Disney Cast Members at Walt Disney World Parks & Resorts. The book demonstrates how the theme park employees have fulfilled their mission to create happiness in the most magical place on earth, and give a memorable guest experience to guests of all ages. But, amidst delivering so-called "Disney magic", the reader will learn how Cast Members develop the transferable skills and useful morale that take them beyond the magical kingdom of Walt Disney World.

My name is Karla Quintanilla and I am the author of Imagination Mindset. After completing my Disney College Program in spring 2020, I was eager to share what I experienced behind the stage and what work habits and skills I took with me that have helped me in my career endeavors. This book has turned into so much more than just my perspective. You'll get to hear Cast Members from different roles and locations talk about what it means to make magic through their lens.


My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how Cast Members go above and beyond to deliver the best service, the mentality that Disney instills in their employees, and the potentiality of using those work habits in a professional job. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for demonstrating the value of Cast Members and their dedication to their role. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you discover the mentality that Disney cultivates that can be adapted by any professional and dedicated employee.

In this book, you'll learn about the mindset that Cast Members use to deliver excellent service to their Guests and how that mindset can be useful in other roles in the job market. You'll hear stories such as...

  1. Walt and Roy Disney’s vision for creating an immersive experience for people of all ages and the company’s morale for creating a positive work environment.
  2. Disney Cast Members speaking about the importance of their role within the Disney production.
  3. Ways to use the Cast Member mindset and apply it in future jobs.

You will love this book if you are passionate about building immersive experiences, business work ethic, and career development.

Imagination Mindset is a nonfiction book that speaks to Disney enthusiasts and career-driven individuals who want to explore the behind-the-scenes for creating world-class hospitality and effective work morale in a new way.

The Book 
The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1: Leaving a Legacy and Establishing a Mission
Contains The Introduction + Chapters . This section goes through Walt and Roy’s Original vision for Disney’s parks and resorts. It also discusses the current company values and mission and how it ties to the Cast Member culture that Disney has cultivated, which I have called the Imagination Mindset.

Part 2 Exhibiting The Imagination Mindset
Contains chapters  This section unravels the operational roles within the parks and resorts to show how the Cast Members have adapted Disney’s values on a day to day basis. Each chapter takes the reader on a journey to discover how important each role is to put on the best show.

Part 3 The Value of Magic contains chapters This section tells the magical moment that cast members have delivered for Disney Guests. It showcases the meaning and value that Disney Cast Members are able to give to others and how it is all through the cultivated mindset that the Disney company has instilled in them.

Part 4 Adopting the Cast Member Mindset—his section demonstrates the transfer-ability of the Imagination Mindset. It explores the skillset that cast members possess that are valuable beyond Disney’s parks and resorts. Part 4 looks at the cast member character as a potential candidate in the professional world due to their work ethic and performance skills.

Important note: This is not sponsored by Th Walt Disney  Company nor am I speaking on behalf of the company. This is a research-based memoir and a collection of stories from former Cast Members. All encouraging to look at this organization as a positive example of work ethic. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer

PERKS 
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

About the Author

Karla Quintanilla is a first-generation Mexican immigrant.  Karla moved to the United States at age 11 in 2010. She is a curious nomad, dreamer, and big picture thinker who thrives in challenging environments that offer opportunities for growth and expansion. Karla is currently a marketing major at DeSales University, Class of 2021. She is a career ambassador and host of the Desales University Beyond The Tassel show, a podcast that highlights the success stories of alumni via informational interviews.

She wrote this book to pay tribute to the hardworking Cast Members that go above and beyond to create happiness for Disney guests. Karla is a young professional that is passionate about the Walt Disney Company and their work ethic. She hopes to make an impact on the reader by sharing honest perspectives about the passion and purpose of a Cast Member.

To put it simply, Karla is a quirky individual that likes to do things out of the ordinary. She would most likely be described by her friends and family as an extroverted, creative, and hard-working girl. Karla’s most valuable asset is the ability to grow in adversity and have fun while doing so. :)
 

International Preorders /Ordenes Internacionales

For international preorders, please send me a private message. 

Para más informacion por favor mandame un mensaje privado. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Karla Quintanilla

 

Important note: This is not sponsored by The Walt Disney Company nor am I speaking on behalf of the company. This is a research-based memoir and a collection of stories from former Cast Members. All encouraging to look at this organization as a positive example of work ethic.
story_txt:
Story of My Book
Imagination Mindset is a collection of stories from Disney Cast Members at Walt Disney World Parks & Resorts. The book demonstrates how the theme park employees have fulfilled their mission to create happiness in the most magical place on earth, and give a memorable guest experience to guests of all ages. But, amidst delivering so-called "Disney magic", the reader will learn how Cast Members develop the transferable skills and useful morale that take them beyond the magical kingdom of Walt Disney World.My name is Karla Quintanilla and I am the author of Imagination Mindset. After completing my Disney College Program in spring 2020, I was eager to share what I experienced behind the stage and what work habits and skills I took with me that have helped me in my career endeavors. This book has turned into so much more than just my perspective. You'll get to hear Cast Members from different roles and locations talk about what it means to make magic through their lens.
My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how Cast Members go above and beyond to deliver the best service, the mentality that Disney instills in their employees, and the potentiality of using those work habits in a professional job. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for demonstrating the value of Cast Members and their dedication to their role. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you discover the mentality that Disney cultivates that can be adapted by any professional and dedicated employee.In this book, you'll learn about the mindset that Cast Members use to deliver excellent service to their Guests and how that mindset can be useful in other roles in the job market. You'll hear stories such as...

Walt and Roy Disney’s vision for creating an immersive experience for people of all ages and the company’s morale for creating a positive work environment.
Disney Cast Members speaking about the importance of their role within the Disney production.
Ways to use the Cast Member mindset and apply it in future jobs.

You will love this book if you are passionate about building immersive experiences, business work ethic, and career development.Imagination Mindset is a nonfiction book that speaks to Disney enthusiasts and career-driven individuals who want to explore the behind-the-scenes for creating world-class hospitality and effective work morale in a new way.
The Book The book is written in 4 parts.Part 1: Leaving a Legacy and Establishing a MissionContains The Introduction + Chapters . This section goes through Walt and Roy’s Original vision for Disney’s parks and resorts. It also discusses the current company values and mission and how it ties to the Cast Member culture that Disney has cultivated, which I have called the Imagination Mindset.Part 2 Exhibiting The Imagination MindsetContains chapters  This section unravels the operational roles within the parks and resorts to show how the Cast Members have adapted Disney’s values on a day to day basis. Each chapter takes the reader on a journey to discover how important each role is to put on the best show.Part 3 The Value of Magic contains chapters This section tells the magical moment that cast members have delivered for Disney Guests. It showcases the meaning and value that Disney Cast Members are able to give to others and how it is all through the cultivated mindset that the Disney company has instilled in them.Part 4 Adopting the Cast Member Mindset—his section demonstrates the transfer-ability of the Imagination Mindset. It explores the skillset that cast members possess that are valuable beyond Disney’s parks and resorts. Part 4 looks at the cast member character as a potential candidate in the professional world due to their work ethic and performance skills.
Important note: This is not sponsored by Th Walt Disney  Company nor am I speaking on behalf of the company. This is a research-based memoir and a collection of stories from former Cast Members. All encouraging to look at this organization as a positive example of work ethic. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summerPERKS I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

About the Author
Karla Quintanilla is a first-generation Mexican immigrant.  Karla moved to the United States at age 11 in 2010. She is a curious nomad, dreamer, and big picture thinker who thrives in challenging environments that offer opportunities for growth and expansion. Karla is currently a marketing major at DeSales University, Class of 2021. She is a career ambassador and host of the Desales University Beyond The Tassel show, a podcast that highlights the success stories of alumni via informational interviews.She wrote this book to pay tribute to the hardworking Cast Members that go above and beyond to create happiness for Disney guests. Karla is a young professional that is passionate about the Walt Disney Company and their work ethic. She hopes to make an impact on the reader by sharing honest perspectives about the passion and purpose of a Cast Member.To put it simply, Karla is a quirky individual that likes to do things out of the ordinary. She would most likely be described by her friends and family as an extroverted, creative, and hard-working girl. Karla’s most valuable asset is the ability to grow in adversity and have fun while doing so. :) 

International Preorders /Ordenes Internacionales
For international preorders, please send me a private message. 
Para más informacion por favor mandame un mensaje privado.

I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. 
Thank you so much for all of your love and support!Thanks again,Karla Quintanilla
