story:
Story of My Book

Pendulum is a magnificent composition of stories about heritage and character.  This book explores the human heritage of thought, viewing how extreme ideals glorify violence. It exposes our discomfort with the inevitable, inviting us to live in momentum accord with our complex world and lives. By uniquely aligning stories of African descendants, Pendulum calls for a consciously humane bond of character, not form. In this book, we learn courage from leaders, purpose from freedom fighters, humility from people we call heroes and resilience from rebels who become the change they seek. Pendulum is for lovers of poetry, history, psychology, philosophy, entrepreneurship, and self-help books about causing good trouble. 

My name is Bruce Sakindi and I am the author of Pendulum. I wrote this book to bridge the lives of Africans everywhere by demonstrating how both Africa and Africans have always been uncontestedly valuable to humanity. The entire world indwells in a destructive loot psychology that Africa is secondary and by default, as so are its descendants. This sentiment is exhaustively untrue and shall stand no more.

My hope is that, in reading this book that we assume the responsibility to do better and be better, by any means necessary.

I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with your conscious forms of egoic and caste superiority. I wish for you to escape from your mundane conscious negligence about the oneness in our being and to learn alongside the heroic revolutionaries and freedom fighters of our times. Pendulum is about awakening and emboldening an inner space within us that is earthshaking, ego killing, and spiritually transforming our human bond into a deeply uniting, truthful, and fruitful being.

In this book, you'll also join in me using language to render distinct aspects of the lessons beyond through poems like:

T.e.t.h.e.r.e.d. Canvas "We sink our kin in pieces for peace." 

  • Tethered canvas is about the space where our being is split between the known which is more pleasurable than the pain of and the unknown.  It feels for the broken parts of ourselves that we hate the most. The parts which we cannot show to the world. It is about our desire to what is near and familial. It is about how desperately we hold onto that peace of certainty, so much so that if a piece of it splits, the fear within us, sinks us.

Isano Ku Isonga " Being African and human is finding a balance between fantasy and reality"

  • This poem is about the bridge between seeking validation of African worth and actually realizing its irrepressible existence. In Kinyarwanda, 'Isano Ku Isonga' translates to 'Oneness at Peak'.

Poetry " A foul tool and a fine remedy"

  • How can one thing also be two different things? Much alike Tethered Canvas and Isano Ku Isonga, Poetry illustrates how the known can coexist with the unknown or how the dark can coexist the light. The analogy of Pendulum telling about an unshaken momentum between two dual and extreme opposites. 

​FOR ALL:

You will love this book if you are a student of the universe, passionate about understanding the legacy contribution of the African Continent and its descendants towards global revolutions. Pendulum is for every person willing to shift into a conscious sharing of pain with the aim to find oneness within vulnerable and uncomfortable truths. 

Ultimately, I hope that [Pendulum] inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Who am I worthy to become?
  •  Why is my world also your world? And how do we find a bipartisanship in our being and living?
  • Where are we now, how did we get here, and where are we going?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing [collusive normalcy, unconscious conformity, and identity reconstruction ] will change us all for the better.

 

The Book - [Pendulum]


The book is written in 2 Parts....

Part [1] contains the introduction + additional chapters about the mediocre normalcy from which identities are constructed. Pendulum begins by leading an explosive discovery into the Eugenicist Psychology which emphasizes on biological superiority of certain human kinds. As a trajectory to purifying humanity, methods of religious doctrines, scientific human experiments, social, economic, and political motives subsequently result in a traumatic "us against them". This education legacy of passing on human trauma is copped with by a conscious conformity to structures of in-group identities. And by abiding to this collusive obedience, their is an outright righteously justified destruction of out-groups.

Part [2] contains Chapters where readers will learn to read in between the lines of the known and the unknown. This is the part about awakening to our worth and becoming. It leads the pendulum swing of thought into how to coexist together and find balance between the pain and pleasure  through stories about leaders and people we all call rebellious heroes. Conclusively, this part in rebelling heresy invites readers into a momentum of non-resistance within all that exists.

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in [December, 2020]

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this [Fall 2020]

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

Bruce Sakindi is the founder of Grow Up Smart Organization, a Non-Governmental Organization focused on building the potential of vulnerable youth in Rwanda, a Degree holder in Industrial and Organizational Psychology at Barry University in Miami, Florida, an avid world traveler and student of the universe.

He wrote this book because he is curious about the diversity of stories.  He wanted to explore how we embrace extremely opposite dualities as we meet the gift to choose. Choosing the title Pendulum is an imagery of the momentum swing of pendulum, going left to right, mirroring the that we know, we don't know. 

In his 22 years on this earth, Bruce has lived in Rwanda, Connecticut, Rome, and Miami. In between the third world, first world, modern worlds, and ancient worlds, he uncovered several thoughts about worth and way of being in our world. Bruce Sakindi is son to a liberation soldier and a genocide survivor, warriors of the 1994 Genocide Against the Tutsi. He is also the eldest brother to 2 sisters and 1 brother. He hopes writing Pendulum is an opportunity for others to share their journey of worth and living, as he quotes " between the world and me."

For more information you can connect with Bruce at [syrbrucesakindi@gmail.com] and [Linkedin: Bruce Sakindi, Twitter: Bsakindi, Instagram:syrbrucesakindi].

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use the hashtag [#Pendulum] and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Bruce Sakindi.

story:
Innovation. Creativity. Affordability. City Owl Press, co-founded by two award-winning author and editor friends, is a cutting edge indie publishing company, bringing the world of romance and speculative fiction to discerning readers. We believe in connecting every book with the right reader and every reader with the right book. See more about us at www.cityowlpress.com

City Owl Press is going to make a splash at the 2016 RT Booklovers Convention in Las Vegas. We are looking for funding to help us make our big entrance a success with strong marketing and advertising as well as to help our authors make a strong presence there. RT Booklovers Convention is one of the biggest industry events, bringing together thousands of romance authors and readers over the course of 5 days filled with fun events, informative workshops and panels and author/editor opportunities.

When you donate to help us and our authors grow, we will acknowledge your generous donations with a reward, as outlined in the Rewards section.

Our authors, editors, and staff appreciates each and every donation made and we thank you in advance!

(If you can't donate, we would love it and would appreciate it if you could spread the word about this campaign on social media!)

story:
Hello Internet

I am a blogger and social media enthusiast named Robert Headley. Like a lot of people, I am very connected online. I have 15,000 followers on Google+ which isn't alot compared to celebrities, but is a lot more than your average individual has. I love to connect, meet new people and create with them.

Before I started my current job, I was unemployed for about 3 months. During this time my internet bill got larger and larger. I did start paying on it when I got a job but it was too little, too late. Now I have a $250 aproximate bill that I have to pay off before I can get my internet back. I turn to the internet for support in this situation because the internet is my family. I tried creating paypal and other donation links but they seemed to get lost in the stream or were mostly ineffective.

My promise to you internet, is that if you fund this campaign and I am able to get my internet back, I will be sure to apply myself better than I ever have before. I am capable of much more than I have been doing in the past. No more, this will be a new me and you will have helped me become the new me.

Here is my about.me page. connect with me if you want. Just let me know why you are connecting with me. 

Any excess amount will towards me generating awesome content.

story:
I am a poet and storyteller from Baltimore, MD.

I am writing my first book, a poetry memoir called The Finder of Lost Things While Lost: Antonia Perdu, and I need your help. 
  • I need funding for promotion, publishing, and web-hosting.

To complete this book, I need.

    • $748 for Author Select Publishing Solution from Create Space
    • $144.10 Promotional tools from VistaPrint
    • $67.90 for website hosting fee from Weebly
    • $40 for the percentage hosting fee for indiegogo

  • You get thanks and perks with your contributions.  Check out the list. 
  • If I don't reach my goal in 60 days you will be refunded and I will start from square one.  If you contribute please share and spread the word. 

Project Impact

For me as a poet:  Completing this project will help me expand my career as a poet/storyteller.  Book-length publications are essential in this field, and I have yet to publish a book. 

  • I write for folks to read in their own voices so it's not solely for myself.  Someone out there may read something from me and be able to construct or mold how it applies to their life; it's importance and meaning to them (inspiration I hope).  
  •  I would like to publish books in the future in braille and extend performances with a sign language translator.  I would like to continue on a path of healing, empowering, and watering souls through my art. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this  IndieGoGo project link along can be a form of contributing.

  • You can hear audio of some of my previous works on https://soundcloud.com/djneondreamz
  • "Like" my facebook page "Antonia Perdu"
Thank you for your support!

You get thanks and perks with your contributions.  Check out the list. 
If I don't reach my goal in 60 days you will be refunded and I will start from square one.  If you contribute please share and spread the word. 
Project ImpactFor me as a poet:  Completing this project will help me expand my career as a poet/storyteller.  Book-length publications are essential in this field, and I have yet to publish a book. 
I write for folks to read in their own voices so it's not solely for myself.  Someone out there may read something from me and be able to construct or mold how it applies to their life; it's importance and meaning to them (inspiration I hope).  

 I would like to publish books in the future in braille and extend performances with a sign language translator.  I would like to continue on a path of healing, empowering, and watering souls through my art. 


Other Ways You Can HelpSharing this  IndieGoGo project link along can be a form of contributing.
You can hear audio of some of my previous works on https://soundcloud.com/djneondreamz

"Like" my facebook page "Antonia Perdu"
Thank you for your support!

story:
"Ma petite robe en wax" est un concept initié par la créatrice de la marque Mia Dreams. Nous inventons des vêtements élégants et confortables pour les femmes de toutes générations. 

Nos créations sont un somptueux mélange d’inspirations africaines et d’un chic à la parisienne, Toutes nos collections sont éditées en séries limitées  en vue de contribuer à un commerce raisonné, privilégiant l'originalité et l'exclusivité.

----

"My little dress in wax" is a concept from the creator of the Mia Dreams label, a chaine of ready made dress dedicated in satisfying the quest for comfort and elegance of women of all generation. Our design is a gorgeous mix of inspiration, unifying African and a "Chic" Parisian Style, in other to introduce authenticity to your wardrobe.These collections are produced in limited-series to satisfy an enthuised exclusive person.

 

Mia signifie Made In Africa, une volonté de garantir la provenance de nos produits mais également de promouvoir et mettre en avant les richesse, les traditions et le savoir-faire des artisans africains. Une valorisation qui est mis en lumière de façon très contemporaine à travers le vêtement.

 

Mia Dreams s’inscrit dans une démarche d'économie sociale et solidaire. Ainsi, l’entreprise travaille avec des artisans sénégalais pour la confection de ses vêtements et accessoires afin de promouvoir et soutenir les pays du Sud. Collaborer, dans un premier temps, avec un  pays africain tel que le Sénégal vise à :

- Proposer des conditions commerciales plus justes,
- Lutter contre la pauvreté en créant des emplois,
- Renforcer la position des artisans en leur ouvrant des marchés vers l'international pour obtenir une vie meilleure. 

----

MIA an acronym for Made In Africa, a drive in guaranteeing the source of our product and also to promote and to put-in-place the tradition and savoir-faire of African artisans. An enhancement that has put-to-light a very contemporary way of clothing.

 

MIA Dreams is based on the approach/move for social economy and solidarity. In this way the enterprise work with Senegalese artisans for the manufacturing of clothings and accessories so as to promote and support this part of the continent. At the forefront to collaborate witht Africa's number one country of which is Senegal, by ;

-  Proposing fairest business condition

- Lutte against poverty by creating employment,

- Reinforcing creators postion by introdcuing them to the international market so as to obtain a better life.

​

 

NOUS AVONS OUVERT LA BOUTIQUE MIA DREAMS AU 14 RUE MARCADET 75018 PARIS EN OCTOBRE 2015

----

OUR BOUTIQUE MIA DREAMS HAS BEEN OPEN IN OCTOBER 2015 IN PARIS

 

 

Une vision alternative de l’industrie de la mode 

 

La démarche forte du commerce équitable

Par notre action, nous voulons participer à créer un nouvel écosystème qui permettrait de développer de façon pérenne et différente le marché actuel de l’industrie du textile dans les pays émergents. Notre pierre à l’édifice est un projet fort, qui donne

  • accès à l’emploi,
  • la formation professionnelle,
  • la juste rémunération,
  • la mutuelle de santé,
  • l’épargne salariale,
  • la validation des acquis de l’expérience et
  • l’apprentissage de la langue française (oral et écrit) et
  • donne priorité aux jeunes femmes. 

Mais parce que notre action ne s’arrête pas à Dakar, nous souhaiterions sensibiliser nos clientes à l’importance d’une consommation plus responsable par le biais d’outils connectés comme l’application mobile Ma petite robe en wax. 

----

An alternative vision for fashion industry

A strong move for equitable business.

By our action, we would like to participate in creating a new ecosystem that would allow develop the present market of the textile industry in the emerging market in a durable and different way. Our building block is a strong project, that creates avenue for employment, proffessional training, a fair pay cheque, health insurance, savings, accreditation of prior experiental learning and apprenticeship of French AND English language learning ( speaking and writing) and gives priority to young women. Also as our action does not stop at Darkar, we hope to raise our client's awareness of the importance of more responsible consumption by the use of tools in form of mobile application like Ma Petite Robe en Wax.

Our project brings people, talents and culture together by works and valued ethics. It is a run-up of solidarity that creates a passage between countries of north and south. Today's world vision is seen to be a melting-pot around fashion.

 

  

Notre projet rassemble les hommes, les talents, les cultures par le travail et des valeurs éthiques. C'est un élan de solidarité, qui crée une passerelle entre les pays du nord et du sud. Une vision du monde actuel se traduisant par un melting-pot autour de la mode

4 AXES POUR DÉFINIR LE CONCEPT

"MA PETITE ROBE EN WAX"

La mode haute gamme africaine n’a jamais été aussi cool et aussi easy grâce à l’application mobile « ma petite robe en wax » dont le concept est basé sur quatre axes:

African High-end fashion has never been this cool and simple if not for the (Ma petite robe en wax) mobile application, of which the concept is base on four approach:

1. Le sur-mesure/Custom-made:                                                                                                                                                        

Nous vous permettons d'avoir une robe adapté à votre morphologie, et de la personnaliser à votre goût grâce à une multitude de choix quant à l'encolure, les manches, la longueur de la robe...

You are allowed to have a perfect-fit dress that suits your morphology, you can also customize it to your taste with the help of multitude of choice available from the Collar, the sleeves and the length of the dress.

       

      

 

2. Le choix d'un tissu/Choice of fabric:                                                                                                Du wax en veux-tu en voilà! L’application permettra à chaque femme de sélectionner un tissu wax parmi un large choix de motifs qui racontent différentes histoires à l’esprit fun, et sont un véritable miroir social. 

----

Which wax do you want, right here! The application allows you to select a wax fabric among a wide range of pattern that tells different stories in a lively manner, and they are true social lens.

 

                  Sac Madame Obama      L’œil de ma rivale          L'hirondelle

                  

 

3. La confection/The tailoring:     

Des artisans africains qui mettent leur savoir-faire à votre disposition  et se charge de vous confectionner  à la main  avec le plus grand soin et de façon artisanal pour vous permettre d’obtenir la robe de vos rêves  et créer ce lien qui fait de vous une Consom'Actrice. 

----

African designers that have put together their Know-how at your service to give you a complete hand-made tailoring with the greatest care and a pattern of handicraft so as to bring to you the dress of your dream and creating the link that makes you an Actress'Consummer.

4. Prix abordable/Affordable price:        

 Le luxe d'avoir une robe sur mesure n'est plus réservé à une certaine élite. Nous réintégrons l'équilibre en créant un point de rencontre centrale entre créateurs et consom'acteurs des produits en wax tout en faisant la transparence  sur la fabrication.

----

The luxury of having a custome made dress is no longer reserved to a certain elite. We reintegrate the balance by creating a meeting-point between the creators and the Actress'Consummers of wax product, just by making the manufacturing process transparent.

 

NOUS TRANSFORMONS L'ORDINAIRE EN EXCEPTIONNELLE ET FAISONS EN SORTE QUE LE SUR-MESURE SOIT UN LUXE ACCESSIBLE À TOUS

WE TRANSFORM THE ORDINARY TO EXTRA-ORDINARY IN SUCH A WAY THAT CUSTOM MADE BECOMES A LUXURY ACCESSIBLE AND AFFORDABLE TO ALL

 

COMMENT ÇA FONCTIONNE?/HOW DOES IT WORK?

Intuitive, simple d’utilisation et sécurisée, avec l'application mobile "Ma petite robe en wax" surfer  simplement afin de réaliser votre vision de la robe parfaite.

Vous choisissez votre tissus, sélectionnez votre modèle de robe sur la base de trois coupes et vous la personnaliser grâce aux différentes options de col, manche...,  vous entrez vos mensurations (des vidéos tutorielles seront mises à disposition pour vous aider), et vous lancer votre commande qui est pris en charge par un de nos artisans maître tailleur. 

----

Our mobile application which is intuitive, easy to use and secured has been put in place as a platform In order to help you acchieve the perfect vision of your kind of dress. You choose your fabric, select the model of dress base on three section and then you customize using different option of colar, sleeves, etc..

You click in your measurements(video tutorial will be at your disposal to guide you), then you can forward your order which will be receive by one of our chief designer. This mobile application creates a central meeting-point between designers and the clients of the wax world, facilitates the distribution of the multicultural product only by promoting the transparency of manufacturing in wax and the work of the African Artisan in their tailoring.

 

 

        EASY DRESS        TUBE DRESS          TOP DRESS

    confort et  élégance     classe et sexy    chic et tendance

     

 

----

MA PETITE ROBE EN WAX

La mode autrement, la mode qui rassemble

The alternative fashion, The fashion that unifies

100% MADE IN AFRICA

----

 

Envie de rêver, envie de s'évader?

Alors la petite robe wax est faite pour vous ! A l'instar du jean, de la robe noire ou de la chemise blanche, la petite robe en wax est le Must Have de toute garde-robe digne de ce nom.

Que vous ayez 5 ans ou 95 ans, que vous soyez grande ou petite, fine ou ronde, asiatique ou africaine, la petite robe en wax n'a pas de frontière !

Universelle et démocratisée, la petite robe en wax fait tomber les préjugés et réconcilie toutes les femmes avec l'Afrique et ce qu'elle a de beau à offrir. 

----

Wish to Dream? Wish to break-out?

Then La petite robe en wax is made for you! In Jean, black dress or white shirt, la petite robe en wax is a "Must Have" in all wardrobe worthy of it's kind.

Whether you are 5 or 95 years old, Tall or Short, slim or thick, Asian or African. La petite robe en wax doesn't have boundaries! Universal and accessible, La petite robe en wax defeats all biases and reconcilles all women with Africa and the beautiful things she have to offer.

 

 

TOUTES LES CONTREPARTIES SERONT PERSONNALISÉES À PARTIR D'UN CHOIX DE TISSU

ALL COMPENSATION WILL BE INDIVIDUALIZED FROM BASE ON CHOICE OF FABRIC

 

HEADBAND

 

SNOOD

  

 

MA POCHETTE NARI

    modèle 1                                 modèle 2 

   

 

CACHE-COL MIXTE TERRANGA

 

                                   

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

EASY DRESS

 

A QUOI VONT SERVIR LES FONDS?

50% des fonds collectés serviront à finaliser l'application mobile, que se soit au niveau du design, et toute la logistique à mettre en place pour qu'elle soit  sécurisée, dynamique, intuitive et ainsi vous proposer un maximum d'options.

 Grâce à votre soutien 25% des dons serviront à la réalisation de vos pré-commandes

22% de vos dons serviront à nous permettre d'obtenir une structure plus grande et plus adaptée pour accueillir tous les artisans dans des meilleurs conditions à Dakar dans des locaux de 200m2 

À PROPOS DE LA FONDATRICE

   

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Khady SY SAVANE, créatrice et Fondatrice de la marque Mia Dreams une ligne de prêt à porter qui propose un univers coloré au style parisien et ethnique. Les pièces confectionnées artisanalement promeut un concept fort, éthique et 100% Made in Africa.

Après plusieurs boutiques éphémère, des ventes-privées, des défilés et un corner d'exposition au Printemps, la créatrice autodidacte, ouvre sa première boutique en octobre 2015 dans le quartier dynamique et cosmopolite de la Goutte d'or au 14 rue Marcadet Paris 18. 

Elle préside également l'association Collectif Fusionailes, un réseau de femmes entrepreneurs qui a pour objectif de promouvoir l'entraide, l'échange, le partage et la solidarité afin de mettre en lumière l'artisanat d'ailleurs et un savoir-faire.

 

J'APPARTIENS A UN RICHE ÉCOSYSTÈME

story:
Amigdala

Nell'epoca in cui viviamo la tecnologia si evolve a una tale velocità da far sembrare l'uomo che la interpreta come Achille che rincorre la tartaruga. Per orientarsi all'interno di uno sconvolgimento del genere è necessaria una risposta istintuale, concentrata sulla percezione fenomenologica delle metamorfosi in atto, una trattazione che si sviluppi attraverso l'elaborazione critica di un'esperienza generazionale. Le pagine di Amigdala affrontano il tema della realtà virtuale, della nuova cultura fotografica e delle trasformazioni dell'identità all'interno dell'era dei social network.

Si può leggere un estratto qui.

Il Varco Edizioni

Il Varco nasce nel 2014 dall'associazione di giovani artisti emergenti a Roma, diventando poi, negli anni, una casa di produzione indipendente di cinema, editoria ed eventi. Dal 2014 ad oggi abbiamo prodotto, in maniera totalmente indipendente:

  • Tre cortometraggi ed un lungometraggio (Onyricon, Memorie di un viaggiatore, Per un pugno di spicci, Polvere)
  • Un'antologia di poesie e racconti (L'aria che tira, 2014) e un romanzo (Uomomordecane di Massimiliano Zulli)
  • Un festival di cortometraggi, una biennale d'arte e numerosi eventi culturali. 
  • Un blog che conta più di 2 milioni di visite da aprile 2014 e più di 11mila Mi Piace su facebook.

Ulteriori info sul sito ufficiale. 

L'autore

Andrea Gatopoulos (Pescara, 11 aprile 1994) è fotografo, regista e autore. Laureato con lode in Letteratura, Musica e Spettacolo all’università La Sapienza, lavora principalmente a Roma, dove ha fondato l’associazione Il Varco attraverso la quale produce e promuove i suoi lavori. Amigdala è il suo primo libro.  Ulteriori info e curriculum sul sito internet.
story_txt:
Amigdala

Nell'epoca in cui viviamo la tecnologia si evolve a una tale velocità da far sembrare l'uomo che la interpreta come Achille che rincorre la tartaruga. Per orientarsi all'interno di uno sconvolgimento del genere è necessaria una risposta istintuale, concentrata sulla percezione fenomenologica delle metamorfosi in atto, una trattazione che si sviluppi attraverso l'elaborazione critica di un'esperienza generazionale. Le pagine di Amigdala affrontano il tema della realtà virtuale, della nuova cultura fotografica e delle trasformazioni dell'identità all'interno dell'era dei social network.
Si può leggere un estratto qui.

Il Varco Edizioni
Il Varco nasce nel 2014 dall'associazione di giovani artisti emergenti a Roma, diventando poi, negli anni, una casa di produzione indipendente di cinema, editoria ed eventi. Dal 2014 ad oggi abbiamo prodotto, in maniera totalmente indipendente:

Tre cortometraggi ed un lungometraggio (Onyricon, Memorie di un viaggiatore, Per un pugno di spicci, Polvere)
Un'antologia di poesie e racconti (L'aria che tira, 2014) e un romanzo (Uomomordecane di Massimiliano Zulli)
Un festival di cortometraggi, una biennale d'arte e numerosi eventi culturali. 
Un blog che conta più di 2 milioni di visite da aprile 2014 e più di 11mila Mi Piace su facebook.

Ulteriori info sul sito ufficiale. 

L'autore
Andrea Gatopoulos (Pescara, 11 aprile 1994) è fotografo, regista e autore. Laureato con lode in Letteratura, Musica e Spettacolo all’università La Sapienza, lavora principalmente a Roma, dove ha fondato l’associazione Il Varco attraverso la quale produce e promuove i suoi lavori. Amigdala è il suo primo libro.  Ulteriori info e curriculum sul sito internet.

story:
Short Summary

Let’s talk about representation and being heard as individuals! As Asian Americans who grew up in the Bay Area, we saw a gap in the way our stories are packaged and shared with the rest of the world. In a society where “Crazy Rich Asians,” a wonderful film that we love, is deemed a pivotal moment that brought the Asian experience to the rest of the world, we can’t help but feel like there’s still much more to be done and many more stories to tell. We have to keep the momentum going. To be Asian is so many things and it can look so many different ways. Our community cannot be painted with one broad stroke. Since modern society moves slowly to address gaps in representation, we decided to create and tell the stories we’ve been missing. We want to foster deeper connections with the people around us. We’re committed to changing our narrative - one story at a time. Our visual storytelling platform aims to highlight the different perspectives, cultures and individual experiences that go beyond a label of our identities. We invite you to join the conversation.

What We Need & What You Get

The founders of More Than Asian need additional funds to compensate some of the creatives that will be instrumental in bringing this project to life: photographers (shooting & post-production), stylists, illustrators/graphic designers, copywriting editors, UX consultants.

With your help, we can create an accessible blog and Instagram profile that will foster more diverse storytelling within the Asian American community. We are committed to creating a space of transparency, empowerment and community that brings to light a more inclusive narrative for Asian Americans. 

The Impact

Our Reason For Being:

More Than Asian is a conversation starter focused on Asian Millennial identities and experiences, drawing connections within communities and individual spaces. We visually stimulate and empower our audience through positive, open and diverse storytelling.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute funds, please follow our Instagram @morethanasian and tell your friends about our upcoming project! Thank you for taking the time to learn more about us.

story:
In support of The Generalist - Taboo 4: Angle of the Angels and the Thomas Duder vending booth in Portland's Comic-Con!

First and foremost, this is the fifth episode in the action-adventure, urban fantasy novella series known as "The Generalist."  It's a rip-roaring rollercoaster ride through a Neo-Los Angelos of the near future, full of amazing battle sequences and witty dialogue that is sure to drill itself into your heart before festering and killing you.

But hey, at least you'll enjoy it!

"Monsters, magic, morons, misfits, martial arts, miscreants, misfits and more!"

Now, where does Indiegogo and YOU come into play?

Project 4 is the culmination of two years hard work, of getting the series edited and published to the point where I can release the Generalis Omnibus volume 1 (the first four Taboo episodes, plus four short stories/novellas and other goodies to fit in there), release Taboos 2 and 3 (the Mayhem Arc), and, above all, properly equip a vending booth for Portland Comic-Con.

My team and I are right at the edge of infamy, ready to take that plunge towards marketing, advertising, and more...but we need YOUR help!

$1000 is what we need to finish Project 4.

Get in on it for some fabulous literary prizes!

~Thomas Duder, Author of the Things

story:
Who We Are 

Zymbol was founded in May 2012 to house new and groundbreaking art and literature inspired by symbolism and surrealism. 

We celebrated the launch of our first issue in March 2013 at the AWP Conference in Boston, and we were recognized as a US 501(c)3 non-profit soon after. 

Since March 2014, we've been working with mainstream distributors, placing Zymbol in over 100 US bookstores, and in the hands of international subscribers.

We now share free excerpts of art, writing, and multimedia from our print issues on our website, zymbol.org.

Cover of Issue 3, with art by Carrie Ann Baade

Where We Go

  • AWP Conferences
  • Brooklyn Book Festival
  • Massachusetts Poetry Festival
  • International Academic Conferences
  • Harvard Book Store Warehouse Sales
  • Salem Literary Salon Series

We organize free, public readings and book launches to share the work of our contributors with the world.

What We Do

In the last few years, we've shared with you the work of artists and writers from over 20 countries, who have, after being discovered by the magazine, published award-winning books, opened solo shows, and spoken at various conferences and festivals. 

Broadening to an international focus has drawn our attention to the unique cultural phenomena and social issues our authors in various countries encounter, and we want to bring their news to our readers. 

We're working on a special, full-color, illustrated issue of Zymbol, which will shine a spotlight on current events in the arts, and celebrate our global community of artists and writers with multimedia collaborations.

Your contributions can make this project a reality, and ensure a robust future for Zymbol. Thank you for your support!

Marcello Castellani, Cover Artist for the upcoming issue of Zymbol

What We Need 

We're asking for $8,000 — it sounds like a lot, so we'll break down exactly what it will go towards.

  • Printing Zymbol for 2 years (including special color issue) — $5,200. 
  • Distributing all the issues to contributors and students — $1,000.
  • Releasing eBook versions of Zymbol & free content on zymbol.org — $800.
  • Hosting free public literary events at 3 festivals — $1,000.
What your money will NOT go towards: Paying us, the editors — we are proud volunteers! 

TAX-DEDUCTIBLE DONATIONS! When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving, our nonprofit payments processor, confirming the tax-deductible status of your contribution. 

What Happens If We Exceed Our Goal?

We will co-sponsor awards for aspiring international artists & writers to further their craft through education, artist residencies, or exhibitions/publications.

What You Get

Perks for donating include:
  • Handwritten letters of thanks from our editors
  • Recognition on our website and in print issues
  • Limited-edition poster prints from Zymbol artists
  • Hard-to-find back issues of Zymbol
  • Personalized book selections from our editors (with free eBook download)
  • Tote bags with nifty surreal sayings
  • Subscriptions to the 2015 issues
  • Original art pieces by Founding Editor Anne James

Limited edition fine art poster print by Susanne Iles, one of the perks we're offering to those donating $25 or more! 

Limited edition fine art poster print by Marcello Castellani, one of the perks we're offering to those donating $25 or more! 

The Global Impact

We are a group of friends from different countries with the same vision: Art and literature with shared sources of inspiration, shared social responsibility, and shared pages in Zymbol.

story:
Hello, my name is Taylor Rhodes. I am nineteen years old living in Central Virginia, tucked in between robin's egg blue mountains and swirling rivers. I photograph everything. I write as if my veins produce ink. I’m a hippie at heart and the Blue Ridge Mountains are my idols. And all I want out of life is happiness and a hard copy of my book in people’s delicate hands. I began writing these bits of craziness on Facebook using the “Note” feature, since my blog on MySpace was dead and I was bored with scribbling in journals. They begin one hundred and fifty-six days since I last self-harmed on January twenty-fourth, two thousand and ten.

 

I thought “Hey, what the heck? Why not write an online blog? All the cool kids are doing it!” *poke nudge wink wink* I get to put my thoughts and such out there, into this wacky world of ours, and maybe be able to be there for others. And then it turned into this book. Regardless of how it pans out, I haven’t figured out the secret formula for happiness. I’ve matured and realized that love is a difficult commodity to come by and not everyone loves as deeply as you do. I’ve experienced moments that feel the way chocolate tastes and I’ve suffered through the not so great gritty bits. I’m able to look back on my life and see the transformation from wobbly spud to flow and flitter. This is my teeny tiny life in your teeny tiny fingers and we are now connected in this teeny tiny world. This is how it happened, with these people and these songs and these tissue paper apologies and these mornings cloaked in star matter. This book will explore and expose my life, day by day. It's a mess of brutal honesty and heart wrenching emotion. I've twisted my way through the turmoil and have come here to share my story with you all, in the hopes that I will be able to reach out to at least one delicate being in this teeny tiny world and make them feel understood and loved and oh so whole. I just… I want to be there and be heard. I need to.

What I Need and What You Get

I need help with funds. I’m going to self-publish since I don’t have tens of thousands of dollars to send in manuscripts via agent and hope they are accepted. This is my only option. I will spend the money on creating copies through Lulu Publishing and on promotion. Each book will be about twenty-three dollars apiece to produce. I’d like to order a nice bulk order to sell myself, and have money to buy more and use for shipping costs. I also have to factor in the percentage Indiegogo will take from this. Even if the goal isn’t met, ALL donations will be used for this project and this project only. Scout’s honor. I’m much too invested to be a sneaky witch.

PERKS!

A donation of twenty-five USD will get you a personalized copy of the book.

A donation of sixty USD will get a mention in my book and a personalized copy. [MENTION IS NOW GONE DUE TO REVISIONS BEING FINISHED. YOU CAN STILL DONATE, BUT THE MENTION IS NOT AVAILABLE]

A donation of one hundred USD will get an 8x10 print of their choosing from my photography on my Facebook profile, a mention in the book, and a personalized book. [I’ll help you set up those details, no problem. Just let me know and I can add you to my page so you can choose. c: [MENTION IS NOW GONE DUE TO REVISIONS BEING FINISHED. YOU CAN STILL DONATE, BUT THE MENTION IS NOT AVAILABLE

*Personalized means I will sign in, write to you in the front cover, and include a dried flower/herb, maybe your own poem. All kinds of heartwarming things.

This book is something I hope will be a dog-eared glimmer of hope under the covers with someone late at night when they can’t stop shaking and need to be understood.

If You Can’t Send Money

Don’t worry! Just share my campaign! Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter, Instagram, email, text, however you can! I appreciate any help I can get. This has a sixty day funding period which should end the day after my twentieth birthday. And don’t forget to use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

Much love and buttery warmth, Taylor Rhodes

story:
The purpose of this campaign is to re-release my epic fantasy series, The Chronicles of Parthalan. To make a long story short, two of the books were previously released, then I encountered a bump in the road. I have since had my rights returned. Now, I aim to release the entire six book series, beginning in June 2014. Here is the blurb for the first in the series (of note, the image above is the ebook cover for Heir to the Sun, for which I retain full rights. New artwork will be commissioned for the relaunch):

Heir to the Sun

The Faerie King has entered into a pact with the demon lord, trading his people's freedom for the might to conquer the nine realms. Two unlikely allies are determined to stop him: Asherah, enslaved by demons, and Caol'nir, a warrior sworn to defend the king.

When Asherah, stripped of both her memory and her dignity, learns that King Sahlgren is responsible for her captivity, she leads her fellow slaves in a daring escape and burns their prison to the ground. Then she learns that there are many more prisons across Parthalan, and embarks upon a campaign to free every last faerie.

In stark contrast to Asherah's struggles, Caol'nir lives the comfortable life of a temple guard. He is sworn to serve and defend the king, as his ancestors have done since time immemorial. Now a priestess has been murdered, and Caol'nir learns that Sahlgren's scheming is to blame. Determined to thwart the king, sacred oath or no, Caol'nir joins Asherah's rebellion. What Caol'nir doesn't know is that Sahlgren has promised the demon lord a woman of rare and singular beauty, a woman who is rumored to be the sun god's daughter. She also happens to be Caol'nir's mate.

The following five titles are:

The Virgin Queen

Latera’s Song

Rise of the Deva’shi

Golem

Elfsong


What will this money go toward?

All funds donated will go toward editing the series and cover art. My artist of choice? The uber-talented Rhea Ewing of Mystic Sheep Studios. Check out her work here: http://rheaewing.com/

I'm also looking to commission some interior art, and I would just love to have Slake Saunders involved. A sampling of her work can be found here: http://looklooklookitabook.deviantart.com/

How can you become a part of The Chronicles of Parthalan? I’m glad you asked! Suggested donation amounts are below, although please feel free to contribute whatever you’d like. Every bit helps!

story:
UPDATE: Thanks to everyone who helped us raise funding to publish Dark Mountain: Issue 1!

The book is now back from the printers, so we’re closing this campaign – you can order a copy through the Dark Mountain Project website.

If you donated through IndieGoGo, your copy should be with you very soon! Thanks again for making this book possible.

In July 2009, we published Uncivilisation: The Dark Mountain Manifesto – funded by an online campaign which raised $1800 in three weeks.

The manifesto argued that “sustainability” had become a delusional attempt to preserve a collapsing way of living, that “the end of the world as we know it is not the end of the world full stop”, and that writers, artists and all whose work is rooted in the imagination have a particular role to play as we navigate the transition to the unknown world ahead.

It was read around the world, reviewed in publications from The Independent to the Australian Financial Review. We were called “crazy collapsitarians” and “dangerous romantics”, but we also got thousands of emails from people for whom its message resonated deeply: activists tired of pretending that one more push would do it, writers sick of a literary culture of clever cynicism, people looking for the hope beyond hope.

Now we’ve gathered a collection of stories, essays and poems exploring the territory beyond the edge of what we have called civilisation. Dark Mountain will feature essays from Ran Prieur, JM Greer, Jay Griffiths and Alastair McIntosh, poetry from Melanie Challenger and Mario Petrucci, and an interview with Derrick Jensen.

The Dark Mountain Project has no external funding. The printing costs come to around £4500 and our bank account currently has about £600 in it. This campaign was launched to raise this money – and we’re happy to announce that we’ve now done so.

We want to open a conversation about the world we’re heading into and the stories we need to make sense of it. Please join us in making that conversation possible!

The manifesto argued that “sustainability” had become a delusional attempt to preserve a collapsing way of living, that “the end of the world as we know it is not the end of the world full stop”, and that writers, artists and all whose work is rooted in the imagination have a particular role to play as we navigate the transition to the unknown world ahead.
It was read around the world, reviewed in publications from The Independent to the Australian Financial Review. We were called “crazy collapsitarians” and “dangerous romantics”, but we also got thousands of emails from people for whom its message resonated deeply: activists tired of pretending that one more push would do it, writers sick of a literary culture of clever cynicism, people looking for the hope beyond hope.
Now we’ve gathered a collection of stories, essays and poems exploring the territory beyond the edge of what we have called civilisation. Dark Mountain will feature essays from Ran Prieur, JM Greer, Jay Griffiths and Alastair McIntosh, poetry from Melanie Challenger and Mario Petrucci, and an interview with Derrick Jensen.
The Dark Mountain Project has no external funding. The printing costs come to around £4500 and our bank account currently has about £600 in it. This campaign was launched to raise this money – and we’re happy to announce that we’ve now done so.
We want to open a conversation about the world we’re heading into and the stories we need to make sense of it. Please join us in making that conversation possible!

story:
YOU CAN SEE THE WHOLE CAMPAIGN BELOW, but now the chance to buy the completed and renamed novel Dragons In The Post, which will be available this year.  It has gone to main stream publishers too, so if it is picked up, a strictly limited edition will be produced, with your names in the front too.


THE SUCCESSFUL CAMPAIGN:

JUST MAGNIFICENT, we've done it, together, and over 100% funded!  But you can still contribute to DRAGON IN THE POST, own a unique book but also open a doorway on a little publisher, until the project runs down on Indiegogo.  Then the fight and adventure goes on too though, so when time runs out here you can go straight to Phoenix Ark Press instead and pick up several of the perks at  Pre-Ordering Dragon In The Post


THE BOOK AND PUBLISHING PROJECT

Hear about David and the project on BBC Radio (at 1:11:40) by clicking on The Katie Martin Show

THEN OWN a unique, hard copy edition of a fairy tale, the first in a series of six, by best selling fantasy author David Clement-Davies - "Dragon In The Post", signed, with your name in the front and sent to you - in the post!  Easy.

You'll have helped an award winning writer to finish and publish it, by March next year, but will also be helping an ambition to change the face of modern publishing, reach through the Internet and get back to real books and authors.  

You will also be helping to bring David's classic novel Fire Bringer back into hard copy print availability in the UK, after 12 years on the shelves with Macmilan.

Together we can build a little Indie publisher then, Phoenix Ark Press and perhaps launch many crowd funded ideas to support other writers and artists. You heard it here and whatever age we need your support, passion and creativity!

Meanwhile David is walking the South Downs Way and there is a charity element in the £50 perk, for the RNIB or you can back a charity alone at JustGiving.com/David-Clement-Davies

  "JOIN THE STORY, BECOME PART OF THE ADVENTURE..." in very many ways

Project ends - August 27th!

DCD's novels Firebringer, The Sight, Fell, The Telling Pool and The Alchemists of Barbal have sold over 400,000 copies and been highly praised worldwide, winning awards and starred reviews.  He has been translated into German, Italian, French, Latvian and Russian. Praise For The Works of David Clement-Davies:  "Riveting...deserves to be widely read "- Richard Adams, author of Watership Down.  "Gripping and engrossing...rich, lucid and sure to win loyal readers." - VOYA.  "Compelling ambience and marvelously credible characterizations." - BOOKLIST, starred review.  You can see the comments of readers and backers who have been fundamental to making this happen at the end.


LISTEN TO DRAGON IN THE POST AT PHOENIX ARK PRESS OR READ SOME OF THE STORY NOW - DRAGON IN THE POST:

Click for AUDIO READING

TEXT

"THERE was a brilliant fire in the London evening that burned outside the oily kitchen window like a growing ribbon of blood-red light, cut with bruising purple clouds and smoking over the great tower on that building Gareth’s dad always told him was called Parliament. Where all those funny people met, MPs or PMs, or something, to talk and fight and do whatever they do. It rose there, with its boldly waving flag, the Union Jack, and its funny, pointy turrets. To Gareth Marks, gazing sadly through the grimy little window, it looked almost medieval, like that dumb book he'd seen..." 

So, since we like our authors organic, that Egg box arrives, except that one of the eggs is larger than the others and strangely blue, out of which hatches something very remarkable indeed-

"Gareth Marks could have fallen over, when the thing seemed to burp, a little puff of black-grey smoke came out of its beak, and then, as if it was swelling, it shrugged off its casing, in a shower of breaking egg shell and stood up in the brown egg box and the remains of its broken home. The little creature raised its beak as if to sing and uncurling a pair of tiny blue, leathery wings, only slightly sticky with a glistening slime, it unfurled a minute club ended tail too, that waved about like that flag on the House of Commons. In the Class A, organic egg box, Gareth Marks was suddenly looking down at a real, live dragon in the post. "

NOW READ ON AS THE AUTHOR WRITES IT: Don't forget that there is much more of the adventure already up on Wattpad .  This project is genuinely being hatched as it happens, so the story will be written only if we achieve our goal. Help us do that now.


THE PROJECT IN GREATER DEPTH:

HELP MAKE A BOOK AND BECOME A DRAGON!

This is a very personal indie publishing project by best selling British fantasy author David Clement-Davies to bring out a specific signed First Edition book and story "Dragon In The Post", with your name in the front,that you can read part of right now by clicking the blue link to Wattpad.  

It tells the tale of Gareth Marks, a troubled 12 year old who one day gets an Organic egg box in the post from his Godfather Pendelion Pumfrey's farm and out of it hatches a Firecutter, a little blue she Dragon, whose fiery breath cuts a doorway into another world, filled with Dragons, magic, mystery and adventure, as well as some very strange Dragon Chefs!   The mission is to finish that partly blogged story and turn it into a real book, not just a souless Ebook, and send it out to you and others, in the post.


THE MISSION AND VISION BEYOND JUST ONE BOOK - PHOENIX ARK PRESS AND HATCHING A REALLY ORGANIC PUBLISHER?

Dragon In The Post will be our very first hard copy book under the label Phoenix Ark Press, which is guided by the spirit of animal stories and already has an established cultural blog, also publishing David's printed novels as eBooks.  But there and here we also want to spread the word and start a grass roots fire, in a reaction to much of the awfulness of the internet and online too, so forging a new path in crowd funded publishing and real books. Partly using the medium of Social Media to talk through its own empty noise and reach real people again.  There is a place for eBooks but essentially we want to get back to  real books, sent to you in the post! So why not contribute what you can, at Perk levels or more and "Join the story and become part of the adventure"?  

The bigger your support for Dragon In The Post though, the more likely you will help open a magic door on a whole publisher and several thrilling projects beyond Gareth's fable:  From David's epic polar bear fantasy Light of The White Bear, to a beautiful book on the Carol The 12 Days of Christmas to unique non-fiction work on London in the 16th Century and William Shakespeare's unknown brother Edmund, who died in 1607 in mysterious circumstances, called Looking For Edmund.  They are all David's own ideas and projects waiting in the wings, hoping to lead the field in trying to then draw in other writers and artists and build a new model in grass roots publishing.

If we hit our target on the Dragon then it will also guarantee that we will start to roll out other crowd funded efforts, so your interest and support are vital, as a younger person or older reader and whether interested in great fiction or  in factual books. To justify a Flexible Funding model too at Indiegogo, which means money is definitely drawn down, rather than having to cross a finish line, and as part of this project  itself David's classic fantasy Fire Bringer will be brought back into hard copy print, after 12 years publishing success with Macmillan in the UK. He does not believe it should have been taken out of print. Perhaps his younger ebook fantasy The Terror Time Spies will be printed too, for the very first time. That means your money will definitely go to Phoenix Ark Press and be well spent, so every penny helps and counts! 

As for Flexible Funding, if an all or nothing model gives an important psychological incentive  to 'cross a finishing line', so not risking your contributions either, please understand that here the psychology of hitting that target is vital too, because this is not asking for hand outs, but passion and engagement.  Meanwhile we need to see that a model can really work in trying to establish a new way of 'paying it forward' and protecting committed artists.  Publishers take commercial gambles by investing in writers with advances, big or small, as well as production costs, but we are asking readers and the public to do that instead.  Editors' rewards are both the artistic satisfaction, and jobs and profits inside firms, while yours is the artistic satisfaction, if you think the Dragon good, but also the perks that we are offering and being part of a grass roots movement too.  Meanwhile the Indiegogo model means that it is important to hit that 4.5k target too, because only if we do so will Indiegogo take a 5% rather than a 9% cut of the total raised. 

David has also put in a special Opt Out clause though,  as a mark of honour, which means if we don't get very close indeed to the goal David will personally refund your money, if you want, although he hopes you understand that Indiegogo takes a % operating cut.   Here there is great ambition  for Phoenix Ark Press too, which is is why, although we have set a very modest goal of 4.5k, to give David some money as he finishes the story of Dragon In The Post, create the print run, find an editor, pay a great illustrator properly and then to send it out to you in the post, along with the other perks, we have set an unofficial target too of 6k-10k to help us really fly. In this real life publishing story then the more raised really is the key to more and more creativity. Here we're bursting with ideas and creative projects and want to make David's label at Phoenix Ark Press 'your publisher', so that you will be part of something truly organic.


Steph's brilliant creation for the Dragon In The Post,  both a fan and part of a great Street Team that you can join now on Facebook.  Go to David's page there, Like the page "Stories in The Post - The Dragon Tries Again' or ask to join the Phoenix Ark Press group. 

We have many plans to make Phoenix Ark a successful little business too, from a Friends of Phoenix Ark scheme offering future benefits and discounts, to plans for beautifully designed PA sweatshirts, inspired by The Poet's Sweatshop blogging poetry online, with your favourite quotes on them and where you can literally 'wear your art on your sleeve', to very unique perks too: like joining a Phoenix Ark crowd funding hall of fame, to hooking up with a passionate fan-base, speaking directly with  authors, or coming to launch parties in London. With the highest pledges, start to consider yourself as a Dragon investor to highly creative people then and see how you can directly participate.  During the campaign new pictures and videos will be put up as well and more of the story blogged online.

THE PERSONAL PUBLISHING STORY

This is a very personal fight for David too, who saw a highly successful career blocked and effectively wrecked in very particular circumstances in New York and who is deeply uncomfortable with much online and the shifting publishing landscape of the Internet and ebooks, all becoming such a challenge to the written word and to a whole reading culture.  So, as we all know, such a threat to musicians, writers and artists everywhere. The truth of big business and mass marketing nowadays too means that editors are often far more interested in fighting for their own jobs and riding particular successes, than they are in standing up for books of cultural value or the authors who make them.   So why not help build a publisher created by writers and artists themselves - Phoenix Ark Press?  The Phoenix is of course that mythical bird that rises from the ashes and the Ark a symbol both of journeying and protection, so help one committed author challenge the system too and get his voice back.  Then see a small and passionate publisher back his stories and cross support many publishing ideas, as it strikes a blow for real books again, on the shelves and in the post!

A still from the animation of the eggbox from Pumfrey Farm. Can you help hatch both a real book and a little organic publisher?


What We Need & What You Get

What we need is your passion for reading and for real stories and books, but also your direct  contributions, large or small,  younger or older. First to guarantee and build the fan base around this specific novel, blogged in part on line, then for a personalised publisher itself and the other books Phoenix  and you will make together.  That first book will be retailed to the general public as well, so treat a contribution as a kind of pre-order for a novel, a thing to have and cherish, that you helped to make and with your name inside. 

We are ambitious though and the more money raised the more we can open the door on other real books too.  We hope to grow and grow then, breaking new ground by using a direct and intimate crowd funding model on many occasions,  so helping other artists and illustrators too, in future - by acting as inspiration, pathfinder, support and quality control, in other directly financed publishing projects, while also publishing much as a conventional publisher might into the market place.  Ultimately your backing is helping a small business flourish too.

Why We Are Different

Phoenix Ark Press is different firstly because, a bit like Curly Tail Press inside the story of Dragon In The Post , it represents writers and artists doing it for themselves,  fighting back with the direct help of readers, and not just dictated by  editors jockeying for jobs inside big houses. Secondly because the guiding spirit of Phoenix Ark Press, which is also an on-line blog, is  defined by the neglected genre of great animal storytelling and also by aspects of environmental and issue based journalism.  You can read blogs, poems, travel articles and cultural essays free now at PhoenixArkPress

Risks & Challenges

The risk and challenges are that Phoenix Ark cannot survive in the highly competitive and cut throat world of modern publishing and that David's stories will die out.  The benefit of crowd funding  is that it will help a highly committed author earn and so continue his life work, even if a book's initial fan base is not that large, although all the better if it is.   David has no issue with finishing a story like Dragon In The Post and making it shine, he has a remarkable track record, has won brilliant reviews in the UK and US, like 'a Master of Animal Fantasy' from Booklist and  'one of the best anthropomorphic novels known to me' from Richard Adams author of Watership Down.  He does have a problem with being denied the voice he earned over many years, as contracts were disrespected and seeing a culture of real books by inspiring authors wiped out in this mass media world, where there is no decent half way house between mass created ebooks and the all consuming global phenomena, so often little room for work not done to formula.

Other Ways You Can Help

A contribution of £15 will secure you that basic fact, more than any perk, of a signed copy of Dragon In The Post, at effectively little more than the price of a hardback in a shop today, but in this case with special perks too.  Larger pledges bring a chance to consider yourself crucial to a valuable indie publisher and perhaps to discuss future investment opportunities too. Even the smallest contributions add to a vital spirit though, allow you to join a publishing adventure and  make a difference, just as much as your  sharing the story and a new grass roots publishing word. So Join the Story with a contribution and become part of the adventure. Thank you.

Giving Readers and Backers the Last Word!

David's books have been described as 'A masterpiece' 'A hurtling ride' and 'too cool for words', while his novels have been Family Award winners and Book 76 Selections in the US, achieving over 7000 reviews on Goodreads.  But it is to people who got involved with the first attempt to crowd fund that we give the final word:

Charlotte C:

I'm sure my sentiments will be echoed by others when I say how impressive it is for you to be making a stand for your work and how glad I am to help in what small way I can. DCD, for me your books were my first step away from the standard 200 page childrens' book; and the adventure of Fire Bringer has never been regretted. 

Laura K:

I just wanted to say that your works are amazing. When I was 12 (and The Sight first came out), I went through a very, very difficult time. I actually was in shock/developed PTSD from various events, and I can say with certainty that The Sight helped me to open back up again. 

Tim B, chum and photographer :

Fifteen years ago, probably more I forget, I went to Italy on holiday with friends. I took another friend's first novel, with no little trepidation. I'm not good at telling people their work is good when it isn't. The book was Fire Bringer by David Clement-Davies. It rained for the first three days solid, and I lay on a sofa reading the book, until on day three, tears streaming down my face, I finished it. 

Sarah H, who has sent many great comments:

Behind you one hundred percent. ....Words cannot accurately express my gratitude. Your talent and tales are what the mind and spirit needs; the world in fact, needs these stories. If more people read your books the world perhaps would be in a better state of awareness and connection to nature. People would certainly be less inclined to ill treat the earth and its animal inhabitants (the human animal too). :)

Adam, a fine young man in the UK who has always supported:

It's been such a pleasure not only to help a favourite author to so many but also for you to have taken the time to thank us all individually. Any future project will have my full backing and the backing of many others. Please do continue to do what you do as it brings so much joy to so many.

Eugenia, such a staunch friend to many:

I've never not known you not to give up. Sam Johnson never did...despite Chesterfield. Backing you all the way....

Darren, who came in not only with the highest pledge but a warmth of heart that was literally out of the blue (on a Boris bike!) and quoted Theodore Roosevelt's 'In the Arena speech': 
David, I whole heatedly congratulate you on you tenacity. It's hard to see with so much 'battling' that you have been subject to but if you keep going there can only be one outcome and that is a win and this is a fact if you just don't give up. Keep going, you and your writing(s) are worth it.

Stephanie, who loves animals and threatened to sell her signed Tshirt from the Olympic Swimming team to raise her pledge:

Try again 

Justin, reader and warm fan:

Nostalgia's got my money no matter what you end up doing. 

Sheila Ruth (Imaginator Press):

I just discovered that on Goodreads, you're the #5 most followed author in the UK this month: https://www.goodreads.com/user_followings/most_followed There are definitely plenty of people out there who love your books; we just have to find a way to reach them!...

Yasmin, who so inspired with generosity and saying "how could I not give something back?":

I think it's always better to try and risk failure then never try at all and to keep trying until you make progress. Is that not what it was like to break into the industry as a fresh new author with his/her first book? 

Linda and Roger Garland, who have illustrated the Master JRR Tolkien's stories and have a wonderful art gallery in Cornwall:

So sorry the project is at present on hold, but with your dynamism something will crop up and it will come to fruition one day.

Kelly, brilliant reader, ecologist in the US and the very first to back the first project:

If money matched passion, you’d have made well over 6,000 pounds (now we are asking 4.5).  The fight is far from over. ..You shook the shelves once, and in great talents, I believe lightening strikes more than once.
