First to guarantee and build the fan base around this specific novel, blogged in part on line, then for a personalised publisher itself and the other books Phoenix  and you will make together.  That first book will be retailed to the general public as well, so treat a contribution as a kind of pre-order for a novel, a thing to have and cherish, that you helped to make and with your name inside. We are ambitious though and the more money raised the more we can open the door on other real books too.  We hope to grow and grow then, breaking new ground by using a direct and intimate crowd funding model on many occasions,  so helping other artists and illustrators too, in future - by acting as inspiration, pathfinder, support and quality control, in other directly financed publishing projects, while also publishing much as a conventional publisher might into the market place.  Ultimately your backing is helping a small business flourish too.Why We Are DifferentPhoenix Ark Press is different firstly because, a bit like Curly Tail Press inside the story of Dragon In The Post , it represents writers and artists doing it for themselves,  fighting back with the direct help of readers, and not just dictated by  editors jockeying for jobs inside big houses. Secondly because the guiding spirit of Phoenix Ark Press, which is also an on-line blog, is  defined by the neglected genre of great animal storytelling and also by aspects of environmental and issue based journalism.  You can read blogs, poems, travel articles and cultural essays free now at PhoenixArkPressRisks & ChallengesThe risk and challenges are that Phoenix Ark cannot survive in the highly competitive and cut throat world of modern publishing and that David's stories will die out.  The benefit of crowd funding  is that it will help a highly committed author earn and so continue his life work, even if a book's initial fan base is not that large, although all the better if it is.   David has no issue with finishing a story like Dragon In The Post and making it shine, he has a remarkable track record, has won brilliant reviews in the UK and US, like 'a Master of Animal Fantasy' from Booklist and  'one of the best anthropomorphic novels known to me' from Richard Adams author of Watership Down.  He does have a problem with being denied the voice he earned over many years, as contracts were disrespected and seeing a culture of real books by inspiring authors wiped out in this mass media world, where there is no decent half way house between mass created ebooks and the all consuming global phenomena, so often little room for work not done to formula.Other Ways You Can HelpA contribution of £15 will secure you that basic fact, more than any perk, of a signed copy of Dragon In The Post, at effectively little more than the price of a hardback in a shop today, but in this case with special perks too.  Larger pledges bring a chance to consider yourself crucial to a valuable indie publisher and perhaps to discuss future investment opportunities too. Even the smallest contributions add to a vital spirit though, allow you to join a publishing adventure and  make a difference, just as much as your  sharing the story and a new grass roots publishing word. So Join the Story with a contribution and become part of the adventure. Thank you.Giving Readers and Backers the Last Word!David's books have been described as 'A masterpiece' 'A hurtling ride' and 'too cool for words', while his novels have been Family Award winners and Book 76 Selections in the US, achieving over 7000 reviews on Goodreads.  But it is to people who got involved with the first attempt to crowd fund that we give the final word:Charlotte C:I'm sure my sentiments will be echoed by others when I say how impressive it is for you to be making a stand for your work and how glad I am to help in what small way I can. DCD, for me your books were my first step away from the standard 200 page childrens' book; and the adventure of Fire Bringer has never been regretted. Laura K:I just wanted to say that your works are amazing. When I was 12 (and The Sight first came out), I went through a very, very difficult time. I actually was in shock/developed PTSD from various events, and I can say with certainty that The Sight helped me to open back up again. Tim B, chum and photographer :Fifteen years ago, probably more I forget, I went to Italy on holiday with friends. I took another friend's first novel, with no little trepidation. I'm not good at telling people their work is good when it isn't. The book was Fire Bringer by David Clement-Davies. It rained for the first three days solid, and I lay on a sofa reading the book, until on day three, tears streaming down my face, I finished it. Sarah H, who has sent many great comments:Behind you one hundred percent. ....Words cannot accurately express my gratitude. Your talent and tales are what the mind and spirit needs; the world in fact, needs these stories. If more people read your books the world perhaps would be in a better state of awareness and connection to nature. People would certainly be less inclined to ill treat the earth and its animal inhabitants (the human animal too). :)Adam, a fine young man in the UK who has always supported:It's been such a pleasure not only to help a favourite author to so many but also for you to have taken the time to thank us all individually. Any future project will have my full backing and the backing of many others. Please do continue to do what you do as it brings so much joy to so many.Eugenia, such a staunch friend to many:I've never not known you not to give up. Sam Johnson never did...despite Chesterfield. Backing you all the way....Darren, who came in not only with the highest pledge but a warmth of heart that was literally out of the blue (on a Boris bike!) and quoted Theodore Roosevelt's 'In the Arena speech': David, I whole heatedly congratulate you on you tenacity. It's hard to see with so much 'battling' that you have been subject to but if you keep going there can only be one outcome and that is a win and this is a fact if you just don't give up. Keep going, you and your writing(s) are worth it.Stephanie, who loves animals and threatened to sell her signed Tshirt from the Olympic Swimming team to raise her pledge:Try again Justin, reader and warm fan:Nostalgia's got my money no matter what you end up doing. Sheila Ruth (Imaginator Press):I just discovered that on Goodreads, you're the #5 most followed author in the UK this month: https://www.goodreads.com/user_followings/most_followed There are definitely plenty of people out there who love your books; we just have to find a way to reach them!...Yasmin, who so inspired with generosity and saying "how could I not give something back?":I think it's always better to try and risk failure then never try at all and to keep trying until you make progress. Is that not what it was like to break into the industry as a fresh new author with his/her first book? Linda and Roger Garland, who have illustrated the Master JRR Tolkien's stories and have a wonderful art gallery in Cornwall:So sorry the project is at present on hold, but with your dynamism something will crop up and it will come to fruition one day.Kelly, brilliant reader, ecologist in the US and the very first to back the first project:If money matched passion, you’d have made well over 6,000 pounds (now we are asking 4.5).  The fight is far from over. ..You shook the shelves once, and in great talents, I believe lightening strikes more than once.

story:
s t o r y

Isabel is offered an artistic residency on the colony planet of New Canada, but beginning again on a new world proves difficult. Unexpectedly invited to a lavish society event by the taciturn Serge, she is swept off her feet under an unfamiliar sky. As Isabel and Serge dance in a sci-fi minuet around their feelings, they face the full force of the young planet's rigid social expectations.

a   w o r k   o f   h e a r t

I have always wanted to write science fiction. Growing up on a steady stream of Star Trek, Star Wars, and all the sci-fi novels I could find, I dreamed of robots and droids and galaxy clusters. But I also devoured Jane Austen's classics and played piano while picturing Regency dances. 

One day in early 2015 I woke up and began to write. The words poured out of me unabated. I then composed an entire album based on this story. I have been working on this project for the past two years, pouring all my heart into its creation. Now the final versions of both are almost ready. Launch is imminent.

f l i g h t   t e s t   s u c c e s s f u l

I performed an early version of the musical cycle in several Canadian and European cities throughout 2015. In January 2016, short films by Canadian visual artist Hali Rey, created specifically for my project, were premiered at the 2high Festival in Brisbane, Australia, as I performed my compositions live. Here I was joined by violinist dea.nice, who also performs on the album. I got some great reviews: I care if you listen called my songs "intelligent and inspired."

h e l p   m e   f l y

When you contribute to this campaign, you help me achieve my lifelong dream of publishing a book. You also help me achieve another lifelong dream: that of making the soundtrack to that book! This project encapsulates my creative spirit. I hope it captures your imagination too.

I'll do a book launch tour in the first half of 2017 through a series of readings+concerts in Canada and internationally. In the spring and summer I will put on smaller scale performances and readings. Some larger-scale musical collaborations for the second half of 2017 are already in the works. 

d e t a i l s 

Gravity Wing will be released as an illustrated e-book in early 2017. A digital musical album will also be released at the same time, providing the soundtrack for the novel. The decision between print and digital publishing was a difficult one, but I finally settled on digital for the following reasons:

  • This is my first novel and I'm self-publishing, meaning I'm managing the entire operation. Forgive me for comparing it to running a planet.  E-publishing allows me to turn it into more of a planetoid, something more manageable.
  • E-books are convenient! There's no shipping cost or shipping time. They can be beamed right across the galaxy, so you can order one from anywhere.
  • An e-book lets me share Hali Rey's beautiful illustrations with you in a format that is infinitely more visually appealing than it could appear in black-and-white print.

c o s t   b r e a k d o w n

I'm looking to raise $5000 CAD to help cover some of the many costs associated in self-publishing a novel in e-book format, as well as self-producing and recording a musical album. I've already worked very hard to produce most of the book and album at low cost. For example, I recorded and produced the album myself using my own computer and equipment. I am doing a lot of my own layout for the book. The cost breakdown will be approximately as follows (in Canadian Dollars):

ca. $1500 book launch series, Canada - setup, equipment, all sorts of Terran conveyances like planes and trains and automobiles... your contribution would help offset some of these expenses. At present, I plan to read and perform in Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto, and Quebec City, with more cities added as soon as the opportunity arises (Calgary and Vancouver are in the works!) 

ca. $500 promotional costs - print materials such download cards and story cards, posters, prints of the artwork for shows, online promotion

ca. $1000 audio - final equipment + software costs, mastering (note: some of the audio budget may be allocated to the launch series, if necessary.)

ca. $2000 additional costs - though I strive to be as fiercely independent as possible, I can't do every single thing alone. I anticipate costs to come up for design+visual, editing, distribution, administration, etc. This part of the budget would enable me to flexibly deal with challenges in the production process that I can't deal with myself. I would pool this and the audio budget, to allot funds where they are most needed. 

b u i l d i n g   a   n e w   w o r l d   c a r r i e s   i n h e r e n t   r i s k

I'm choosing a flexible funding campaign because I know that I will release Gravity Wing no matter what. I'll present the project in as many places as I can. A slightly more modest launch is still a successful launch. 

If I cannot reach the full $5000, the funding will focus on producing the e-book and getting a mini-tour off the ground.

r e l a y   m y   m e s s a g e

Everyone needs a little sci-fi love in their lives, whether they've got $ to offer or not. If for whatever reason you cannot afford to help me out right now, I still want to hear from you! You may not qualify for an indiegogo perk that way, but I've got plenty of beautiful stories and songs already published on my site that I can e-mail your way.

  • Share this campaign to your Facebook and tag me (@clio.em.singer.song.writer)
  • Tweet the link and tag me @ClioEm
  • Follow me on Instagram @airshipsandlace
  • Send me a message of support

story:
THRILLING MOMENTS

                                     Healing The World 1 Book At A Time

        SPECIAL THANKS TO ALL WHO HAVE DONATED IN PRIVATE!!

        CONTACT ME AT Janisdasilva@aol.com

Hi I'm from the Mid-West, where I 1st met Michael when I was a kid.  I moved to the West Coast to go to College, after Graduating.  I reconnected with Michael Jackson, and our Friendship picked right back up.

 I just wanted to write a book to Inspire people, and to Heal People that are hurting.  To bring hope to people, to help people hold on to their dreams, and to work hard to make those come true, no matter what they may be going through. That is what this book is all about, and this is why Michael Jackson Loved it, Authorize it, and  sold it in his own Fan Club for many, many years.  Michael, helped me with it when he was still living. He wanted this book to help him, help Heal The World.  You will feel the Inspiration and Healing as you read the story, of Making a Dream Come True, and giving hope.

 I can't do it by myself, cause I need your Help to Heal the World, through this Inspirational story.  Please Help me get this book out to as many people as possible, to fulfill Michael's Goodwill efforts, of making hurting people Happy, and giving them hope through this story.  Your giving will help me spread this Goodwill Inspiration to the masses.

Before Michael Jackson passed away leaving 100's of Millions of people World wide sad, he was helping me publish this book, he even sold it  in his Michael Jackson International Fan Club, and it is loved worldwide because the pictures make it like a movie, and there are Never-before seen photos, that make the book exciting, because they are all throughout the book, which helps the reader, feel as tho they are right there in the story of Inspiration, and hope mixed in with lots of fun, and Love.

It transports the Reader into Michael's world.  A few weeks before Michael died; Michael and I talked about adding more pages, because the fans wanted more.  Michael was going to help me, but when he passed, it all fell on me.

Publishers would change and tant it, and take away from the pure joy of knowing these are the actually pages, that made Michael very happy, while also given the Reader a Magical fun adventure.  It also gives a look at Neverland that will transport you to the Ranch for a day of fun.

I met Michael when I was 12 or 13, we stayed friends for over 33 years, we would call each other, and laugh laugh laugh, he was so much fun to be around, I miss him, and I want to share some of that laughter with the World.  Please donate whatever you can.  Help me keep my Promise to Michael, help me get this book out to the whole World.  The money will be used to Advertise in the Media, and add the final pages Michael wanted me to add;  which is very, very costly.  I know people want to get this book but they just don't know about it yet, the ones that do know of it, love it!

Join me on this mission for my dear friend Michael Jackson, who wanted to Heal The World for us all  to live a better life. This book is an Inspiration, that hurting people will gain from, like a Ray of Sun Light.

 I have been spending and funding this project thus far, and it almost left me Broke.  Will you please help in some way, anything you can give will help.  I thank you, and Michael would thank you too.  Please don't let this project die, help me keep it alive!  (Please make some noise about my Campaign, by using the Indiegogo share tools.)  Thank you again from Michael and I.  We Love You.

The Video on this page shows the book before I put money into it to make it a real paperback, but I still have more pages Michael wanted me to add. Michael helped me add some pages and Promote it before, without his help I'm lost. Promotion is very, very costly.  Michael would have kept helping me if only he were here.  Thank you for watching, Again I say Thanks for whatever you can do.  Michael  really stood by me on this, until you came along.  (Big Smile)    THANKS

story:
The Circle of Leadership is a playbook on how to create and leverage culture. The book explores the intersection of leadership, entrepreneurship, and culture. 


My name is Andrew Adeniyi and I wrote this book because all leaders and entrepreneurs deserve to win. I believe too many organizations struggle with productivity, retention, and employee engagement and exceptional leadership and organizational culture is the key to long term success. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to win by leveraging leadership and culture. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for leadership and entrepreneurship in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you start creating an award winning culture in your organization which will result in improved employee engagement. 

In this book, you'll learn about finding purpose, inspiring people, and implementing processes. You'll read about some inspiring stories like:

The $6,000 Egg - A story about how poor leadership and culture can lead to poor performance. 

Stefan Larsson - How the former CEO of Ralph Lauren was able to turn around apparel brand Old Navy

Lee Cockerell - Former Disney executive Lee Cockerell and what he believes are the secrets to the iconic brand’s continued success. 

You will love this book if you are a leader, entrepreneur or small business owner. 
The Circle of Leadership is a non-fiction book that speaks to leaders and entrepreneurs who are interested in leadership development and organizational culture.


The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + Cultivating Culture, Leveraging Culture, Finding Purpose (Mission), and Vision & Values. The reader will learn the components of culture, how to intentionally leverage culture, and how to inspire action in their organization through a compelling mission statement, vision statement, and core values. This section will clarify why a strong organizational culture leads to higher performance while outlining practical steps you can take to win in an organizational setting. The 80/20 principle is also highlighted in this part as a tool to help leaders be intentional with spending a portion of their time focused on building a culture that will lead to a competitive advantage. Examples of firms such as Google and Intuit are mentioned for their commitment to what Google refers to as “20% time”. 

Part 2 contains chapters on Hiring, Diversity & Inclusion, and Retention. The reader will learn how to strategically slow down the hiring process to get to know candidates better. The reader will also learn the importance of having a diverse and inclusive culture while striving to retain top talent through the art of appreciation. Through a story told by former CEO of Yum! Brands, Inc. David Novak, we will discuss the impact that recognition can have on your people and your overall performance. 

Part 3 contains chapters on Training & Development, Delegation, and Accountability. These chapters showcase how to effectively train and develop others so you can feel confident in delegating tasks to test their comprehension and improve productivity and engagement. We will discuss the impact of trust when it comes to delegation and firm performance through content shared from a book titled Leaders Eat Last by Simon Sinek. Ultimately, leaders should strive to instill a culture of extreme ownership and constant feedback. This section will explain how to supervise and manage performance. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Andrew Adeniyi is a first-generation Nigerian-American from South Bend, Indiana. He obtained his bachelor’s degree in Entrepreneurship and Corporate Innovation from the Kelley School of Business at Indiana University Bloomington. He then went on to complete his Master of Science from Michigan State University in Management, Strategy & Leadership. With almost 10 years of executive level management experience in retail operations and consulting, Andrew has dealt with a plethora of business scenarios. 

Andrew is passionate about entrepreneurship, organizational culture, business strategy, diversity, equity, and inclusion. With years of experience running his own branding and consulting firm, Andrew has helped dozens of clients amplify their potential. He strives to empower and equip leaders with the resources and tools necessary to win. Currently Andrew works at Starbucks as a District Manager while helping small business owners win through his consulting firm AAA Solutions LLC. 

Andrew currently resides in Indianapolis, Indiana with his wife and two kids and is excited to be publishing his first book titled The Circle of Leadership in Summer 2020. The book will serve as an entrepreneurial playbook on how to create and leverage culture. 

For more information you can connect with Andrew at adeniyi1906@gmail.com and on LinkedIn. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #CircleofLeadership and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Andrew Adeniyi
story_txt: The Circle of Leadership is a playbook on how to create and leverage culture. The book explores the intersection of leadership, entrepreneurship, and culture. My name is Andrew Adeniyi and I wrote this book because all leaders and entrepreneurs deserve to win. I believe too many organizations struggle with productivity, retention, and employee engagement and exceptional leadership and organizational culture is the key to long term success. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to win by leveraging leadership and culture. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for leadership and entrepreneurship in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you start creating an award winning culture in your organization which will result in improved employee engagement. In this book, you'll learn about finding purpose, inspiring people, and implementing processes. You'll read about some inspiring stories like:The $6,000 Egg - A story about how poor leadership and culture can lead to poor performance. Stefan Larsson - How the former CEO of Ralph Lauren was able to turn around apparel brand Old NavyLee Cockerell - Former Disney executive Lee Cockerell and what he believes are the secrets to the iconic brand’s continued success. You will love this book if you are a leader, entrepreneur or small business owner. The Circle of Leadership is a non-fiction book that speaks to leaders and entrepreneurs who are interested in leadership development and organizational culture.The book is written in 3 Parts....Part 1 contains the introduction + Cultivating Culture, Leveraging Culture, Finding Purpose (Mission), and Vision & Values. The reader will learn the components of culture, how to intentionally leverage culture, and how to inspire action in their organization through a compelling mission statement, vision statement, and core values. This section will clarify why a strong organizational culture leads to higher performance while outlining practical steps you can take to win in an organizational setting. The 80/20 principle is also highlighted in this part as a tool to help leaders be intentional with spending a portion of their time focused on building a culture that will lead to a competitive advantage. Examples of firms such as Google and Intuit are mentioned for their commitment to what Google refers to as “20% time”. Part 2 contains chapters on Hiring, Diversity & Inclusion, and Retention. The reader will learn how to strategically slow down the hiring process to get to know candidates better. The reader will also learn the importance of having a diverse and inclusive culture while striving to retain top talent through the art of appreciation. Through a story told by former CEO of Yum! Brands, Inc. David Novak, we will discuss the impact that recognition can have on your people and your overall performance. Part 3 contains chapters on Training & Development, Delegation, and Accountability. These chapters showcase how to effectively train and develop others so you can feel confident in delegating tasks to test their comprehension and improve productivity and engagement. We will discuss the impact of trust when it comes to delegation and firm performance through content shared from a book titled Leaders Eat Last by Simon Sinek. Ultimately, leaders should strive to instill a culture of extreme ownership and constant feedback. This section will explain how to supervise and manage performance.  What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publicationThe Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this SummerWhen I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. He then went on to complete his Master of Science from Michigan State University in Management, Strategy & Leadership. With almost 10 years of executive level management experience in retail operations and consulting, Andrew has dealt with a plethora of business scenarios. Andrew is passionate about entrepreneurship, organizational culture, business strategy, diversity, equity, and inclusion. With years of experience running his own branding and consulting firm, Andrew has helped dozens of clients amplify their potential. He strives to empower and equip leaders with the resources and tools necessary to win. Currently Andrew works at Starbucks as a District Manager while helping small business owners win through his consulting firm AAA Solutions LLC. Andrew currently resides in Indianapolis, Indiana with his wife and two kids and is excited to be publishing his first book titled The Circle of Leadership in Summer 2020. story:
There are unexplainable things that happen in this world, these are the things that change us forever

                  The Viseratta Series

                                                        By Ellen Griffin

‘I would rather know the truth and face my fear than live a lie and hide in the darkness. I was not born to fear, I was born to rule. Sometimes even during all the commotion in life you can truly see the balance of nature even in it's most raw form. The land covered by a thick layer of fresh snow hiding what lies beneath the true nature of the beast’

       

Viseratta is a paranormal tale of a transformation into darkness, horror, strength and the truth about the humanity. The true nature of what we are and what we can become, there is always a choice.


Ari has always been different but after a series of unexplainable terrifying events she comes face to face with what she truly is. For Ari and her friends, life as they know it will never be the same, when they get pulled into a world were nothing and no one is what they seem.

As the darkness clears and the secrets of the Viseratta unfold. They face the deadly creatures forged from fire, in an epic struggle that spans several generations between humans and demons.

“Sometimes we become trapped in the gilded cage of money and power never realizing we have become a prisoner of our own hand. When the days turn into nights, and nights to days the circle just continues and nothing ever changes. Tomorrow they would ride across the fields and bring the wrath’s of hell with them. He looked across the table at the others and all that he could see were the years of perpetuated hate fueled by each others ego's. It is the thing that drives men to the brink of madness then lets them fall over the edge while it laughs at them in the wind.”

                       

What We Need & What You Will Receive:

Target goal 2,650.00

The costs break down to:

1) Pre-Production = $500.00

2)Equipment and props= 1,200.00

3)Costs of Perks = $650.00 and shipping of perks

4)Cushion = IndieGoGo takes a commission + an unexpected thing or two


By supporting this project and getting a perk you will essentially:

    1) Get it first

    2) Get limited editions only available on Indiegogo

    3) Get your name in the book, and/or trailers

    4) Get extras

    5) Get to be part of something pretty amazing


What This Project Is For – The Production of 6 Live Action Book Trailers

There are 6 physical books written and self produced as of now for the Viseratta series.

Book 1 - Viseratta

Book 2 - The Revenge

Book 3 - Family Secrets

Book 4 - Rise from Darkness

Book 5 - Obsession and Betrayal

Book 6 - Return of the Nochi

They are actively being sold on www.Lulu.com , www.viseratta.com , and amazon, in both actual softcover editions and e-book formats.

Now is the time to take it to the next level. We will be shooting 6 live action book trailers starting April 17th thru July 2014. They will then be edited and used to promote the books through the most effective visual way possible.


How This Helps Us:

This helps get us out there and become noticed. Nothing works better than short visual videos to let people see into the real vision of the writer.


Other Ways You Can Help:

Do you know someone who might like to be involved in our project? Please let them know!

You can use Indiegogo's "Share Tools" to get the word out and help make this endeavor a success.

                                                       Thank you

Additional Goals:

If we go over our target amount, those funds will be used for:

1) Additional software editing upgrades and plug ins

2) Advertising/trade show in-person signings

3) Candy Bars, well just because

4) Once we hit the goal we will add two additional perks

This will be for the 7th book in the series “The Fire Sign”

$25.00 will get your name in the 7th book in the credits section. The book is due out between December 2014 and January 2015.

$35.00 will get your name in the 7th book in the credits section and a softcover edition of the book.


About The Author:

Born on the New Jersey shore early enough to remember the 80's and big hair days and smart enough to hide all those embarrassing pictures. Then transplanted to the good ole' southern State of Virginia.

Currently a fantasy art artist and author, which is a pretty cool gig considering the fact she can change people into most any type of creature in a digital picture. However, one should not forget the not so hilarious sarcasm of hiding people of whom she has had differences with in her books. While most do make for some very interesting characters they do seem to meet some unusual fates. It does, however, make for some good reads!

On most days she can be found wading in a pond with a camera, harassing the locals or chasing a surprised woods animal while out doing a fantasy art shoot. Many a cow has been chased out of a stream in the quest for the perfect fantasy shot location.

Visit Ellen Griffin's web site at www.viseratta.com

Any questions about a shoot email to viseratta@yahoo.com

story:
I'M A FELLOW COMEDIAN

  • My name is Emery Emery and I am launching this fund-raising effort in the name of my Freelancer.com scavenger team, "Running Hunts"!
  • We are launching this campaign for two reasons:
       1. As a show of public support for Fred Stoller.
       2. To help alleviate the expenses associated with Fred's effort to defend his name.
  • I know Fred Stoller personally and he did not ask me to set up this fund raiser. I will be making sure that all money donated will go directly to his legal team and not to him personally.
  • Any funds are raised beyond Fred's legal expenses will be donated to The Innocence Project, the folks that get wrongfully convicted people, free DNA tests.
  • If you believe what Kenny Kramer was wrong, express your disgust by donating to Fred's legal fund now.

WHY IS KENNY KRAMER SUING FRED?

  • Kenny is claiming that fred slandered him in his new book, "Maybe We'll Have You Back,"
  • The lawsuit doesn't even cite a specific passage from Fred's book. The claim is ambiguous and seems to suggest that Kenny deserves a million dollars because he believes that Fred has hurt his reputation.
  • Fact is, Fred said nothing close to what the lawsuit claims.

Why Should I Donate?

  • Don't sit back and do nothing while Kenny Kramer rakes Fred over the coals with what can only be described as a frivolous lawsuit. Any reasonable person who reads Fred's book can clearly see that he did not say the things alleged in the lawsuit.
  • Fred does not have a ton of money or a fancy house. He's a struggling performer and more important, he is an author and he certainly has the right to speak his opinion about Kenny Kramer and his tour business. Sometimes our rights must be defended and that is not cheap.

  • Let's hope thing doesn't get too out of hand, but let's start out my raising at least $5,000 for Fred to get a good lawyer to defend his livelihood, his humor and his rights.

I Just Can't Afford Anything!

If you can't afford to contribute, please tweet, email, post and talk about this fund raiser!

  • Click on the  the Indiegogo share links and help get the word out!
story_txt:
I'M A FELLOW COMEDIAN
My name is Emery Emery and I am launching this fund-raising effort in the name of my Freelancer.com scavenger team, "Running Hunts"!
We are launching this campaign for two reasons:   1. As a show of public support for Fred Stoller.   2. To help alleviate the expenses associated with Fred's effort to defend his name.

I know Fred Stoller personally and he did not ask me to set up this fund raiser. I will be making sure that all money donated will go directly to his legal team and not to him personally.
Any funds are raised beyond Fred's legal expenses will be donated to The Innocence Project, the folks that get wrongfully convicted people, free DNA tests.
If you believe what Kenny Kramer was wrong, express your disgust by donating to Fred's legal fund now.
WHY IS KENNY KRAMER SUING FRED?

Kenny is claiming that fred slandered him in his new book, "Maybe We'll Have You Back,"

The lawsuit doesn't even cite a specific passage from Fred's book. The claim is ambiguous and seems to suggest that Kenny deserves a million dollars because he believes that Fred has hurt his reputation.
Fact is, Fred said nothing close to what the lawsuit claims.


Why Should I Donate?
Don't sit back and do nothing while Kenny Kramer rakes Fred over the coals with what can only be described as a frivolous lawsuit. Any reasonable person who reads Fred's book can clearly see that he did not say the things alleged in the lawsuit.
Fred does not have a ton of money or a fancy house. He's a struggling performer and more important, he is an author and he certainly has the right to speak his opinion about Kenny Kramer and his tour business. Sometimes our rights must be defended and that is not cheap.


Let's hope thing doesn't get too out of hand, but let's start out my raising at least $5,000 for Fred to get a good lawyer to defend his livelihood, his humor and his rights.

I Just Can't Afford Anything!If you can't afford to contribute, please tweet, email, post and talk about this fund raiser!Click on the  the Indiegogo share links and help get the word out!

story:
Story of My Book

All the Little Things is a collection of short stories about the way people connect with the environment and the way nature can affect and reflect us, both in tragedy and times of love.

My name is Lissa Sangree-Calabrese and I am the author of All the Little Things. I wrote this book because of my deep love for the environment and my belief that through expanding on and enriching our connection with nature we as a people will be able to find a more sustainable future. I wrote this book for all the flowers that go unnoticed, for all the winds that howl lonely, and for all the animals silently going extinct. I wrote it in the hopes that somewhere someone who didn’t before will now stand up and take notice.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the ways in which nature has woven itself into your life. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the environment in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you reconnect with the world around you.

In this book, you'll learn about a varied cast of characters and see snippets of their lives as they start to understand, explore, and come to terms with harsh climate realities:
  • The way microplastics have infiltrated our food chain, the way they slip into even innocuous family dinners.
  • The intensity of natural disasters as they grow and change and become more and more prominent.
  • The way species distributions and occurrences are changing, the way climate change can trickle down to even the smallest things.
  • The footprint we leave behind and what remains (both the good and the bad).
You will love this book if you love the little things, the connections we make with each other and in turn the connections we make with the world and environment within which we live.

All the Little Things is a fiction book that speaks to the nature lovers in all of us and those of us who are starting to see the way the world is changing as the climate warms.

 

The Book - All the Little Things

The book contains 9 short stories:

Lorie- A young girl who, after almost swallowing a piece of plastic at a family dinner begins to think about the way we live. Her tumultuous relationship with the world around her is reflected both in her struggle to find her voice within her family and in her connection to the world around her.

Ingrid- An Icelandic native who contemplates what a changing climate means for natures purest places and what it means to be at peace.

Jared- A boy who loves his town but notices that things are changing, that even the brush that makes his town whole is disappearing. He struggles to find what is causing his home to change and to figure out what he can do to save what he loves.

Viviane- A girl who grows up with a little bit of nature in her life, in the form of a tree. As she grows older, she learns about shifting baselines and how the little things add up to a somewhat darker picture.

Isabell and her grandmother- A story about memory and what it means to love where you are from amidst destruction and the kind of insidious change that is slow at first and then there all at once.

Malika- A woman who contemplates loss, both within her family and at a local lake, while reflecting on what it means to love even in times of strife.

Tyron- A young man whose home is destroyed in a flood. He deals with feelings of displacement, both from his home and within his connection to the Mississippi river, as he tries to navigate a new water-logged world.

Liam- A boy who discovers the toll that pollution can take when he starts finding dead birds on his local beach every day. He contemplates what it means to take notice in a constantly shifting world.

Kliment-A man at the end of his life who reflects on what it means to love and what it means to find beauty within suffering and in the most unexpected of places.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter!
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

About the Author

Lissa Sangree-Calabrese is an intern at Anthropocene.Design, a sustainable development firm focused on how to create functional designs that are environmentally sound. In addition to her internship, she is working on a citizen science project (housed at Testingourwaters.net) aimed at cataloging plastic waste in our oceans. She is also a student at Brandeis University where she is studying environmental science and creative writing.

From the Author

I wrote this book because to me, the environmental issues of our time are of the utmost importance. However, for many people, it is hard to connect to the issues deeply because they seem far away. I wanted to explore the ways people can form these connections in their homes and in their everyday lives. I wanted to explore the ways climatic issues can hit close to home, even for those of us who do not live on disappearing islands or near e-waste dumps. This book is my attempt to reconcile massive climatic change with everyday lives and the ways in which we relate to each other.

Outside of my writing, I love to dance and to find new ways to create grace and strength within my body, whether that be through silks, acroyoga, or lyra. I love to immerse myself in stories, both through reading books and watching films. I love to listen to those around me and to connect to those I love and who I feel loved by.

For more information, you can connect with Lissa at lissasc@brandeis.edu and on facebook (Lissa Sangree-Calabrese) and instagram (lissasangrec).

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #allthelittlethingsbook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Lissa Sangree-Calabrese
story_txt:
Story of My Book
All the Little Things is a collection of short stories about the way people connect with the environment and the way nature can affect and reflect us, both in tragedy and times of love.My name is Lissa Sangree-Calabrese and I am the author of All the Little Things. I wrote this book because of my deep love for the environment and my belief that through expanding on and enriching our connection with nature we as a people will be able to find a more sustainable future. I wrote this book for all the flowers that go unnoticed, for all the winds that howl lonely, and for all the animals silently going extinct. I wrote it in the hopes that somewhere someone who didn’t before will now stand up and take notice.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the ways in which nature has woven itself into your life. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the environment in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you reconnect with the world around you.In this book, you'll learn about a varied cast of characters and see snippets of their lives as they start to understand, explore, and come to terms with harsh climate realities:
The way microplastics have infiltrated our food chain, the way they slip into even innocuous family dinners.
The intensity of natural disasters as they grow and change and become more and more prominent.
The way species distributions and occurrences are changing, the way climate change can trickle down to even the smallest things.
The footprint we leave behind and what remains (both the good and the bad).
 You will love this book if you love the little things, the connections we make with each other and in turn the connections we make with the world and environment within which we live.All the Little Things is a fiction book that speaks to the nature lovers in all of us and those of us who are starting to see the way the world is changing as the climate warms. 
The Book - All the Little ThingsThe book contains 9 short stories:Lorie- A young girl who, after almost swallowing a piece of plastic at a family dinner begins to think about the way we live. Her tumultuous relationship with the world around her is reflected both in her struggle to find her voice within her family and in her connection to the world around her.Ingrid- An Icelandic native who contemplates what a changing climate means for natures purest places and what it means to be at peace.Jared- A boy who loves his town but notices that things are changing, that even the brush that makes his town whole is disappearing. He struggles to find what is causing his home to change and to figure out what he can do to save what he loves.Viviane- A girl who grows up with a little bit of nature in her life, in the form of a tree. As she grows older, she learns about shifting baselines and how the little things add up to a somewhat darker picture.Isabell and her grandmother- A story about memory and what it means to love where you are from amidst destruction and the kind of insidious change that is slow at first and then there all at once.Malika- A woman who contemplates loss, both within her family and at a local lake, while reflecting on what it means to love even in times of strife.Tyron- A young man whose home is destroyed in a flood. He deals with feelings of displacement, both from his home and within his connection to the Mississippi river, as he tries to navigate a new water-logged world.Liam- A boy who discovers the toll that pollution can take when he starts finding dead birds on his local beach every day. He contemplates what it means to take notice in a constantly shifting world.Kliment-A man at the end of his life who reflects on what it means to love and what it means to find beauty within suffering and in the most unexpected of places.

story:
¿Qué?

El tiempo está próximo recuerda a lo mejor de Raymond Carver, Tobias Wolff o Mircea Cartarescu, aportando frescura y un poso existencial más amplio a un conjunto de relatos al borde del abismo.

Los personajes de estos relatos no solo afrontan la completa ruptura de su realidad cotidiana, sino también la soledad y la incertidumbre que esa nueva existencia conlleva.
Ante esta fractura, trazada desde las diferentes edades de los protagonistas, los personajes encaran su inevitable situación a través del enfrentamiento, la inseguridad, la renuncia, la resignación de la derrota aceptada. Sin embargo, aunque cada uno de ellos resurja culpable o redimido de su apocalipsis personal, la estructura circular de estos relatos sugiere un daño tan ineludible para los protagonistas como próximo para el resto de personajes, e incluso para el lector mismo a su vez, arrastrado a formar parte de las diferentes historias que la obra le presenta.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Noel Pérez Brey.

Licenciado en Filología Hispánica y en Administración y Dirección de Empresas, responsable de Revista Literaria Visor, especializada en los distintos aspectos del relato corto. Su trabajo ha obtenido diferentes premios y menciones, entre los que destacan el primer premio de narrativa en el Iparraguirre Saria de 2008 (Zumarraga-Urretxu, Guipúzcoa), el tercer premio en el XI Concurso de Relato Breve del Museo Arqueológico de Córdoba (2014, Córdoba) o, más recientemente, el ser finalista en el I Concurso de Relatos Breves Enrique Gallud Jardiel (2016, Alicante). Fue elegido como uno de los Talentos 2013 por el diario El País.

Sus textos han sido publicados tanto en antologías como en obras editadas en virtud de los galardones conseguidos, y es colaborador con múltiples cuentos y estudios críticos en distintas revistas literarias.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Al fin y al cabo un hombre y un gato no podían ser tan distintos. Le clavaría el cuchillo a aquel cretino en el cogote, justo cuando se diera la vuelta para salir, y tal y como hacía con los animales, giraría el puñal a uno y otro lado hasta que le crujiera la columna. Cuando la mujer y la suegra de aquel imbécil preguntaran por él, Brais ya se habría cambiado el delantal y tendría todo recogido.
     —No sé, señora —diría—. Pagó la tarta y se marchó.
     Y después podría ir haciendo deliciosas empanadas de carne, y así ahorraría también en eso, igual que con el colorante alimenticio. Incluso podría pensar una forma de recortar en el azúcar o la harina. Quizás de ese modo volvería a contratar a su ayudante y reflotar de nuevo el negocio, y todo sería como antes otra vez.
     —Oiga —escuchó Brais desde dentro—. ¿Viene ya esa tarta?
     Brais apretó los dientes, acariciando el cuchillo a través del mandil, y luego salió con el pastel sobre las manos»

«Entonces Ernest se afianzó la escopeta en el hombro, contuvo la respiración y, sujetando con firmeza el arma, apretó el gatillo. El perdigón impactó contra la carrocería del automóvil. El ruido metálico asustó al chico, que encogió la espalda mientras se protegía la cabeza con los brazos y, mirando a un lado y a otro, comenzó a correr, pasando por delante del vehículo, ante el jardín. Tan rápido como pudo, Ernest cargó de nuevo, apuntó impaciente y disparó. El proyectil atravesó esta vez una de las ventanillas del coche y la hizo pedazos. Ernest agarró deprisa un puñado de perdigones, y se los guardó en uno de los bolsillos del pijama mientras atravesaba la cocina. Corrió hacia la puerta de la casa apresurado en cargar de nuevo la escopeta, y, tropezando, dejando atrás una de las chanclas, saltó a trompicones los escalones del jardín. Salió a la calle en pijama y medio descalzo. El pequeño Herráez se alejaba a toda prisa, escapando sin volver la cabeza, y Ernest disparó otra vez, aunque ahora apenas se molestó en apuntar al chico»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El tiempo está próximo que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Noel Pérez Brey vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
The Story of My Book

1521: Re-Discovering the History of the Philippines tells the forgotten stories of Filipinos in the advent of Spanish colonization, beginning with Magellan’s arrival in the archipelago. This book offers a unique Filipino perspective.  

My name is Judy Robinson and I wrote this book because after revisiting the story of Magellan’s “discovery” of the islands, I learned new information that I didn’t remember reading about in history textbooks growing up in the Philippines. I decided to keep reading about early colonial history. The more I that researched, the more surprises that I found.  

In reading this book, you will discover that precolonial Filipinos had a complex social structure that was more advanced than previously acknowledged.  

  • Trade and commerce flourished in the archipelago even before Magellan’s arrival. 
  • Precolonial Filipinos were expert seafarers with a deep connection to water. 
  • Some of the traditions and practices from precolonial times continue to live on today. 

You will love this book if you are interested in learning more about Filipinos’ resilience and adaptability with the introduction of Spanish influences in their culture. Fans of history will enjoy reading about how historical events have shaped culture. Those interested in trade and economics may be surprised in the role the Philippines played in globalization.  

I wrote 1521: Re-Discovering the History of the Philippines for the Filipino diaspora, especially the next generation, with the hope that this book will lead to a deeper appreciation of our rich and colorful Filipino heritage.  

Ultimately, I hope that this book inspires meaningful dialogue and the opportunity to reflect on questions like: 
  • How can lessons learned from these forgotten stories of our ancestors shape our identity? 
  • How can this new understanding of our shared past lead to empowerment for Filipino immigrant communities? 
  • How can we build a better appreciation of Filipino heritage for future generations of the diaspora?


I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.  My hope is that in re-discovering our history, we learn who we were, who we are, and who we can be.  

 

The Book - 1521: Re-Discovering the History of the Philippines

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. This includes an overview of the Philippines and origins of precolonial Filipinos. It also looks closely at how our understanding of our own history has been shaped by the biases of the writers of history.  

Part 2 contains chapters 4-16. Here you will find stories of the push and pull of a variety of influences including geography, religion, and economics to create the rich and colorful tapestry of Filipino culture today. Beginning with a fresh look at Magellan’s journey, this part also includes chapters that explore aspects of Filipino life at the time of conquest.  

Part 3 contains chapters 17-21. This last section has stories from the diaspora such as the first Filipino community in the US, recorded as early as 1763. It also includes interviews from Filipino diaspora as they share insights from their experiences and on how knowing our history affects our culture and identity.  

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this August 2021

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Judy Robinson was born and raised in the Philippines and now lives in the Washington DC area. She graduated with a Bachelors Degree from the University of the Philippines Diliman and a Masters Degree in Business Administration from Georgetown University.  

She does not consider herself a historian. Judy is more comfortable around spreadsheets and analyzing the story behind data. Innate curiosity and love for life long learning instilled by her parents and grandparents led to writing this book.  

In remembering the 500-year anniversary of Magellan's arrival in the Philippines, Judy decided to revisit the story of this extraordinary voyage. She realized there were stories from Philippine History that she wanted to share with her nephews and nieces. This grew into a book for the Filipino diaspora, especially the next generation.  

Judy and her husband are dog parents to a pair of Jacks, rambunctious, rescue terrier mixes. Her little pack enjoys going on nature hikes, forest bathing, and adventures. She also tends to her growing collection of grocery store orchids as they remind her of her hometown in the Philippines. 

For more information, you can connect with Judy at judyrobinsonstories@gmail.com and @judyrobinsonstories on Instagram. 

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.  

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #1521Philippines and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Maraming Salamat.  Daghang Salamat.

Judy Robinson
story_txt:
The Story of My Book
1521: Re-Discovering the History of the Philippines tells the forgotten stories of Filipinos in the advent of Spanish colonization, beginning with Magellan’s arrival in the archipelago. This book offers a unique Filipino perspective.  My name is Judy Robinson and I wrote this book because after revisiting the story of Magellan’s “discovery” of the islands, I learned new information that I didn’t remember reading about in history textbooks growing up in the Philippines. I decided to keep reading about early colonial history. The more I that researched, the more surprises that I found.  In reading this book, you will discover that precolonial Filipinos had a complex social structure that was more advanced than previously acknowledged.  

Trade and commerce flourished in the archipelago even before Magellan’s arrival. 
Precolonial Filipinos were expert seafarers with a deep connection to water. 
Some of the traditions and practices from precolonial times continue to live on today. 

You will love this book if you are interested in learning more about Filipinos’ resilience and adaptability with the introduction of Spanish influences in their culture. Fans of history will enjoy reading about how historical events have shaped culture. Those interested in trade and economics may be surprised in the role the Philippines played in globalization.  I wrote 1521: Re-Discovering the History of the Philippines for the Filipino diaspora, especially the next generation, with the hope that this book will lead to a deeper appreciation of our rich and colorful Filipino heritage.  Ultimately, I hope that this book inspires meaningful dialogue and the opportunity to reflect on questions like: 
How can lessons learned from these forgotten stories of our ancestors shape our identity? 
How can this new understanding of our shared past lead to empowerment for Filipino immigrant communities? 
How can we build a better appreciation of Filipino heritage for future generations of the diaspora?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.  My hope is that in re-discovering our history, we learn who we were, who we are, and who we can be.  
 
The Book - 1521: Re-Discovering the History of the Philippines
The book is written in three parts.Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. This includes an overview of the Philippines and origins of precolonial Filipinos. It also looks closely at how our understanding of our own history has been shaped by the biases of the writers of history.  Part 2 contains chapters 4-16. Here you will find stories of the push and pull of a variety of influences including geography, religion, and economics to create the rich and colorful tapestry of Filipino culture today. Beginning with a fresh look at Magellan’s journey, this part also includes chapters that explore aspects of Filipino life at the time of conquest.  Part 3 contains chapters 17-21. This last section has stories from the diaspora such as the first Filipino community in the US, recorded as early as 1763. It also includes interviews from Filipino diaspora as they share insights from their experiences and on how knowing our history affects our culture and identity.   

What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this August 2021

 
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!


 
About the Author
Judy Robinson was born and raised in the Philippines and now lives in the Washington DC area. She graduated with a Bachelors Degree from the University of the Philippines Diliman and a Masters Degree in Business Administration from Georgetown University.  
She does not consider herself a historian. Judy is more comfortable around spreadsheets and analyzing the story behind data. Innate curiosity and love for life long learning instilled by her parents and grandparents led to writing this book.  
In remembering the 500-year anniversary of Magellan's arrival in the Philippines, Judy decided to revisit the story of this extraordinary voyage. She realized there were stories from Philippine History that she wanted to share with her nephews and nieces. This grew into a book for the Filipino diaspora, especially the next generation.  
Judy and her husband are dog parents to a pair of Jacks, rambunctious, rescue terrier mixes. Her little pack enjoys going on nature hikes, forest bathing, and adventures. She also tends to her growing collection of grocery store orchids as they remind her of her hometown in the Philippines. 
For more information, you can connect with Judy at judyrobinsonstories@gmail.com and @judyrobinsonstories on Instagram. 
 
International Preorders
For international preorders, please send me a private message.  

 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

story:
About The Book...

 

A lethal and wildly contagious virus has confined, isolated, and fundamentally changed human life. And We Drown follows Nadia Luka reckoning with her strange, new world. 

My name is Kiran Sampath and I am the author of And We Drown. I wrote this book during quarantine. Much of it is inspired by my own reflection, and increasing self-knowledge, though much of it is also purely creative, and was written as an outlet for me to express my imagination and freedom during a restricted period of our lives. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will see yourself reflected in parts of Nadia. In ways a painting of modern disillusionment, this book will help you appreciate the many mundane things that make up our lives, which cannot be controlled by the circumstances framed by the current pandemic.

The aggression of a lethal and wildly contagious virus sends Nadia Luka home to Chicago from her senior year at Yale. Government restrictions prevent movement outside of states and the local communities within them. In Chicago, she has only a few friends. Her family is detached, her routine is hollow. She craves the vitality and excitement of before: when she was talented, desirable, and life was a silver invitation to drinks on 33rd street, dinner in New Haven.

Before Nadia was gifted. The career she’d wanted was unfolding itself to her. Welcoming her.
Before Nadia was free. She could stand alone on a street corner and say, I will fly to Paris today, I will tease the lonely croissant maker in Saint Germain. 
Before Nadia was loved. For the first time. Briefly.

Now, she waits for life or waits for death.

At her home in Chicago, Nadia sits down to write about “before.” As she writes, she sees how incomplete her memories are. That nostalgia, which echoes, go back, go back, misses so much of what was wrong before.

Before she saw that career, the same career she’d thought she wanted, as little and unimportant.
Before she was hardly free by any definition of the word; she was anxious, bounded by others’ opinions, and her only function was to please them.
Before she believed, as deeply as a person can believe anything, I am unlovable. 
Before Nadia was so much. But not enough. 

Now, after, she is still alive, but in a different way. Not in that drunken, vibrant, saturated way that is defined by circumstance and laughed over at dinner tables, which confuses and feels almost fully external. The way of living that is really only reacting. Now she is alive in a strange, and unfamiliar, and complete way. Her life is something that flows through her. Something innate and irrevocable. Her life is both simple and boundless, mundane and extraordinary, almost over and only beginning. And she is happy.
 

You will love this book if you have ever felt disillusioned. If you have questioned and been crippled by the mundanity of your routine. If you seek new ways to think about that routine. Or even if you just have a few free hours to kill before cribbage practice at Panda Express.

 

Ultimately, I hope that And We Drown inspires reflection upon questions like:

Who do I live for? What makes me come alive?

What is intimacy? How can I distinguish raw, intimate relationships from purely intense ones?

In a modern society, how can we inspire simple and happy, combat anxiety, depression, all without losing our curious, philosophical tendencies. 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing mortality, briefness, mundanity, disillusionment, intimacy, intensity, and what makes life worth living, will change us all for the better. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Kiran Sampath is a Philosophy Student at Yale University. While she was unable to complete French on Duolingo, learn Python, or finish a Rubik’s cube during quarantine, she did have time to journal, reflect, and creative write. Outside of writing this novel, Kiran enjoys comedy writing, soccer, squash, taking baths, and getting low to Moonlight Sonata.

For more information, you can connect with Kiran Sampath at kiran.sampath@yale.edu or @kiransampathhh on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AndWeDrown and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

With gratitude,

Kiran Sampath
