story:
My book is about handling the challenges of change during a significant transition period by taking advantage of the right kind of support networks to bring about a better sense of purpose so we can develop a more just society. I put the reader in the shoes of one of my former students to get a better idea of what needs changing in society. As she lives in rural Thailand, she develops a particular perception of how the world works through technology and the media. Because she lives in a bubble, the only way for her to get a better understanding of what goes on in society is by her teachers.
 

The Diverging: Searching for Clarity sheds light on how we’re losing trust in many parts of our society and the implications this has on people’s lives. To be able to bring about change, we must able to be resilient, and a good way to do this is by doing something that you least expect, like experiencing another culture.


My name is Christopher Pinkos and I am the author of The Diverging: Searching for Clarity. I wrote this book because we are in a pivotal transition point and to move forward in a sustainable manner, we must be able to know what is worth our time to help make the world a better place. If humanity wants to progress into the next century, we must work toward solving the most pressing challenges of our current century before we even think about what to do in the next century.  

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that to make society better, we must re-establish trust in our institutions during a time where change is disrupting many people’s lives. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for making the world a better place through finding purpose. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you do something about it and give the next generation a better place to live.

In this book, you'll learn about what our institutions have done to cause us to lose faith in our system and what needs to be done to fix it by giving some possible solutions:

  • Kunjira’s understanding of the world - Coming from rural Thailand, Kunjira who is a middle school student develops a particular perception of how the world works. With the rise in technology, she can find out what is going on around her. Still, she isn't familiar with everything she sees, so Kunjira relies on her teachers to fill in the gaps, but her teachers are in a predicament of their own. As her teachers aren't in a suitable position to give Kunjira the education she deserves because of other tasks that require their attention, Thai teachers don't have much choice but to cancel class on some occasions. With limited resources in the classroom, Kunjira realizes that she must do more on her own so she can achieve her goals in life. If there wasn't a foreign teacher to help Kunjira realize her full potential, she would be less prepared to handle the changes of today's economy. The experiences Kunjira goes through is a typical occurrence in many rural places around the world.
  • Understanding why there’s a rise in distrust with many of our institutions around the world - Just before Kunjira decides to get some sleep, she watches the movie Hachiko Monogatari. As she watches the film, Kunjira falls asleep and dreams about being right in the middle of Hachiko scramble during the evening rush. Since Hachiko Scramble is the busiest intersection in the world, it has to live up to this reputation, which makes it the perfect place to talk about people's concerns. Because the dream was so vivid, Kunjira wants to know more about what she heard. She notices that a lot of people are going through tough times. As the general public becomes more vulnerable to change, it is more important now that our elected officials support the interest of many instead of the few because we are seeing many of us struggling to handle uncertainty.
  • What can be done - If we want to be able to make the world a better place for Kunjira and the many other people who have a tougher time finding opportunities because of where you come from, you must know that you are not alone. Many of us want to make the world a better place but find it hard to start as getting a job that is worthwhile nowadays isn’t easy. With the right support, you will be able to handle any obstacle that comes your way, plus you will be able to live a better life. By looking at the Hispanic Paradox and the Roseto Effect, people who form tight communities tend to do better and live healthier lives. As a Returned Peace Corps Volunteer (RPCV), I have seen that people are better off when you develop more inclusive societies.


You will love this book if you need help finding purpose as you move from one thing to another.

The Diverging: Searching for Clarity is a creative non-fiction book that speaks to students and recent graduates who are looking at how they fit in the world and what contributions they can make to better our society for the first time.

 

The Book - The Diverging: Searching for Clarity


The book is written in 4 Parts:

Part 1: Misconceptions contains the Introduction or Prologue + Chapters 1-3. We all go through some form of change in our lives, even when it might be scary. Going through something different is part of life, and we need to be able to cope with transitions. One of the most frightening things anyone can experience is going to another country for an extended period. Going to a new place for the first time can be a terrifying experience, especially when you don’t know much about where you are going.  

Part 2: Shatterings contains Chapters 4-8. Now you have adjusted to your new life abroad. But with technology, you can keep track of what is going on back home and you don’t like everything you’re hearing. You go to work and hear people talking about some bad things going on in the United States, and you start to feel bad. You don’t want to start a scene so you bury what you hear, leading you to feel homesick. Instead of staying down, you decide to research the reason we got into this mess. You discover some interesting information, so you choose to write.

Part 3: Lenses contain Chapters 9-14. You get the news that one of your friends is abroad but working as a teacher in Thailand. Because he is also working in another country, you decide to reach out, thinking that you can catch up and maybe do some traveling. He contacts you, saying he would love to catch up and possibly travel over a holiday. Since Thailand is a popular tourist destination, you decide to visit him when you have time off. By talking with him, you discover that one of his students is very bright and can do big things, but she doesn't come from a developed area, so her prospects are quite low. Even though she is uncertain about what her future has in store, she still wants to learn as much as possible.  

Part 4: Directions contains Chapter 15 (Conclusion). You have completed your work and realize that time has gone by so fast. As you arrive back in the United States, you notice that the friend you met in Thailand is also in the United States and staying not too far from you. You decide to meet up because it has been a year you haven’t seen each other. While talking with him, you get the impression that something’s up, so you ask him what’s on his mind. You find out that he was moved by what his former student had said and wants to make more of a difference in the world. Because you were also abroad, he’s interested in working with you on developing a social enterprise. 

I wanted to frame the book around the concept of a diverging lens because we are searching for the right path out of many beams of parallel rays of light. Since we are in a dark moment, we are looking for the best way to provide us with lighter prospects.


What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor and I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and eBook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish,
  • A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book,
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”),
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback,
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover,
  • A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book,
  • And more!


About the Author

 

As a Returned Peace Corps Volunteer (RPCV), Christopher Pinkos served in Thailand from 2017 to 2019 as a Teacher Collaborator and Community Facilitator, working alongside the people of Taling Chan village in Nakhon Ratchasima Province. While serving, Christopher had the opportunity to go to Laos, Malaysia, and Singapore. Upon completing service, Christopher stayed in Thailand to pursue a Master’s in International Business Management at Chulalongkorn University, the country’s oldest and most prestigious university where he got the change to visit Myanmar. Serving in the Peace Corps made it possible for Christopher to be a contributor with Artem NexGen (ANG), a mentoring platform to help the rising generation network internationally with high-achieving youth and social entrepreneurs.

From Christopher’s experiences abroad, he noticed that we are at a pivotal transition point. Before going to Thailand, Christopher has spent some time in Korea and China. As the United States has many competing interests compared to what we have previously witnessed, we must know what our primary roles are in the world. He hopes this book helps bring about a better sense of direction to bring about a better society. Being someone who sees things in a Light Triad point of view makes Christopher curious about what people can do to make an impactful contribution.

After meeting so many people during his travels, Christopher noticed that we all have something to offer society. As things change even more quickly than we previously anticipated, it can be a little challenging to get back on your feet; however, there are ways to get you back on track, and Christopher has witnessed this firsthand as he moved from one place to another. If the COVID-19 pandemic has taught us anything, it’s that we’re more connected to one another, so it matters how we interact with one another.

For more information you can contact Christopher Pinkos at chrpnks@yahoo.com and on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/christopher-pinkos-.... 


Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.


Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheDiverging and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.


Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Christopher Pinkos
story_txt:
My book is about handling the challenges of change during a significant transition period by taking advantage of the right kind of support networks to bring about a better sense of purpose so we can develop a more just society. I put the reader in the shoes of one of my former students to get a better idea of what needs changing in society. As she lives in rural Thailand, she develops a particular perception of how the world works through technology and the media. Because she lives in a bubble, the only way for her to get a better understanding of what goes on in society is by her teachers. The Diverging: Searching for Clarity sheds light on how we’re losing trust in many parts of our society and the implications this has on people’s lives. To be able to bring about change, we must able to be resilient, and a good way to do this is by doing something that you least expect, like experiencing another culture.My name is Christopher Pinkos and I am the author of The Diverging: Searching for Clarity. I wrote this book because we are in a pivotal transition point and to move forward in a sustainable manner, we must be able to know what is worth our time to help make the world a better place. If humanity wants to progress into the next century, we must work toward solving the most pressing challenges of our current century before we even think about what to do in the next century.  My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that to make society better, we must re-establish trust in our institutions during a time where change is disrupting many people’s lives. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for making the world a better place through finding purpose. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you do something about it and give the next generation a better place to live.In this book, you'll learn about what our institutions have done to cause us to lose faith in our system and what needs to be done to fix it by giving some possible solutions:

Kunjira’s understanding of the world - Coming from rural Thailand, Kunjira who is a middle school student develops a particular perception of how the world works. With the rise in technology, she can find out what is going on around her. Still, she isn't familiar with everything she sees, so Kunjira relies on her teachers to fill in the gaps, but her teachers are in a predicament of their own. As her teachers aren't in a suitable position to give Kunjira the education she deserves because of other tasks that require their attention, Thai teachers don't have much choice but to cancel class on some occasions. With limited resources in the classroom, Kunjira realizes that she must do more on her own so she can achieve her goals in life. If there wasn't a foreign teacher to help Kunjira realize her full potential, she would be less prepared to handle the changes of today's economy. The experiences Kunjira goes through is a typical occurrence in many rural places around the world.

Understanding why there’s a rise in distrust with many of our institutions around the world - Just before Kunjira decides to get some sleep, she watches the movie Hachiko Monogatari. As she watches the film, Kunjira falls asleep and dreams about being right in the middle of Hachiko scramble during the evening rush. Since Hachiko Scramble is the busiest intersection in the world, it has to live up to this reputation, which makes it the perfect place to talk about people's concerns. Because the dream was so vivid, Kunjira wants to know more about what she heard. She notices that a lot of people are going through tough times. As the general public becomes more vulnerable to change, it is more important now that our elected officials support the interest of many instead of the few because we are seeing many of us struggling to handle uncertainty.

What can be done - If we want to be able to make the world a better place for Kunjira and the many other people who have a tougher time finding opportunities because of where you come from, you must know that you are not alone. Many of us want to make the world a better place but find it hard to start as getting a job that is worthwhile nowadays isn’t easy. With the right support, you will be able to handle any obstacle that comes your way, plus you will be able to live a better life. By looking at the Hispanic Paradox and the Roseto Effect, people who form tight communities tend to do better and live healthier lives. As a Returned Peace Corps Volunteer (RPCV), I have seen that people are better off when you develop more inclusive societies.
You will love this book if you need help finding purpose as you move from one thing to another.The Diverging: Searching for Clarity is a creative non-fiction book that speaks to students and recent graduates who are looking at how they fit in the world and what contributions they can make to better our society for the first time. The Book - The Diverging: Searching for ClarityThe book is written in 4 Parts:Part 1: Misconceptions contains the Introduction or Prologue + Chapters 1-3. We all go through some form of change in our lives, even when it might be scary. Going through something different is part of life, and we need to be able to cope with transitions. One of the most frightening things anyone can experience is going to another country for an extended period. Going to a new place for the first time can be a terrifying experience, especially when you don’t know much about where you are going.  Part 2: Shatterings contains Chapters 4-8. Now you have adjusted to your new life abroad. But with technology, you can keep track of what is going on back home and you don’t like everything you’re hearing. You go to work and hear people talking about some bad things going on in the United States, and you start to feel bad. You don’t want to start a scene so you bury what you hear, leading you to feel homesick. Instead of staying down, you decide to research the reason we got into this mess. You discover some interesting information, so you choose to write.Part 3: Lenses contain Chapters 9-14. You get the news that one of your friends is abroad but working as a teacher in Thailand. Because he is also working in another country, you decide to reach out, thinking that you can catch up and maybe do some traveling. He contacts you, saying he would love to catch up and possibly travel over a holiday. Since Thailand is a popular tourist destination, you decide to visit him when you have time off. By talking with him, you discover that one of his students is very bright and can do big things, but she doesn't come from a developed area, so her prospects are quite low. Even though she is uncertain about what her future has in store, she still wants to learn as much as possible.  Part 4: Directions contains Chapter 15 (Conclusion). You have completed your work and realize that time has gone by so fast. As you arrive back in the United States, you notice that the friend you met in Thailand is also in the United States and staying not too far from you. You decide to meet up because it has been a year you haven’t seen each other. While talking with him, you get the impression that something’s up, so you ask him what’s on his mind. You find out that he was moved by what his former student had said and wants to make more of a difference in the world. Because you were also abroad, he’s interested in working with you on developing a social enterprise. I wanted to frame the book around the concept of a diverging lens because we are searching for the right path out of many beams of parallel rays of light. Since we are in a dark moment, we are looking for the best way to provide us with lighter prospects.
What I Need & What You'll Get
 This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor and I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for my book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and eBook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish,
A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book,
Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”),
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback,
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover,
A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book,
And more!

About the Author
 As a Returned Peace Corps Volunteer (RPCV), Christopher Pinkos served in Thailand from 2017 to 2019 as a Teacher Collaborator and Community Facilitator, working alongside the people of Taling Chan village in Nakhon Ratchasima Province. While serving, Christopher had the opportunity to go to Laos, Malaysia, and Singapore. Upon completing service, Christopher stayed in Thailand to pursue a Master’s in International Business Management at Chulalongkorn University, the country’s oldest and most prestigious university where he got the change to visit Myanmar. Serving in the Peace Corps made it possible for Christopher to be a contributor with Artem NexGen (ANG), a mentoring platform to help the rising generation network internationally with high-achieving youth and social entrepreneurs.From Christopher’s experiences abroad, he noticed that we are at a pivotal transition point. Before going to Thailand, Christopher has spent some time in Korea and China. As the United States has many competing interests compared to what we have previously witnessed, we must know what our primary roles are in the world. He hopes this book helps bring about a better sense of direction to bring about a better society. Being someone who sees things in a Light Triad point of view makes Christopher curious about what people can do to make an impactful contribution.After meeting so many people during his travels, Christopher noticed that we all have something to offer society. As things change even more quickly than we previously anticipated, it can be a little challenging to get back on your feet; however, there are ways to get you back on track, and Christopher has witnessed this firsthand as he moved from one place to another. If the COVID-19 pandemic has taught us anything, it’s that we’re more connected to one another, so it matters how we interact with one another.For more information you can contact Christopher Pinkos at chrpnks@yahoo.com and on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/christopher-pinkos-.... 
Risks & Challenges
 The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheDiverging and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Christopher Pinkos

story:
Love. It always been, and still is, a misterious zone that everyone take for granted, without even questioning. From philosophers to scientists, from religious figures to common citizens, everybody have something to say about it. I am one of them and want to speak loud and clear.

I´m Mauricio Acero, psychiatry from the São Paulo University in Brazil.

I worked 10 years in Colombia, as a clinician, and meanwhile I wrote short histories, one of them won first place in an event from the Braszilian embassy. There born my interest on Brazil. I felt that it was time for a change for me, that I need my life to move on. I came here, to Brazil, to São Paulo, leaving behind family and work, looking for studying at one of the best universities in the south hemisphere. And I was right, I learn a lot here.

During the time of residency I learn a lot and I begin to gather interest on one of the lines of research developed in the Psychiatric Institute of the São Paulo University: Love. And not only love, pathologic love.

Pathologic love? Exists something like that? It is not too much to pathologize something that seems so natural, something that everybody feels, in different intensities, through them life times? “Sounds crazy” I thought at first. But I got a feeling, deep inside, that yes, there´s something wrong with love in our culture.

That day born Love´s Revolution, a book that I have been cooking through these last 3 years. It had been growing from my study and work as psychiatry student, my lectures and from my own experiences becoming a grownig and beautiful pile of notes and pages marked. And it is time to put order to the letters.

What´s all about

Love is one of the most important issues in western culture, and in human culture. Exist moutais of films, songs, soap operas and yes, books. Bond to one feeling exist thousands of myths, symbols and forces that mold our lives and behaviors. The answer to why is so important is out of question as it is obvious.

We englobe so many things under the word "love" that we tend to mix different feelings, emotions and desires into an amorphus mass that leave us more confused. It is difficult to identify what´s going on inside. What are we talking about when we speak "love"?

All this cultural building surrounding love is well constructed? Are all we suffering unnecessarily? There´s are other forms of love less “pathologic” than others? And all this have something to do with us? Are we guilty? These questions and more will be discussed in the book.

What in the name of love are we doing wrong? Or everything is alright? Is our way of loving responding to our own deep feelings and desires or it is just some other form of system, a structure pre-formed by religions or governments? Could exist freedom and happiness in love? If you´re feeling it too, there´s something you can do to change it?

Love´s Revolution will be not a guide for a perfect relationship, it not pretend to "teach", to be a "how to". It just want to show that others forms of thinking love are possible. At end, revolution is only inside you.

What I need

The Book is initiating its process of been written, although some of the material is in my hands already. The path is long but sure. The funds collected are for living in the 6-8 months process of writing: rent and services, transport and alimentation, polls and interviews, for a full time dedication at one of the most expensive cities of South America (São Paulo). This is one of the challenges for writers. Research and write needs time.

Here is how the money would be used:

- 6 to 8 months of work left, around US$ 1000 each for for basic expenses.

- US$ 2000 for graphic design and mounting.

- US$ 2000 for traduction expenses (the book will be writte in spanish at first).

What I expect

To bring into discussion new ways to look at love, to help those that look for understanding, to open visions around one of the oldest issues and to bring revolution into your hearts.

You can follow the writing precess at https://www.facebook.com/lovesrevolution

story:
Our Story

We are everyday women that wanted an everyday solution to the mess we called our closets. (and our lives...shhh....) We quickly realized that 99.95678% of women cannot identify with the Rachel Zoe's of the world. While fabulous, I can't spend $900 per designer sock. You know? Reality sunk in and we wanted to inspire the everyday woman to get off the couch, dust off her cheeto sweatpants and make some changes to her wardrobe (and her life...shhh..) Women, we get it...life is hard. You have stress coming at you from every angle, don't let one of those stresses be your appearance. We have developed "Five Weeks to Fabulous" - it's a five week no-fail plan to take your appearance from drab to fab!


The Impact

Our book is an inspiration to women of all ages. A preteen can read our book and get the same inspiration from it as a post-menopausal woman. (but we don't talk about menopause because it's made of evil) This book isn't about spending 7 million dollars on a new wardrobe - it's about organizing your life. We truly believe that women need a book like this. A plan that is easy to follow, doesn't cost a lot of money and gives them real world advice is what women have been waiting for. We want to inspire women of all ages to find their confidence and organize their lives so they can tackle the world every single day with the determination to succeed. If our book doesn't get printed, women may continue to wear cheeto sweatpants in public...men, do you really want that to happen?


What We Need & What You Get

The money will be used for editing, the design of the front and back cover of the book. It will also be used for the inside layout, photography and marketing. Depending on the amount you choose to give you will get some great perks Including dinner with both the author's...and we are awesome so I wouldn't miss out that opportunity.


Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is extremely powerful.

Write about us, Facebook about us, Interview us, Love us (wait, what?)

Tweet about us @thisponytail (Dana) @EmilyNCouch (Emily - yes my last name is Couch...yes it does suck)

When our book is published buy it or give it as a gift or BOTH!

Email us and we will send you a link to buy the book once published:

Dana: dana@doesthisponytailmakemybuttlookbig.com

Emily: EmilyNicholeCouch@gmail.com (are you done laughing at my last name yet?)

story:
I believe the thoughts we think today create the future we will have tomorrow. My mission is to teach children the power of their thoughts and give them the awareness to know they can choose the life they want to have.

My name is Miriam Laundry, I am a Canadian children’s Author with a goal of empowering children to believe in themselves and to know they CAN! I write books that inspire and empower children to make choices that promote confidence, happiness and responsibility. I am the creator of the “I CAN” children’s book series.

As a mother of four young children it’s very important to me that my children grow up being confident, happy and positive individuals.  I feel it is my responsibility to help them make the choices in life that will give them a foundation to stand on.


Partners

                                   

I am honoured to be receiving the Winspiration Award for 2014 which "...recognizes exceptional and inspiring individuals for their personal and impressing civic engagement." I am happy to partner with Wolfgang G. Sonnenburg and Nikken and Nikken Network Partners to promote positive well-being. Together we will build a bright future!

Nikken was founded with a vision of caring and helping others and today their products reflect the 5 Pillars of Health® — Healthy Body, Mind, Family, Society and Finances.

Winspiration Day  is a day EVERYONE can fashion with creativity and imagination. Winspiraton is a day for doing good. We all should share in this day because it’s a day by us for all of us. Winspiration Day is May 7th, the same day as our Guinness World Record™ Event! Everyone can participate in looking to the future by thinking positively and saying "I CAN!"


Thank you for visiting my Indiegogo campaign!




Our Goal: EMPOWER 100,000 CHILDREN TO BELIEVE IN THEMSELVES.

We are planning to achieve this goal by going for a  Guinness World Record™!

The record is “LARGEST ONLINE BOOK DISCUSSION IN A 24 HOUR PERIOD”

You can participate in 4 Easy Steps!

  1. Pre-register to let us know your commitment to empower children and your desire to set a Guinness World Record™!
  2. Read a copy of ‘I CAN Believe In Myself’ before or on May 6th, 2014.
  3. Leave a comment on our blog at www.LaundryBooks.com/recordblog between 2 p.m. EST on May 6th and 2 p.m. EST on May 7th 2014.
  4. Wait and see if together we set a Guinness World Record™! 

Who can participate? 

- Everyone can! Children and adults. The goal of this event is to open the channels of communication between parents and their children, teachers and students about self-esteem, believing in themselves and the importance of our thoughts. 


How You Can Help 

We have two goals with this campaign. First, to bring an Official Guinness Adjudicator to come and verify our attempt on May 7th and second, to publish our 2nd book, "I CAN Make a Difference". Any funds above our goal will be donated to The Healthy Mind Organization. Healthy Child Healthy World's mission is to empower parents to take action and protect children from harmful chemicals.

The cost to pay for an Adjudicator’s time, flight and accommodations is close to $15,000.  We need your support to make this happen.  The excitement is building with the children already signed up to participate, 31,000 and growing daily. This Guinness World Record Attempt for many will be the only time that they will get to experience something like this and become part of history!

The second part of this fundraiser has to do with the second book in the series.  This book has already been written, has been edited and is just waiting for the funds to go to the illustrator, the page layout artist and finally, the printing company. As a self-published Author these expenses are all out-of pocket. Having had invested a great amount of finances in the release of the first book and the time (9 months) plus expenses associated with putting a campaign such as Guinness together , I know the large investment it takes.

The other $10,000 requested through this Indiegogo campaign will commence the 2nd book and I will work very hard at doing Author Visits to come up the remainder funds needed to publish the book.

I am putting it out there to you because I believe that the message in this new book is greatly needed in our children.  The book is entitled “I CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE”.



Testimonials 

“Two little words that make a big difference…I CAN. This book is clever, cute and very effective. It helps children believe in themselves and improve their self-esteem. Highly recommended!”

- Jack Canfield, Co-author of Chicken Soup for the Soul and The Success Principles

"Miriam's book presents a marvellous way to help kids reach their goals. It looks deceptively simple but conveys profound, deep truth that should be spread to each and every kid in our world."

- Wolfgang G. Sonnenburg, founder of the Winspiration Day Association and author of The Best is Yet to Come.

"Mrs. Laundry’s “I Can” message is universal and relevant to everyone. It feels good to be a part of such a wonderful global crusade for the children."

- Kurt H. Fulle, President & CEO of Nikken International, Inc.

“What a great way for children to learn at an early age to let go of limiting beliefs while creating new, empowering ones. “I CAN…believe in myself” has a message all children need to hear!”

- Carol Kline, co-author of the New York Times bestselling book, Happy for No Reason and Chicken Soup 


For more testimonials, click Here

Other Ways You Can Help

There are 4 ways you can help:

  1. Give a financial donation (Any amount helps!)
  2. Please tell your friends. (share it in your social media)
  3. Help us set a Guinness World Record and participate yourself, pre-register Here.
  4. Give me a hug next time you see me because - I love HUGS and because putting myself out there like this - is hard for me 

Together we CAN make a difference!

Together we will build a bright future!Nikken was founded with a vision of caring and helping others and today their products reflect the 5 Pillars of Health® — Healthy Body, Mind, Family, Society and Finances.Winspiration Day  is a day EVERYONE can fashion with creativity and imagination. Winspiraton is a day for doing good. We all should share in this day because it’s a day by us for all of us. Winspiration Day is May 7th, the same day as our Guinness World Record™ Event! Everyone can participate in looking to the future by thinking positively and saying "I CAN!"Thank you for visiting my Indiegogo campaign!
Our Goal: EMPOWER 100,000 CHILDREN TO BELIEVE IN THEMSELVES.
We are planning to achieve this goal by going for a  Guinness World Record™!The record is “LARGEST ONLINE BOOK DISCUSSION IN A 24 HOUR PERIOD”You can participate in 4 Easy Steps!
Pre-register to let us know your commitment to empower children and your desire to set a Guinness World Record™!
Read a copy of ‘I CAN Believe In Myself’ before or on May 6th, 2014.
Leave a comment on our blog at www.LaundryBooks.com/recordblog between 2 p.m. EST on May 6th and 2 p.m. EST on May 7th 2014.
Wait and see if together we set a Guinness World Record™! 
Who can participate? - Everyone can! Children and adults. The goal of this event is to open the channels of communication between parents and their children, teachers and students about self-esteem, believing in themselves and the importance of our thoughts. How You Can Help We have two goals with this campaign. First, to bring an Official Guinness Adjudicator to come and verify our attempt on May 7th and second, to publish our 2nd book, "I CAN Make a Difference". Any funds above our goal will be donated to The Healthy Mind Organization. Healthy Child Healthy World's mission is to empower parents to take action and protect children from harmful chemicals.
The cost to pay for an Adjudicator’s time, flight and accommodations is close to $15,000.  We need your support to make this happen.  The excitement is building with the children already signed up to participate, 31,000 and growing daily. This Guinness World Record Attempt for many will be the only time that they will get to experience something like this and become part of history!
The second part of this fundraiser has to do with the second book in the series.  This book has already been written, has been edited and is just waiting for the funds to go to the illustrator, the page layout artist and finally, the printing company. As a self-published Author these expenses are all out-of pocket. Having had invested a great amount of finances in the release of the first book and the time (9 months) plus expenses associated with putting a campaign such as Guinness together , I know the large investment it takes.
The other $10,000 requested through this Indiegogo campaign will commence the 2nd book and I will work very hard at doing Author Visits to come up the remainder funds needed to publish the book.
I am putting it out there to you because I believe that the message in this new book is greatly needed in our children.  The book is entitled “I CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE”.Testimonials “Two little words that make a big difference…I CAN. This book is clever, cute and very effective. It helps children believe in themselves and improve their self-esteem. Highly recommended!”
- Jack Canfield, Co-author of Chicken Soup for the Soul and The Success Principles"Miriam's book presents a marvellous way to help kids reach their goals. It looks deceptively simple but conveys profound, deep truth that should be spread to each and every kid in our world."- Wolfgang G. Sonnenburg, founder of the Winspiration Day Association and author of The Best is Yet to Come."Mrs. Laundry’s “I Can” message is universal and relevant to everyone. It feels good to be a part of such a wonderful global crusade for the children."- Kurt H. Fulle, President & CEO of Nikken International, Inc.“What a great way for children to learn at an early age to let go of limiting beliefs while creating new, empowering ones. “I CAN…believe in myself” has a message all children need to hear!”- Carol Kline, co-author of the New York Times bestselling book, Happy for No Reason and Chicken Soup 
For more testimonials, click HereOther Ways You Can HelpThere are 4 ways you can help:

Give a financial donation (Any amount helps!)
Please tell your friends. (share it in your social media)
Help us set a Guinness World Record and participate yourself, pre-register Here.
Give me a hug next time you see me because - I love HUGS and because putting myself out there like this - is hard for me 

Together we CAN make a difference!

story:
Short Summary

Ryan and Robbie and the Kung Fu Baby teaches kids that bullying at school and on the play ground is not ok.  Kids Love these books, they stay checked out in the libraries, and that is what this hardback print run will help us accomplish. Kids find the book funny, and delight in the message that there are thoughtful ways to handle a situation like bullying -- and that they are not alone.

Roger Hackett came from the Technology industry where he worked at Apple, Toshiba, and Microsoft.  He partnered with Emma Walton Hamilton who reads the book, and Emma is a best selling author as well and an author of kids books.  She is also a daughter of a true legend in the entertainment industry...I will leave that for you to discover.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to print hardback books, because libraries lend them over and over to kids, and this is by far the preferred way for young kids to read with their parents, teachers, and loved ones.  With your support we can print 1200 books, and reach over 100 libraries.  This will cost us $8500, which is about how much we will raise if we meet our goal.  If we don't quite meet our goal, we will print less books.  If we exceed our goal, we can also invest in improvements in our Mobile, Social, Web presence, and PR.  With my first book, I went on TV over 6 times.  The videos are on my Facebook page. 

The Impact

For my first book, I visited over 10 schools from Hawaii to Brooklyn, NYC.  The USA has an incredibly diverse set of kids and they loved having an author read to them.  They were so emotional as they asked me for autographs and shared there experiences.  This 2nd book, takes all of the feedback and learning from the 1st book and based on the 100 soft copies we were able to print and share -- kids love this book.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute, help us get the word out.  Tell your PTA about it, tell libraries.  Share this campaign at Church and in your Kung Fu studios and Karate dojo's.  Tell us what other perks we can offer!

story:
Greetings!

My name is Adrian Hawaleshka and all my life I have wanted to be a writer. Ideas would come and go but the discipline to finish things... to 'close the deal' so to speak... was lacking!

Then... the ultimate incentive came along... on April 25th, 2011.. my son Luka was born... all 9lbs 10oz of him! 


I had not been exposed as a child to many English children's books (having been raised with Ukrainian as my first language) but of course, with Luka's arrival, I quickly became OVER-EXPOSED to them. After reading what seems like thousands of them, I came to the following realization: 

Some of these are plain TERRIBLE! 

I started to long for children's stories that had a beginning, middle and an end (for ex. The Gruffalo- excellent book!). Inevitably, a thought came to mind: Wouldn't it be great if I could write a children's story that Luka would be able to read to his child someday? Luka could tell his son or daughter that Grandpa wrote this! How cool would that be!?!

Luckily, I already had an idea courtesy of my 3 year old nephew Maksym. On the way back from the beach in Gimli (a small town along Lake Winnipeg in Manitoba), there is an enormous white adirondack chair by the side of Hwy #8 nestled in front of a pine forest.


 My nephew was terrified of this chair. He would always ask: 'What giant sits in that chair? Why is he watching me? What does he want?' So of course, I thought it would be a neat little children's story to describe who sits in the chair and why he sits there, all alone,by the side of the road.

After about a year of writing... deleting... then writing again... I've completed the book and now hope to self-publish it.  The story revolves around a boy who grows so large he is a danger to the people around him (who happen to be 2 feet tall... close to my hobbit-like height!). The villagers build him a home in the woods and a chair by the road where he would wait for his friends to come and play with him.


Eventually, he gets quite lonely and is saved by the emergence of a giant dog that befriends him.


Here's a short snippet from the story:

"He had paws much larger than any regular feet,

And fur golden brown , like an ocean of wheat.

He had big floppy ears. His eyes were constantly smiling,

And his tail caused a gale that was quite alarming!

He followed Luka everywhere: To his home and through the glen,

To the stream in the woods...And then back again!

They played in the forest through all kinds of weather.

Come rain or come shine, they were always together.

Except late every evening, by the light of the moon,

The dog went away and would be back before noon.

Although Luka would worry when he left every day,

Once he returned Luka would lovingly say:

‘I don’t know where you go to, I don’t even know your name.

I don’t know if you’ll stay with me,

But I love you just the same!

If you ever find yourself 

Lost, and not sure where to go,

I’ll be waiting for you,

In my chair by the side of the road."


I commissioned custom illustrations by Natasha Boone, an awesome illustrator I discovered that lives right here within the frigid borders  of Winnipeg (my hometown!). Here is an example of some of the rough drafts (final copy yet to come):



With Natasha's support/great work and the support of my wife Joleen and her good friend Theresa (who has become my publicist... feels surreal even saying that!!!!), I am 75% of the way to my goal: Leaving tangible evidence for my son that Dad wasn't a total idiot!  I am going to try to get the book 'out-there'. I've never done this before but maybe... just maybe... people will like it! I do hope so!

What the money will be used for

After much research and haggling... the costs have 'shaken down' as follows:

1) Friesen Press/Publishing/Illustrator(copy edit, layout, publishing- ebook, hardcover, paperback,illustrations etc) plus Illustrator- $6600.00

3) Marketing- $3000.00

I have already paid the illustrator. After the publishing costs have been covered, I would like to market the book as much as possible (any excess funds will go to that end)

If you can't contribute:

Any word of mouth is helpful. Spread the word and look for the book on amazon in about 6 months (fingers crossed)

story:
Short Summary

The idea behind Blue Lips is to create a collection that tells my personal story around the theme of violence, abuse, hope and recovery. I believe that this is a universal topic that everyone around the world can relate to and it has been an integral part of my storytelling. This campaign will help me offset the cost of getting the collection published. As an artist, it is hard to create materials without the proper funding so I am reaching out to the community for support in publishing the first 150 copies. In the future, I would like to find a sponsor that will pay for the printing of the book and I can donate the books to different venues that battle violence and abuse in the community.

How will this help me?

·  It helps me keep the initial cost of printing the book low which ensures a healthy return. “Take Me Home”, although successful sale wise, did not produce much in return.

·   It gives me a chance to sell the book at a much affordable cost ($15 donation gets you a copy of the book as opposed to buying it for $20 once printed.)

- Focus on setting up for the Book Launch happening early July

·  Peace of mind

What We Need & What You Get

UPDATE: You can also donate in person or by email transfer (henrick.sales@gmail.com)

The campaign is hoping to raise $750 that will go towards printing the first 150 copies of the book. Anything raise over and above the goal will be used to help pay for the artist who made the cover of the book, promotion for the book launch, and to print out more copies of the book.

Community challenge: If the campaign raises $1,250 all the books published will include a complimentary CD of the artist reading his work.

Depending on the donation you make you will receive a combination of the different perks which include:

·  A copy of the book

·  A hard cover copy of the book

·  Name appearing at the backdrop during the Book Launch

·  Sponsor names appearing at the back of the book

·  A bonus poem that will come in the mail on the back of a mystery postcard

The Impact

By investing to me and this book you are also investing in the community in which I write, perform and work. It enables me to spend more time and energy doing workshops and performances in and around the community. In doing so, I am hoping to inspire other young writers to publish and create beautiful artwork. By donating, you are also helping me create more work for people to enjoy, share and experience. But don’t just take the words of this campaign page; here are words by others:

 “Shoolie prompted students to write poetically and speak confidently about themes and content that arose from their classes, including issues of identity, tolerance, community and the history and legacy of genocide. Throughout this process, it was my pleasure to be in the classroom with him and see the way he inspired, encouraged, and helped the students throughout the writing and performance process.    Jasmine Wong, Program Associate – Facing History and Ourselves

“Shoolie is one of those rare poets that are as equally electric on the page as they are on the stage. Blue Lips is easily one of the best collections by a young writer that I have read in a long time.”    Spencer Butt, Poet

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help in other ways you can also:

Share the page and get the word out! The more people here about this, the more likely I will be able to reach my goal and introduce them to some gnarly poetry.

Sending me encouragement, positive energy and love!

#BlueLips


Sponsored by:

story:
Who am I?

My name is Paul Salley and I am currently writing a biography of Jimmy McCulloch's life and career. He was a gifted guitarist known for his work with Wings, Stone The Crows, Thunderclap Newman and The Dukes, among others.

Over the past six and a half years, I have been compiling a visual archive of his musical career and seeking out people who personally knew him. To date, I am in touch with people from each stage of his life including his family. Among those that I've interviewed are Pete Townshend and John Mayall. 


What We Need & What You Get

Writing a book isn't cheap. Production costs can add up quickly with licensing fees for photographs, editing, printing and publishing. It's a ton of work but all part of the process. 

To give this book the proper treatment it deserves, I'm asking for your help in assisting me. 

The minimum goal that I am trying to reach is $7,000 with the money that is raised going towards the production costs mentioned above. 

To show my gratitude, there will be awesome perks for each stage of donations so check 'em out!


The Impact

Originally, I had planned for this to be just another biography about a rock musician before realizing that “No, he deserves better than that because not only was wee Jimmy an incredible musician who poured his heart and soul into his music, he was also a brother, son and a mate.” Little Wing: The Jimmy McCulloch Story will feature interviews from the people who knew him best in addition to rare and unseen photographs taken throughout his life.


This project is a labor of love for me and has touched many lives, including his family. It has reconnected people who hadn't seen each other in over 40 + years and I can't tell you how good that makes me feel, reuniting long lost friends all because of a wee lad from Scotland who played guitar.


Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can't contribute financially, there are still ways you can help like spreading the word through social media websites like Facebook, Twitter and YouTube in addition to letting your friends and family know. 

Every donation is appreciated :)

story:
PROJECT BACKGROUND

Following a four-car accident in 2009, I reflected upon my life and created a list of my values.  Essentially by making this list, I was taking an emotional and spiritual inventory and rekindling my self-love—the third wave of self-love I’ve experienced in my adult life.   Gradually, I began realigning myself with those values.      This love became the foundation for my forthcoming book, Midnight Peaches, Two O’Clock Patience, which is a collection of essays, poetry, prose, and fiction on themes ranging from motherhood and ancestral connection to body image and sexuality.  The title traces its origin to a line from one of my poems,  “Midnight peaches…two o’clock patience.  That’s all she needed,” referring to my daughter waking up in the middle of the night to eat peaches and then returning to sleep. Collectively, these pieces become a story of a woman’s desire to become reacquainted with herself.   

Many of you were there to witness that first wave of self-love back in 1998 when I wrote my first poem, “Did You Know?”  Even more of you were there to celebrate the release of my memoir, Crushing Soft Rubies--A Memoir in 2005 and witnessed the wave of self-love that followed that process.  Thanks to your kind donations, Broken Shackle Publishing, Int'l was born and Crushing Soft Rubies was published.  This memoir has been used as a course textbook at UC Berkeley, San Francisco State University, Santa Rosa Junior College, and Gavilan College and has led to a number of fabulous opportunities to do readings, performances, and speaking engagements at various venues across the country.   Throughout this journey, I have learned about the healing power of words--how a single person’s story creates the space for others to share their stories, forming a communal healing circle that knows no boundaries.  Now through Midnight Peaches, Two O’Clock Patience, I've learned, once again, how self-love can inspire all of us to create.

To assist with the publication, promotion, and distribution of Midnight Peaches, Two O’Clock Patience by January 2012, I am seeking the generous support of donors.   I know these are difficult economic times, so any help you can provide will be greatly appreciated.    

GIFTS 


Donations $25-99

 

Donors who pledge $25-99 will receive one free copy of Midnight Peaches, Two O'Clock Patience and a publicity sticker for the book. You will be considered official members of the Broken Shackle Publishing Family and receive Larkin, Yahaira, or Sterling membership, depending on the donation amount. The Broken Shackle Publishing Family receives email updates about Janet Stickmon's upcoming performances, events, and workshops. 


NOTE: 

$25.00--Larkin* Membership

$50.00--Yahaira* Membership

$75.00--Sterling* Membership


*Larkin, Yahaira, and Sterling are characters in the fictional pieces in Midnight Peaches, Two O'Clock Patience who QUESTION, RESIST, and CREATE--actions that Broken Shackle Publishing stands for.

 

Donations $100 or more

 

For donations $100 or more, donors will receive one free copy of Midnight Peaches, Two O'Clock Patience, a publicity sticker, and receive Gold Taraji, Zulu Spear, or Healing Ear membership status, depending on the donation amount. In addition to being welcomed into the Broken Shackle Publishing Family (i.e. receiving email updates about Janet Stickmon's upcoming performances, events, and workshops), your name will be mentioned in the acknowledgement section of the book. 


NOTE: 

$100.00--Gold Taraji* Membership

$250.00--Zulu Spear** Status

$500.00--Healing Ear** Status


*Gold Taraji, a physics professor in her 40's and a single-mother of a two year old daughter, is the main character in the fictional pieces in Midnight Peaches, Two O'Clock Patience. Dr. Gold Taraji is a warm and fierce woman committed to self-love, self-discovery, and maintaining her connection to her ancestors. 

**Zulu Spear and Healing Ear members remind humanity of the value of engaging in both emotional and physical combat when seeking to co-create a just world.


Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD!  POST ON FACEBOOK.  SEND TO ALL ON YOUR EMAIL LISTS. THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT!!!!

spiritual inventory and rekindling my self-love—the third wave of self-love
I’ve experienced in my adult life.   Gradually, I began realigning
myself with those values.      This love became the foundation
for my forthcoming book, Midnight Peaches, Two O’Clock Patience, which is a
collection of essays, poetry, prose, and fiction on themes ranging from
motherhood and ancestral connection to body image and sexuality.  The
title traces its origin to a line from one of my poems,  “Midnight
peaches…two o’clock patience.  That’s all she needed,” referring to my
daughter waking up in the middle of the night to eat peaches and then returning
to sleep. Collectively, these pieces become a story of a woman’s desire to
become reacquainted with herself.   
Many of you were there to
witness that first wave of self-love back in 1998 when I wrote my first poem,
“Did You Know?”  Even more of you were there to celebrate the release of
my memoir, Crushing Soft Rubies--A Memoir in 2005 and witnessed the wave of
self-love that followed that process.  Thanks to your kind donations,
Broken Shackle Publishing, Int'l was born and Crushing Soft Rubies was
published.  This memoir has been used as a course textbook at UC Berkeley,
San Francisco State University, Santa Rosa Junior College, and Gavilan College
and has led to a number of fabulous opportunities to do readings, performances,
and speaking engagements at various venues across the country.  
Throughout this journey, I have learned about the healing power of words--how a
single person’s story creates the space for others to share their stories,
forming a communal healing circle that knows no boundaries.  Now
through Midnight Peaches, Two O’Clock Patience, I've learned, once again,
how self-love can inspire all of us to create.
To assist with the
publication, promotion, and distribution of Midnight Peaches, Two O’Clock
Patience by January 2012, I am seeking the generous support of donors.   I
know these are difficult economic times, so any help you can provide will be
greatly appreciated.    



GIFTS 

Donations $25-99

 
Donors who pledge $25-99
will receive one free copy of Midnight Peaches, Two O'Clock Patience and a
publicity sticker for the book. You will be considered official members of the
Broken Shackle Publishing Family and receive Larkin, Yahaira, or Sterling
membership, depending on the donation amount. The Broken Shackle Publishing
Family receives email updates about Janet Stickmon's upcoming performances,
events, and workshops. 

NOTE: 
$25.00--Larkin* Membership
$50.00--Yahaira*
Membership
$75.00--Sterling* Membership

*Larkin, Yahaira, and Sterling are
characters in the fictional pieces in Midnight Peaches, Two O'Clock Patience
who QUESTION, RESIST, and CREATE--actions that Broken Shackle Publishing stands
for.

 
Donations $100 or more

 
For donations $100 or
more, donors will receive one free copy of Midnight Peaches, Two O'Clock
Patience, a publicity sticker, and receive Gold Taraji, Zulu Spear, or Healing
Ear membership status, depending on the donation amount. In addition to being
welcomed into the Broken Shackle Publishing Family (i.e. receiving email
updates about Janet Stickmon's upcoming performances, events, and workshops),
your name will be mentioned in the acknowledgement section of the book. 

NOTE: 
$100.00--Gold Taraji* Membership
$250.00--Zulu Spear** Status
$500.00--Healing Ear** Status

*Gold Taraji, a physics professor in her 40's
and a single-mother of a two year old daughter, is the main character in the
fictional pieces in Midnight Peaches, Two O'Clock Patience. Dr. Gold Taraji is
a warm and fierce woman committed to self-love, self-discovery, and maintaining
her connection to her ancestors. 
**Zulu Spear and Healing Ear members remind
humanity of the value of engaging in both emotional and physical combat when
seeking to co-create a just world.



Other Ways You Can Help
PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD!  POST ON FACEBOOK.  SEND TO ALL ON YOUR EMAIL LISTS. THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT!!!!

story:
To continue to celebrate the memory of Leslie Cora Williams (http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/260261/x/1654750) Let's help another Mito patient!
 
CJ is a 16 year old boy with Mitochondrial Disease. For CJ everyday is a battle. CJ’s mitochondrial disease presents as fatigue, failure to gain weight, short stature, ptosis, hypotonia, muscle weakness and cramping, irritable bowel syndrome, hearing loss, gastrointestinal problems, dysautonomia, migraines, autistic features, mental retardation, developmental delays, vomiting, and nausea. When you have a disease that is not well understood such as mitochondrial disease, it is hard for others to truly understand what you are going through. They may think that you look too healthy to be missing so much school or they misjudge you. You see other kids out playing sports and going to school every day. You wish that you could do that, too, instead of sitting home and resting or taking so many medicines every day. Yet, all you really want to do is be healthy enough to go to school, play outside without getting sick. You're tired of going to the doctors so much and needing to be in the hospital because you don't feel good. CJ’s anxiety makes him uncomfortable entering new situations. Transitions are stressful for him, and he needs extra support for them to be successful. Social situations are also extremely difficult because CJ has trouble interacting with other children and adults.
We are thrilled to have the opportunity for CJ to have a NEADS dog! This dog would help him to feel more secure during transitions, and perhaps be more receptive to new experiences. A NEADs dog can be a constant friend and support during his numerous medical visits. A NEADs dog can be trained to help calm him when he is becoming overwhelmed. CJ’s dog would be his best friend and a comfort to him when he needs to rest instead of doing all those things that most peers and even adults take for granted.
We are trying to raise $9500.00 for this special dog for CJ. We hope that you will help CJ reach his goal.
We would appreciate your support for CJ and Neads and are most grateful for consideration of such.
Thank-You!

story:
A BIG THANK YOU ! to everyone who helped support my project

while I didn't reach my goal I did raise enough money to print 500 copies of my book. 

If you are interested in a copy visit my website to buy one http://www.waxcastle.ca/SHOP

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

CONTEXT  Traditionally the practice of gleaning was a social activity, typically carried out by poor peasant woman. Together they would carefully and diligently reap the fields of left over food after the harvest. Gleaning was a widely accepted practice, and was conceived as a measure of welfare for those less fortunate. However controversial, as gleaners would make use of food that did not belong to them on land that was not theirs. The attitude of the time was prudent and sensible therefore food must not be wasted and such a practice was thought to be beneficial to everyone.



STOOP / PICK / CRUISE /

RUMMAGE / LOAD-UP / REAP /

SLAG / SCAVENGE / BIN /

GLEAN /

.... are all practices by which one person makes use of what another discards. 

The utopian idealists of the 60’s & 70’s challenged the conventions of property, public space and domestic lifestyle. Groups like Superstudio imagined a reality where space becomes non-hierarchal and autonomous. Where the landscape of both the city and country is liberated and accessible to everyone equally.

Such ideals are subversive yet concede the dilemma of a culture that was dissatisfied with their current social, political and economic environment. 

The utopian movement inspired an accretion of alternative informal settlements. Places like the Open City in Chile , Scoleri’s Arcosanti in the Arizona desert and Christiania in Copenhagen were radical experiments in socialism, architecture, and community.

As a typology of settlement, these informal communities are predicated on an ad-hoc and intuitive method of construction. Those living in such a community are active participants in the making of their home and their neighborhood. In fact, more than 1 /3 of the world's population live in a home that they built themselves.

The issues that once spread over the french rural landscape are evident today in our contemporary urban cityscapes. The predicament of urban decay and vacancy are products of post-industrialization and economic blight. Rather than orchards of un-picked grapes and fields of un-gathered potatoes, there are vast neighbourhoods of abandoned buildings, vacated lots, demolished factories and neglected homes. Not unlike the idealists of the 60’s, a subculture of people are once again dissatisfied.

THE HANDBOOK  addresses the tactical and perhaps banal issues of squatting a building. It is intended to be a fairly generic guide that could be deployed on a site in any given city, however it is inspired by and based upon the real site of 90 Annabella St in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

The order of the book is based on necessity, for instance it is important to know what to do to avoid arrest immediately after breaking into a building. And how to get access to drinking water, heat and cook food before dealing with issues of public space and establishing a communal economy.

Inside you will find roughly 120 illustrated pages with minimal text guiding you through the various chapters. The book covers issues like identifying a potential site, setting up utilities, making general repairs to a building, establishing a community garden and an unconventional economy. The book is prefaced by an introduction from Professor John Bass of the School of Architecture & Landscape Architecture at The Univeristy of British Columbia.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR   After completing an undergradute and masters degree in Architecture and having worked in the field for several years, Larraine Henning decided to quit it all and run away to Australia to wrangle cattle, pick apples, drive around the country in Danger, her 'sweet' Toyota Landcruiser, and sometimes sleep in tents.

This precarious yet liberating lifestyle afforded her the time and mental stamina to revisit her Masters thesis project, with the hope of actually making something of it. Instead of just sitting in a basement library and being fondled by weary and eager grad students, Larraine's thesis is striving to striving to climb the ranks of a properly funded and published, real, live book.

Aside from drawing, making books and working part time in an apple factory, Larraine also enjoys collecting bugs, baking fruit pie and a crisp cold pale ale.

You are welcome to peruse more of her life's work here www.waxcastle.ca

 

THE PERKS   Everyone who contributes, regardless of the amount, will have their name published in the book as a contributor. So that's pretty awsome!

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

ZINE >> The Annoying Treehouse

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

PRINT >> Illustrated print from a book page

 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

POSTER >> Gleaned Objects

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

DONATION >> Floating Gardens Cambodia

Check out the new perk The Noble Scavenger Advocates, this option includes a donation to the Melbourne based non-profit CoDesign Studio. CoDesign Studio is a social enterprise that works with communities, clients and governments to build social inclusion through urban revitalisation projects. Your donation will be used to make CoDesign’s services available to those who would otherwise have no means to access professional architecture, design, planning and community development services. And the money will also go towards their Floating Gardens project in Cambodia.

 

                THANKS  FOR  SUPPORTING  INDEPENDENT  ART !

story:
What?

I've been offered a place on the Clipperton Project, a research and education program, that among other things goes on sailing expeditions with groups of artists across the world. I will be joining them for a month in August 2015, sailing on the recently rescued vessel Lancelot between the islands of Shetland, Fair Isle and Papa Westray. 

I will be using this fantastic opportunity to finalize my second poetry collection. This residency will give me unadulterated time away from the internet to work on this. As a Breton poet with Scottish ancestors, I'm also hoping the particular setting we will explore will feed into my fascination with the six Celtic nations. 

Why I need some help

The Clipperton Project is a not-for-profit, and as such artists are only asked to contribute £200 a week to cover food and board. Not a huge amount in the grand scheme of things, but for 4 weeks that adds up to an £800 I don't have. 

Being a freelancer at the moment, this also means not making an income for the month, so I would be really keen to cover the basics of the expedition (not counting the cost of getting up to Scotland etc) so that I can attend it. 

    What you get

    I know this is a lot of money, but  I hope that the rewards are interesting enough to tempt you to pitch in. I can't emphasize enough what a difference this will make to me, and my writing practice.

    Anyone who contributes to this fund, whether small or large amounts, will get thanked in my next book and on my website.

    Who am I?

    -I'm a poet. My first collection The Shipwrecked House, published by Penned in the Margins was longlisted in the Guardian First Book Awards and has been touring the UK as a one-woman show thanks to Arts Council Funding. I also published a pamphlet with Salt called Low-Tide Lottery. My poems have appeared in all sorts of anthologies, newspapers and magazines over the years including Best British Poetry 2012, The Guardian, The Sunday Times, Magma, POETRY (Chicago), The Charnel House, Furies: Poetry of Women Warriors, etc. I've read my poetry in all sorts of places from Paris to (soon) NYC, from the Ledbury Poetry Festival to The Cube Cinema in Bristol.... 
    -I'm also an editor. You might know Sabotage Reviews, a website I founded nearly five years ago which reviews indie literature. With Tori Truslow I co-edited Verse Kraken, a hybrid art journal that was created thanks to crowdfunding. I also co-organized Penning Perfumes with Odette Toilette, a creative collaboration between poets and perfumers, which toured the UK and resulted in two anthologies edited by me. I'm currently co-editing with Gareth Prior an anthology called Other Countries: Contemporary Poets Rewiring History.
    -I have given poetry workshops for a while now, from local writing groups to Verse Kraken residencies, to Poetry School courses. I have lectured in universities (in French, mind you) for half a decade too, so teaching is something that feels quite natural to me.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't donate anything at the moment, I completely understand, times are hard! It'd be awesome if you could give a shout out on social media!

      Small Print

      In the unlikely event that I raise more than the target, extra money will go towards travel expenses, which are not insubstantial and also covering IndieGoGo fees which take a small percentage of each donation.

story:
Looking for Andy Griffith

LOOKING FOR ANDY GRIFFITH is a literary travelogue. I’ll create a narrative of my physical journey tracing the lines of Andy Griffith’s life and work. (Mostly by car!) Among many other things, I’ll explore how Andy Griffith and the art he helped create intersected and shaped the culture. 

My name is Evan Smith. I'm a writer currently based in Beacon, New York. I've written for the Los Angeles Times, Slate, Salon, and elsewhere. In 2013, I published an essay in the LA Review of Books about the actor Andy Griffith. In the year that followed I expanded the essay into a book proposal, which is now under contract with UNC Press. 

Growing up a fatherless child in North Carolina, Andy Griffith was a real father figure to me, as he was to millions of others, and I’ll examine this commonality more closely, interweaving a personal narrative within the larger story.

Help fund travel to key locations important to the story.

Note: The drive lasts 30 days, but using PayPal makes funds available immediately. Anything in excess of half the fundraising goal of 10K will be donated to the Andy & Cindi Griffith Scholarship fund at the University of North Carolina. (Andy Griffith created the fund in 1972.)

Looking for Andy Griffith Story Project
I've enjoyed hearing everyone's stories. It's amazing. It seems almost everyone I meet has a story about watching The Andy Griffith Show with their family, or watching A Face in the Crowd for the first time, or an anecdote about meeting Andy—so many stories! I wish I could include them all in the book, and would love everyone to hear them. To that end I've created the Looking for Andy Griffith Story Project—a way for anyone to contribute a story, a photo, an audio or video recording, any remembrance—and the goal is those stories will be freely accessible and archived forever. Please contribute here, then go to Looking for Andy Griffith Story Project for info.

Thanks. I appreciate it!
