story:
Short Summary

 

My whole life people have asked me where I'm from. My answer is always different. Sometimes I say: I'm Cuban. Sometimes I say: I'm from Miami, but my parents are Cuban. The question that inevitably follows when the word Cuba makes its way into my answer is: What's Cuba like? Which is when I reveal, always with dismay, that I have never stepped foot on the island. My explanations are always seemingly insufficient. "It would take a book," I always end up saying.

Through a combination of story, personal narrative/memoir, and journalism, Our Cuban Routes  is my real answer to the question: Why not Cuba? Why, when I have travelled to so many other places, Cuba remains the place I have not been able to go to, until now. Further, it explores the idea of what going now means on a larger scale -- what it means for relations between America and Cuba, and towards a New American Identity.

The book will include the narratives of American Born Cubans like myself making their way to Cuba, as well as Cubans who have made the opposite journey into the United States from Cuba. We meet somewhere in the middle, creating a new "borderland" for Cuba or, more optimistically, a new "frontier."

What We Need & What You Get

I am raising $10,000-$12,000 to cover the costs of this project. All money is to be spent on research and research tools, including interview-related expenses such as Cuban-American communities and archives.

All donors will receive mention in the book and an American Born Cuban sticker. Check out our other rewards! 

The Impact

There have been a great many books written about Cuba. About Cuban-Americans "returning" to Cuba and finding a different island than the one they left behind. About the exile community and the Diaspora. What no one is writing about is what I'm calling the Familial Embargo: why so many Cuban-Americans and American-Born-Cubans (ABC's), like myself, have not been "allowed" to go to Cuba because family has stood so adamantly in the way, for so many years.

  Cuba has become a topic of great interest politically, socially, and culturally. Travel restrictions in Cuba are softening. John Kerry, who is anti-embargo, is now Secretary of State...the list of news-worthy, Cuba-related topics goes on and accrues daily.

  Cuba is the subject of my doctoral work at the University of California Irvine, which I am currently completing. I am a Schaeffer Fellow in the English Department, which means that although I must go through the same rigorous training all PhD's must go through, I am allowed to write creatively about my subject. It is my intent to join rigorous research with a tone and form that can reach many.

  I have been conducting interviews for over two years, with ABCs, and with Cubans of my generation born on the island of Cuba that have travelled to the States. In this process, I have found many of my stories -- the stories I want to tell. I believe we are the generation that will be the bridge between the exiled, embargoed Cuba of the past and the Cuba we can reach. It is the ABC's that will finally be able to carry and mediate the conversation on Cuba between the Miami-Cubans, Cubans within the island, and Americans. And it is the Cuban Born Cuban of the same generation that will help educate the ABC and vice-versa.

    Past Work

      In 2012, I published a paper called "The 'Miami-Cuban' (and other Hyphenated-Americans) in the World System," about what it meant for the first migration of Cuban-Americans to refrain from participating in the counter-culture, politically and culturally, for the US.

      On February 3, 2013, I wrote a piece for the LA Times called "Breaking the Family Embargo," in response to Raul Castro's lifting travel restrictions on Cuban citizens. The article explores what it would mean for American Born Cubans to be freed from their own familial restrictions.

      On April 2, 2013, I wrote a piece for Zocolo called "How Cuba Dies," about what it meant for my grandfather to lose his memory, alongside the only living memories our family has of the island/our Cuban past.

      On January 8, 2014, I wrote a piece called "The Unbearable Loneliness of a Cubana in Miami," about a Cuban artist who had moved to Miami, and become disillusioned with the American Dream.

      These are just a few samples. For a complete CV, please visit my website: www.vanessagarcia.org. Specifically: http://vanessagarcia.org/about.php

    Risks & Challenges

    This book involves Cuba, which means there is always risk. There is risk that the laws will change; that we will suddenly have less access to Cuba, for instance. And, yet, this is no risk at all for the book -- because this book is precisely about this moment in time, and whatever occurs will find its way to the pages of the narrative, informing the present.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Spread the word (share on FB, twitter, Instagram)

      Share our ABC stickers. Even if you don't donate, let us know if you want a sticker, we'll send you one!

      Tell your friends about the project, and let us know if you know anyone that would be interesting to include in the book. As the book is still being researched, there is plenty of room for more dialogue, more conversation, and more "characters."
story_txt:
Short Summary 
My whole
life people have asked me where I'm from. My answer is always different.
Sometimes I say: I'm Cuban. Sometimes I say: I'm from Miami, but my parents are
Cuban. The question that inevitably follows when the word Cuba makes its way
into my answer is: What's Cuba like? Which is when I reveal, always with
dismay, that I have never stepped foot on the island. My explanations are
always seemingly insufficient. "It would take a book," I always end up
saying.
Through a combination of story,
personal narrative/memoir, and journalism, Our
Cuban Routes  is my real answer to
the question: Why not Cuba? Why, when I have travelled to so many other places,
Cuba remains the place I have not been able to go to, until now. Further, it
explores the idea of what going now means on a larger scale -- what it means
for relations between America and Cuba, and towards a New American Identity. 
The book will include the narratives of American Born Cubans like myself making their way to Cuba, as well as Cubans who have made the opposite journey into the United States from Cuba. We meet somewhere in the middle, creating a new "borderland" for Cuba or, more optimistically, a new "frontier."
   What We Need & What You Get 
I am raising $10,000-$12,000 to cover the costs of this project. All money is to be spent on research and research tools, including interview-related expenses such as Cuban-American communities and archives.All donors will receive mention in the book and an American Born Cuban sticker. Check out our other rewards!

story:
Short Summary

Hi all! My name is Mary Gudzenovs, and Once Upon A Time my great great great grandfather, Henry Hawson, with his business partner, commissioned a special survey of the remote area of South Australia, named Port Lincoln in 1802 by its discoverer Captain Matthew Flinders.

That was in the late 1830s, and next year it will be 175 years since the first settlers stepped ashore from Henry's brig the Abeona in 1839. To celebrate the event I'm putting together a pictorial history of the fascinating progression of the port into a municipality, and on to its declaration as a city in 1971. 

I've been a history buff since I was a kid and being asked to help the Pioneer & Descendants Club catalogue their collection was a dream come true. When we reached the point where we began to record the huge collection of photographs I was in heaven. I've been looking at old photos of Port Lincoln for nigh on forty years but a lot of these pictures I have never seen!

With the late realisation that 2014 sees the 175th Anniversary of the founding of Port Lincoln I became determined to get the fascinating then-and-now photographs recorded for the future and out into homes so that other kids can discover the history of their home town and the more mature among us can reminisce about the sights they remember from their childhood.

So with the adage 'A PICTURE PAINTS A THOUSAND WORDS' ringing in my ears I set out on my adventure through 175 years worth of images.

The launch of 175 Years: A Pictorial History of Port Lincoln is planned for History Week in May 2014.

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $20,000 to cover the following:

$350 per week living expenses for 12 weeks (so that I am not beholden to the Government while I work) = $4,200

Up to 450 copies softcover production and postage = $8,797

Up to 100 copies linen-covered hardcover with dust jacket and postage = $4,560

Allowance for exchange rate fluctuations, fees, taxes and unforeseen extras = $2443

SAVE $5 on the softcover by buying now at $30!

SAVE $10 on the collectors edition hardcover with dust jacket at just $50!

There are other levels of contribution and associated rewards listed in Your Perks a bit further down.

Multiples of any contribution level are welcome, just let me know how many of which reward you would like. I'll get in touch with those choosing the customised flyleaf closer to production time.

WHAT HAPPENS IF I DON'T RAISE IT ALL?

Well, the world won't fall apart. All money raised, whether I reach the goal or not, will go towards making this book a reality. I might need to work through the night for several months to get it done, but it WILL GET DONE! 

But, with your help, by contributing or sharing this campaign, I will get there! Believe with me people!!

The Impact

I believe you need to know where you came from to know how to get to where you are going. It's certainly been true for me. 

My forebears fought hard for their living and appreciated what they had, and in hard times I have looked back on their lives and realised how easy I do have it. 

So, if money is tight, the car has broken down, the cat needs to go to the vet, I can always look at the pictures and SEE how hard it could be. 

I think pictures, which are an instant, unavoidable truth, have far more impact than words sometimes (not always - I'm a writer too!). 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, I understand, believe me, but you could really help me out by sharing this with all your friends on social media, your email contacts list, family, friends, workmates, coffee club, mates at the pub... the mailman. Anyone and everyone!

Indiegogo has logos for easily sharing on social media, keep an eye out for them. 

Why not check out which reward you would like right now?

Thanks for reading!

story:
This is a heartfelt book comprised of real and raw stories of immigrant experiences with empowering ways to reshape hardships through love and forgiveness. Expected to publish in April 2020.

Story of My Book

My name is Ha Young Shin and I am the author of Reframing the Hyphen: A Christian Perspective on Immigrant Experiences. About a year ago, I found myself at the hospital for what doctors suspected was an autoimmune disease. It was a couple months after my 25th birthday and I hardly had enough strength to do the bare minimum. When I realized that I could not take health for granted, I felt compelled to write this book because I had always desired to share how the Christian faith has helped me to navigate through many obstacles as an immigrant. However, I thought of it as a long-term goal more than anything. I realized that in life, there probably wasn’t going to be the “perfect time” to write a book. For the things that really mattered to me, I knew I had to carve out the time which is why I’m here today.

Since my immigration, I have experienced many internal and external struggles. Internal struggles such as not knowing where I belonged in the “hyphen” of being Korean-American, as well as not knowing how to filter out the different messages from the two distinctive cultures I was part of. External struggles included facing deportation and trying to navigate and assimilate into a foreign country whose language, culture, and systems I was not familiar with.

The Christian faith has been an integral part in how I was able to navigate through the chaos and the dark times that revolved around my immigrant struggles. I wanted to share with those who may have felt lonely amidst their journey that they are not alone and also encourage them to reshape their minds around their difficult circumstances. My hope is that in reading this book, readers will be able to reflect on their personal journeys and choose to reframe their hardships so that if there are residues of resentment and bitterness left in their hearts, they can choose to forgive and have peace.

Through this book, I hope to instill the power of choice so that you, the reader, are able to reframe your mind around your struggles.

You will likely love this book if you:

  • Are an immigrant or your parents/grandparents were immigrants
  • Want to learn about the struggles that immigrants face through real and authentic stories
  • Want to see examples of how you can apply Christian principles toward your hardships

Reframing the Hyphen: A Christian Perspective on Immigrant Experiences is a non-fiction book that encourages immigrants and those who want to learn more about immigrant experiences to reframe their obstacles through the Christian faith.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this spring
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Ha Young Shin is a 1.5 generation Korean-American immigrant and a proud alumna of Georgetown University where she was part of the Georgetown Scholars Program (GSP). In 2019, she won third place in the Sejong Writing Competition for her sijo, a traditional style of Korean poetry. She is also a full-time financial analyst by day and an evening MBA student (at Georgetown) by night.

Ha Young felt compelled to write this book because for the longest time, she felt confused and alone during her immigrant journey and wanted to share her experiences with those who may have felt similarly. In the future, she hopes to go to missions with her husband to share the love of Jesus.

She is an avid Trader Joe’s fan and is a little embarrassed to admit she eats their dark chocolate peanut butter cups more frequently than her daily vitamins. Consequently, she can often be spotted at the gym lifting weights with her husband, who shares her love of chocolates. In her free time, she likes to read, sing, and play the ukulele.

For more information you can email Ha Young at hayoungsj@gmail.com and connect with her on Twitter @hayoungsj

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AimToReframe and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Warmly,
Ha Young Shin

story:
Folks have been asking, now at long last we're gonna write it!

KARP LIVES! The Book! Expands on the story in the documentary film, "Kill All Redneck Pricks: A Documentary Film about a Band Called KARP" and includes many previously unseen pictures and quotes, estimated length of the book should be between 150-200 pages.

Kill All Redneck Pricks: A Documentary Film about a Band Called KARP is the story of three friends overcoming odds through rock n' roll music.

Set in the Pacific Northwest against the backdrop of the Olympia, WA post punk and Riot girl movements of the early 90's, the film details the joys and tragedies of a band called KARP as each band member's life serves as a lightning bolt to a separate destiny.

The book will be written by the director of the documentary film, William E Badgley, to be completed one year from now, September 2016.

"Kill All Redneck Pricks: A Documentary Film about a Band Called KARP" screened over 70 times in 10 countries, was translated into 3 languages and received reviews of "Excellent" in The San Francisco Bay Guardian and "3 out of 4 stars" in The Seattle Times.

KARP LIVES! The Book! Is the biography of a friendship.

story:
Who is Mary Lyons?

Mary Lyons is an Ojibwe elder who has dedicated her life to helping people find balance and healing. Having successfully made her own journey through addiction and recovery, she has gone on to educate and support many others from all backgrounds. A great-grandmother, she has raised hundreds of foster children as well as several children of her own, with a special focus on nurturing children born with fetal alcohol syndrome. She worked for years in the Minnesota child welfare system, was a co-founder of the Wellbriety movement, and has traveled all over the world sharing her wisdom, most recently as a member of the Grandmothers of the Sacred We. In recent years she has participated actively in the Water Is Life movement, including many trips to the Standing Rock anti-pipeline encampment. 

What is the Wisdom Lessons Book?

Mary Lyons has recorded lessons learned from a lifetime that has included many challenges as well as a steadfast determination to serve her family, community and the people of the world. Her thousands of social media followers look forward to her daily short wisdom lesson posts, and Green Fire Press is honored to take on the project of bringing all her wisdom lessons together in book form. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 to edit the Wisdom Lessons; prepare the manuscript; and cover typesetting, book design and publication costs. Project directors Jennifer Browdy and Grace Rossman will interview Mary Lyons and write an introduction to the book. Our aim is to have the book launched by Fall 2018. 

Your perks include project updates, postcard versions of Mary's Wisdom Lessons and copies of the book. 

If we don't reach our goal with this campaign, we will start another one! We are determined to see Mary's Wisdom Lessons into the world.

 

About the Editors

Jennifer Browdy, Ph.D., has successfully edited three anthologies: Women Writing Resistance in Latin America and the Caribbean (Beacon Press, 2017), African Women Writing Resistance (University of Wisconsin Press, 2010) and Writing Fire: Celebrating the Power of Women's Words (Green Fire Press, 2017). The co-founder of Green Fire Press, is a professor of literature at Bard College/Simon's Rock and has long been dedicated to nurturing the voices and visions of women of all ages and from many walks of life. 

Grace Rossman is a spoken word poet, writer, and teacher of creative writing and performance. Her work focuses on addiction, recovery, and healing. She loves to collaborate with other women writers who seek to bring balance to the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially to this campaign. But there are other ways you can help us out!

  • Share our campaign with your social network
  • Follow Mary Lyons on Facebook and share her posts
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Who is Mary Lyons?
Mary Lyons is an Ojibwe elder who has dedicated her life to helping people find balance and healing. Having successfully made her own journey through addiction and recovery, she has gone on to educate and support many others from all backgrounds. A great-grandmother, she has raised hundreds of foster children as well as several children of her own, with a special focus on nurturing children born with fetal alcohol syndrome. She worked for years in the Minnesota child welfare system, was a co-founder of the Wellbriety movement, and has traveled all over the world sharing her wisdom, most recently as a member of the Grandmothers of the Sacred We. In recent years she has participated actively in the Water Is Life movement, including many trips to the Standing Rock anti-pipeline encampment. 
What is the Wisdom Lessons Book?
Mary Lyons has recorded lessons learned from a lifetime that has included many challenges as well as a steadfast determination to serve her family, community and the people of the world. Her thousands of social media followers look forward to her daily short wisdom lesson posts, and Green Fire Press is honored to take on the project of bringing all her wisdom lessons together in book form. 
What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 to edit the Wisdom Lessons; prepare the manuscript; and cover typesetting, book design and publication costs. Project directors Jennifer Browdy and Grace Rossman will interview Mary Lyons and write an introduction to the book. Our aim is to have the book launched by Fall 2018. 
Your perks include project updates, postcard versions of Mary's Wisdom Lessons and copies of the book. 
If we don't reach our goal with this campaign, we will start another one! We are determined to see Mary's Wisdom Lessons into the world.
 

About the Editors
Jennifer Browdy, Ph.D., has successfully edited three anthologies: Women Writing Resistance in Latin America and the Caribbean (Beacon Press, 2017), African Women Writing Resistance (University of Wisconsin Press, 2010) and Writing Fire: Celebrating the Power of Women's Words (Green Fire Press, 2017). The co-founder of Green Fire Press, is a professor of literature at Bard College/Simon's Rock and has long been dedicated to nurturing the voices and visions of women of all ages and from many walks of life. 
Grace Rossman is a spoken word poet, writer, and teacher of creative writing and performance. Her work focuses on addiction, recovery, and healing. She loves to collaborate with other women writers who seek to bring balance to the world.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially to this campaign. But there are other ways you can help us out!

Share our campaign with your social network
Follow Mary Lyons on Facebook and share her posts
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

The book that led us to form a publishing company is the one that we are now turning into an audio book. Four Words by Demetrius O. Davis has been a grand hit with all who have read it and we are taking it to the next level with an audio version so we can reach those many people within our market who prefer audio to the printed word.

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget for this project is $3900. This includes the following:

  • Professional recording at Silver Sound Production in Hatfield, PA.
  • Reading done by Philadelphia musician Supreem of Supreem and the New Experience.
  • High quality editing and mastering by Kevin Frank at Silver Sound Production.
  • Professional quality cd replication and packaging (first 500 units).

We will be sharing the finished product with our supporters along with varied levels of related merchandise (ie. Signed copies of the book, signed copies of the audio book, digital downloads, t-shirts that accompany the book, etc). For higher level supporters, co-producer credits and special invitations are also included.

The Impact

Lazie Horse Publishing has worked hard to provide our authors a high quality product and a top notch experience with a publisher that more closely resembles a traditional publishing situation than a small independent press. We believe in creativity, freedom of expression and in the idea that there are many wonderful stories out there that deserve to be heard. With your help, we can bring this project to another level and get one step closer to being what we’ve envisioned Lazie Horse Publishing to be.

Other Ways You Can Help

Lazie Horse Publishing is still a fairly new company, and still fairly unknown. We’ve built this company from nothing using money from our own pockets. There have been no bank loans or corporate sponsors, so we’ve been taking very small steps toward our success. If you are unable to help financially, here are some other ideas:

  • Help us spread the word about this campaign (don’t forget about Indiegogo share tools!)
  • Help us spread the word about Lazie Horse (www.LazieHorse.com)
  • If you know anyone who owns a store where they sell books or audio books, send them our way. We have a wholesale program that offers retailers a direct from Lazie Horse price that’s better than you can get from any distributor (even if you only want one copy).
  • Our authors are available for speaking engagements, book signings and other events. If you know someone who might be interested in this sort of thing, pass the info along.

Most of all, thank you so much for taking the time to read this far and for your support of any level.

 

***Wait! There's more!***

If we exceed our goal of $3900 by $500 or more, we are also adding on a special soundtrack disk to the audio book. Kevin Frank of Silver Sound Production manages some of the hottest talent in the Philadelphia area, and has offered to put together a soundtrack to accompany the book. If we fly past that goal of $3900, we'll make that soundtrack a reality and include a copy of it with all supporter levels!

story:
Hello there !

This is Sophie Domingues. I am the founder and editor of Healthy Aging Research, an open access journal that aims to publish scientific and medical articles on recent advances in the understanding of the processes associated with aging. The field of aging research focuses on treating and preventing diseases such as stroke, myocardial infarction, cancer, arthritis, cataracts, osteoporosis, type 2 diabetes, hypertension and Alzheimer's disease, to ultimately reduce morbidity and mortality. 

All articles published in Healthy Aging Research will be "open access", meaning that they will be made freely and permanently accessible online immediately upon publication, without subscription charges or registration barriers. The articles published will be individually copyedited, styled and typeset to produce high-quality PDF, XML and HTML versions of the articles. They will be permanently stored on a highly secure server, published and maintained indefinitely on the Internet, and also deposited and indexed with independent archiving organizations (such as PubMed).

We are now in the process of bringing together an editorial board of leading scholars and physicians, who will participate as editors and peer reviewers, and donate their time and expertise at no cost. They will review the articles and approve their publication, to make sure that the articles are technically sound and the research is well conceived and well executed.

To promote the divulgation of research from low-wage countries, we will not charge any publication fee to authors from low-wage countries.

 

What We Need

I have brought together a team of amazing, talented people to help me build this journal: Catherine, Fabien and Joan. I have myself worked as a researcher for many years in this field, and we all now work together in a science consulting firm! The journal will be run by scientists for scientists!

We are fundraising because we are creating the journal with our own labor and investments, to provide a better plateform for sharing research data, but we need help for some tasks that we are not able to do on our own:

-        Finish building the website

-        Create a file submission application

-        Create a layout for the articles

-        Create a cover for the journal

 

What You Get

Unfortunately, we do not have many perks to offer. However, all donations will be thanked on the website of the journal: http://www.har-journal.com.

Moreover, whichever donation level you choose, you’ll get the latest research in the field of aging, and progress on the development of the journal.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out to your colleagues, friends, and family! Post on your Facebook page, blog about it, send emails and tweets. Every bit of sharing helps, even if you can’t contribute yourself right now.

 

THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR HELP!

story:
About Narrator Magazine

Narrator is a free, online creative writing magazine, released once a quarter. Currently all residents of NSW and ACT can contribute, and we're hoping to launch other statewide editions soon. Professional and emerging writers submit their poems, stories and essays to Narrator, they're judged by a secret guest judge and the writers can win up to $1,000 per quarter. We also have a People's Choice prize. Authors don't have to pay anything to enter, and it's free to read online, so it's open to absolutely anyone with internet access.


Our writers are so grateful they have a place to get published, to try their hand. We continually get thanks from authors who have found Narrator really boosts their confidence. Many people like to buy the print copy of Narrator ($12.95 an issue) yet others are happy to read it free online or download it for free.


Why do we need help?

Unfortunately, right now Narrator is run by a small family business, and the costs are coming out of our own pockets - we can't afford to keep it going. We tried to sell advertising the normal way to raise money, but we're just not pushy enough, so we're hoping fellow creatives will see the value in our project and help us keep it running!

We really don't want to have to wrap up our project just yet. Everyone's so supportive, and so grateful, that we feel we're really onto a good thing - but the design, proofreading, layout and promotional costs are sending us under!


Help us keep it running ... in return, we'll promote you.

We hope our goal of $15,000 will be enough to fund Narrator Magazine for another three issues, and invest a little of that into growth and future-proofing.


Your money will help us keep Narrator running, potentially hire a marketing executive to sell advertising space, and the money from that will help us set up an issue for VIC/TAS writers, then QLD writers, then NT/SA/WA writers- eventually, every emerging writer in Australia would have a chance to see themselves in print and win prizes.


But we aren't asking for cash with nothing in return! Our main call is for 'page sponsors' - businesses and individuals to 'sponsor a page' and fill the advertising gaps.


We'd absolutely LOVE to have advertisers. If you run a business, you can contribute on behalf of your business and get a year's worth of full-colour advertising (online and in print) in return. Your ad will appear in four consecutive issues of Narrator, which are all available to read online and they don't have an expiry date - so people will be seeing your ad for at least two years, and probably longer! You'll also see your ad in a scrolling banner on our website. All the online versions of your ad will link back to your own website.


Give us $10 and we'll thank you loudly - we'll be building a list of all our $10 contributors in the middle of our next Narrator. Your name will link back to your blog, Twitter, website, whatever you want - or pay $25 and also get a 25-word shoutout! Whether it's an ad for your business or a shoutout to your mate Bob, we'll print it.


Contribute without spending a cent.

We understand times are tight - that's exactly why our magazine is free to read. So if you can't help financially, maybe you can help socially? Please share this with anyone you know who might be interested - any authors, poets, artists, and anyone who owns a business.


You can also help by reading the magazine! Vote for the People's Choice prize winners, flick through a copy or two - if you're in NSW or ACT, maybe you'd even like to submit something. We've got a great readership, but the bigger it gets, the faster we'll be able to start new statewide issues.

story:
Our Story
My name is Glenn Lumsden and I have been a writer and an illustrator for over twenty years. My son Cooper is autistic, and showed absolutely no interest in art until one day, around the age of five, he produced an illustrated book, complete. Since then he has hardly stopped, pausing only to paint a canvas or ten.
He has taken no direction from me, everything he does just magically comes out of his head. I remember watching him do a colour drawing in texta, starting with a blank sheet of paper, picking up the green texta, and doing all the green bits. Then the blue. Then the red. Gradually, an entire picture came together without him having done any preliminary sketching.
I have seen many examples of art by people on the autism spectrum, some of it amazingly photo-realistic and detailed. Coop's work is not like that. It is dream-like. It is an insight into his world.
Often I think that his world is a beautiful place to live.
To date, Coop and I have printed his books from home, collating and stapling by hand, mostly as gifts for family, school teachers and carers to begin with. After a short while we found it impossible to keep up with the requests. His primary school wanted an entire set for the school library.
Our campaign is to reach $5 000, in order to get as many of Coop's huge back catalogue published and distributed as we can.


The Impact

Having books created by special needs children in school libraries, kindergartens etc exposes mainstream kids to the talents and thought processes of these children. Teachers will find them a great insight as well. And autism aside, these books are perfect for young children as regular readers. They're brightly coloured, not too long, and quirky.

The personal impact on Coop himself would be enormous, as autism spectrum kids often struggle with self-esteem and acceptance. Coop is surrounded by nurturing loving folk, but needs an extra step-up to make him see what he can do with his unique art and stories.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $5000 to get the publishing happening. Every cent goes on printing and distribution. If we raise more, we print more. Coop has an impressive back catalogue of work!

Even if the target money is not raised this time, we will start printing what we can and continue to source more funding to further Coop's career as an artist and story teller.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you think this is a worthwhile project but can't donate funds, donate a bit of facebook or twitter space. It costs nothing but it all helps

story:
Objectif atteint ! 

Un grand merci à tous ceux qui ont contribué, partagé, liké, prié... grâce à vous l'objectif a été atteint !

Je peux donc m'inscrire sereinement pour cette année et continuer mes recherches au service de l'Eglise... grâce à vous !

Retrouvez-moi sur mon site Internet : timotheeminard.com

Si vous avez des questions ou que vous êtes intéressés par mon projet d'étude, n'hésitez pas à me contacter par email : timminard2@free.fr 

Je vous laisse cette petite vidéo, histoire de vous remercier de vive voix...




To read English version, click here

 

Financez des recherches au service de l'Eglise.

Pasteur de l'Eglise Protestante Baptiste de Saint-Etienne, je me suis lancé en parallèle, dans un doctorat en théologie à l'Université de Strasbourg, depuis un an maintenant.

Je ne me forme pas uniquement par intérêt académique, mais afin d'acquérir les meilleures compétences possibles pour l'enseignement théologique au service des églises évangéliques. Je suis interpellé par les besoins en formation théologique solide, et en particulier dans les pays francophones du sud.   

Mon projet

Mon salaire de pasteur permet de pourvoir aux besoins de ma famille, mais il ne permet pas de couvrir les frais liés à mes études. Je n'ai pas pu trouver de financement pour l'année universitaire 2013-2014, et la date limite d'inscription approche. Je fais donc appel à votre générosité !


Mes frais pour l'année 2013-2014 :

  • Paiement des droits de scolarité : environ 400 €
  • 6 déplacements sur Strasbourg dans l'année (en train) : 6x100 = 600 €
  • Achat d'un ordinateur portable (mon fidèle netbook a vécu) : 500 €

Total des frais indispensables : 1500 € + comission d'Indiegogo (env. 120 €) = 1620 €

Si le montant récolté dépasse les 1620 €, j'utiliserais l'argent pour acheter des ouvrages théologiques ou des logiciels bibliques : ce qui me facilitera grandement mes recherches et me sera utile pour la suite !

Comment participer ?

  • En donnant !
  • En partageant le projet autour de vous : faites suivre le lien à vos amis qui pourraient être intéressés, partagez sur Facebook, parlez-en, etc.

Mon parcours 

Une formation théologique oecuménique :

  • 2002-2007 : License et 1ère année de Master en théologie à la Faculté Libre de Théologie Evangélique de Vaux-sur-Seine.
  • 2009-2012 : Master de recherche en théologie à la Faculté de Théologie de l'Université Catholique de Lyon. 
  • Septembre 2012 : Début de mes études doctorales, à la Faculté de Théologie Protestante de l'Université de Strasbourg.

Un engagement ecclésial :

Pasteur de l’Eglise Protestante Baptiste de Saint-Etienne (FEEBF). Je suis également le président de la pastorale CNEF de l'agglomération stéphanoise.

Je suis membre du Département Formation de ma famille d'églises (Fédération des Eglises Evangéliques Baptistes de France).

Pourquoi un doctorat en théologie ?

J'ai le désir de me former au plus haut niveau théologique, afin de participer à l'enseignement théologique au service des églises évangéliques.

Je suis particulièrement convaincu de la nécessité d'une formation théologique évangélique de haut niveau au sein des pays les plus pauvres de la francophonie. Le protestantisme évangélique est  souvent bien développé dans ces pays. Pourtant, peu nombreux sont ceux qui bénéficient d'une formation théologique évangélique de niveau universitaire. 


Depuis 2011, j'ai développé un partenariat avec l'Institut Supérieur de Théologie Evangélique (ISTE), à Madagascar. J'ai pu m'y rendre à deux reprises pour y donner des cours groupés. L'ISTE souhaiterait que je puisse venir enseigner de façon permanente à Madagascar. Avec un doctorat en poche, je pourrais notamment suivre des doctorants, et éviter ainsi aux étudiants malgaches de devoir aller à l'étranger pour réaliser leur doctorat.

 

Mon sujet de thèse

Mes recherches doctorales ont pour titre : "La dimension communautaire de la prophétie dans le Nouveau Testament, et ses antécédents éventuels".

Le Nouveau Testament évoque l’existence de prophètes au sein du christianisme naissant. Ces prophètes chrétiens interagissent avec l’Église naissante, mais aussi avec la société de leur temps : ils sont parfois écoutés, mais aussi dénoncés, rejetés ou persécutés, à l’image de leur maître, Jésus-Christ. Au-delà de ces figures prophétiques individuelles, plusieurs textes présentent la communauté chrétienne comme ayant une fonction prophétique collective au sein de son environnement.

Mes recherches ont pour but de mettre en évidence la fonction prophétique de la communauté et dans la communauté, à partir des données du Nouveau Testament[1]. En quoi consiste exactement cette fonction prophétique ? Quels en sont les enjeux ? Quelles en sont les racines éventuelles, dans l’Ancien Testament[2] ou dans le judaïsme intertestamentaire[3] ?

Intérêt académique :

Dans le domaine des sciences bibliques, le prophétisme néotestamentaire n’a été que peu étudié. Aucune étude majeure francophone sur le sujet n’a été produite depuis près de quarante ans. De plus, les études existantes – en français, anglais ou allemand – s’intéressent généralement aux prophètes en tant qu’individus. Au cours de mes recherches de Master sur la question du prophétisme néotestamentair, je n’ai pas rencontré de travaux académiques majeurs sur la dimension communautaire du prophétisme néotestamentaire. J’espère que mes recherches pourront contribuer à réparer cet oubli.

D’un point de vue méthodologique, il existe actuellement un débat parmi les exégètes bibliques sur la manière de mettre en rapport les divers écrits bibliques. La Bible chrétienne est un corpus d’écrits rédigés par divers auteurs, dans divers contextes. En même temps, pour le croyant chrétien, la Bible est bien plus qu’une banale anthologie. Il la lit comme un unique canon pour sa foi, comme LA parole de Dieu. Comment donc répondre de manière honnête à la question : « que dit la Bible sur tel sujet » ? En choisissant d’étudier un thème au sein du corpus biblique, j’espère ainsi contribuer au débat méthodologique concernant l’intertextualité – ou l’intratextualité ? – biblique.

[1] Je pense notamment aux textes suivants : Matthieu 7.15-23 ; 10.40-42 ; 23-24 ; Actes 1-4 à mettre en parallèle avec Luc 1-4 ;      1 Corinthiens 11-14 ; Ephésiens 2.20-3.6 ; 4.11-16 ; 1 Jean 4.1-6 ; Apocalypse 2-3 ; 11 ; 19-20.

[2] Je pense par exemple à Nombres 11-12 ; Joël 3.1-2 ; au rôle de la communauté prophétique chez Esaïe ou aux interactions entre Jérémie et ses compatriotes.

[3] Je pense par exemple à la manière dont la communauté de Qumrân s’ « auto-comprend ».

Me lire ou m'écouter :

Mes recherches de Master sur la prophétie dans le Nouveau Testament ont abouties à la publication de plusieurs articles :

  • “L’inspiration de la prophétie dans l’Église : les données de la 1ère aux Corinthiens”, Théologie Évangélique, 10.2 (2011), p. 115-132.
  • “La pratique de la prophétie dans l’Église d’aujourd’hui face aux données bibliques”, Les Cahiers de l’École Pastorale, 80 (2011), p. 3-19.
  • "Discernement des prophéties dans l'Eglise face aux données bibliques", Les Cahiers de l'Ecole Pastorale, 87 (2013), p. 39-60.
  • "La prophétie chrétienne d'après le Nouveau Testament : l'état de la question", Théologie Evangélique, 12.1 (2013), p. 23-41.

Retrouvez quelques réflexions personnelles sur mon blog Bible & Breakfast.

Téléchargez un canevas d'études bibliques sur Romains 12-15, que j'ai réalisé pour ma Fédération d'Eglises.Ecoutez quelques unes de mes prédications sur le site de mon église.


 

Serving the Church by funding Theological researches

I am a Baptist minister in Saint-Etienne Baptist Church, near Lyon in France. Beside my pastoral ministry, I have started a PhD in Theology, in Strasbourg University, since a year now.

I do not study theology for academic interest but because I want to take part in Theological training for Evangelical churches. I have a burden for helping churches to develop theological training at a higher level, especially in poorest French speaking countries as Madagascar.

 

My project

My pastoral wages cover everyday needs for my family, but they can not cover my PhD costs. I have not find any funding for the 2013-2014 academic year, and I need to pay quickly university fees. So, I am looking for you to help me in funding my studies.

Costs for 2013-2014 academic year :

  • Scholarship fees : about 400 €
  • Travelling from Saint-Etienne to Strasbourg (350 miles), 6 times a year (by train) : 6x100 = 600 €
  • Buying a Netbook (my old one is out of order) : 500 €

Total costs : 1500 € + commissions (about 120 €) = 1620 €

If I receive more than 1620 €, I will use the money to buy theological books or softwares.

 

 

 

How to contribute:

  • By Giving!
  • By forwarding links to my indiegogo page, by email, Facebook, Twitter, Google +...

Who am I?

An oecumenical theological training:

  • 2002-2007 : Licence degree in Theology in Faculté Libre de Théologie Evangélique de Vaux-sur-Seine.
  • 2009-2012 : Master degree in Theology in Faculté de Théologie de l'Université Catholique de Lyon. 
  • Septembre 2012 : Starting a PhD in Theology in Faculté de Théologie Protestante de l'Université de Strasbourg.

Serving churches:

Pastoral ministry in Eglise Protestante Baptiste de Saint-Etienne (FEEBF). I am also the local evangelical alliance's president. 

Member of the training department in my church family (Fédération des Eglises Evangéliques Baptistes de France).

 

 

Why am I doing a PhD in Theology?

I want to receive the best theological training in order to serve evangelical churches by teaching theology.

I am conscious about the necessity to develop theological training in the poorest French speaking countries. Many French speaking countries in Africa have seen evangelical churches growing a lot during the last decades. But few of them have access to academic evangelical theological training.

Since 2011, I have developped a partnership with Institut Supérieur de Théologie Evangélique (ISTE), in Madagascar. I travelled twice to Madagascar in order to teach theolgical courses. The Institute over there wants me to stay in Madagascar to be a permanent teacher. If I had a PhD, I could help ISTE with supervising PhD students who can not afford a travel to Europe in order to do PhD studies.

My thesis

My Phd resarches are on: "Prophecy in the Community and by the Community, in the New Testament and its background".

Prophets are a reality in the Early Church which can be traced to the New Testament. Christian prophets have interactions with the Church but also with society: they may be listened to, but also rejected or persecuted, as their master, Jesus-Christ. New Testament not only speaks of prophetic persons, but some texts evoke the whole christian community as having a collective prophetic office.

My researches will deal with the question of the prophetical office of the community and in the community, from New Testament texts[1]. What does this prophetic office consist in? What are the issues? What are the roots of thie idea in the Old Testament[2] or in the intertestamental judaism[3]? 

Academic interest :

In the French speaing academic biblical studies field, there has not been any major study on New Testament prophecy since 40 years. Studies in Eglish generally focus on individual prophets, and I do not know any major study on the community dimension of prophecy. I hope my researches can contribute to this lack.

I also hope to contribute to the methodological debate on the way to deal with Bible, as one inspired book. Bible is a book composed of diverses writings from varied times and contexts. In the same time, it is, for christian believers, much more than an anthology.Christians read it as an unique rule for their faith, as God's Word. So, how honnestly answer to the question : "What the Bible does say on this or that?" By chosing to study one theme inside the biblical corpus, I hope to contribute on the methodological debate on biblical intertextuality (or intratextuality?).

[1] See for example, Matthew 7.15-23 ; 10.40-42 ; 23-24 ; Acts 1-4 in parallel with Luke 1-4 ; 1 Corinthians 11-14 ; Ephesians 2.20-3.6 ; 4.11-16 ; 1 John 4.1-6 ; Revelation 2-3 ; 11 ; 19-20.

[2] See for example, Numbers 11-12 ; Joel 3.1-2 ; or the prophetic community function in Isaiah.

[3] See for example, the way Qumran community understands itself.

Reading me or listening to me (in French):

Some of my researches on New Testament Prophecy have already been published in some papers:

  • “L’inspiration de la prophétie dans l’Église : les données de la 1ère aux Corinthiens”, Théologie Évangélique, 10.2 (2011), p. 115-132.
  • “La pratique de la prophétie dans l’Église d’aujourd’hui face aux données bibliques”, Les Cahiers de l’École Pastorale, 80 (2011), p. 3-19.
  • "Discernement des prophéties dans l'Eglise face aux données bibliques", Les Cahiers de l'Ecole Pastorale, 87 (2013), p. 39-60.
  • "La prophétie chrétienne d'après le Nouveau Testament : l'état de la question", Théologie Evangélique, 12.1 (2013), p. 23-41.

Read some biblical thought on my blog Bible & Breakfast.

Download a bible studies groundwork on Romans 12-15, which I realised for the French Baptist Federation.

Listen to some of my sermons on my Church website.

Objectif atteint ! 
Un grand merci à tous ceux qui ont contribué, partagé, liké, prié... grâce à vous l'objectif a été atteint !
Je peux donc m'inscrire sereinement pour cette année et continuer mes recherches au service de l'Eglise... grâce à vous !

Retrouvez-moi sur mon site Internet : timotheeminard.com
Si vous avez des questions ou que vous êtes intéressés par mon projet d'étude, n'hésitez pas à me contacter par email : timminard2@free.fr 
Je vous laisse cette petite vidéo, histoire de vous remercier de vive voix...



To read English version, click here
 
Financez des recherches au service de l'Eglise.
Pasteur de l'Eglise Protestante Baptiste de Saint-Etienne, je me suis lancé en parallèle, dans un doctorat en théologie à l'Université de Strasbourg, depuis un an maintenant.
Je ne me forme pas uniquement par intérêt académique, mais afin d'acquérir les meilleures compétences possibles pour l'enseignement théologique au service des églises évangéliques. Je suis interpellé par les besoins en formation théologique solide, et en particulier dans les pays francophones du sud.   
Mon projet
Mon salaire de pasteur permet de pourvoir aux besoins de ma famille, mais il ne permet pas de couvrir les frais liés à mes études. Je n'ai pas pu trouver de financement pour l'année universitaire 2013-2014, et la date limite d'inscription approche. Je fais donc appel à votre générosité !
Mes frais pour l'année 2013-2014 :

Paiement des droits de scolarité : environ 400 €
6 déplacements sur Strasbourg dans l'année (en train) : 6x100 = 600 €
Achat d'un ordinateur portable (mon fidèle netbook a vécu) : 500 €

Total des frais indispensables : 1500 € + comission d'Indiegogo (env. 120 €) = 1620 €
Si le montant récolté dépasse les 1620 €, j'utiliserais l'argent pour acheter des ouvrages théologiques ou des logiciels bibliques : ce qui me facilitera grandement mes recherches et me sera utile pour la suite !
Comment participer ?

En donnant !
En partageant le projet autour de vous : faites suivre le lien à vos amis qui pourraient être intéressés, partagez sur Facebook, parlez-en, etc.

Mon parcours 
Une formation théologique oecuménique :

2002-2007 : License et 1ère année de Master en théologie à la Faculté Libre de Théologie Evangélique de Vaux-sur-Seine.
2009-2012 : Master de recherche en théologie à la Faculté de Théologie de l'Université Catholique de Lyon. 
Septembre 2012 : Début de mes études doctorales, à la Faculté de Théologie Protestante de l'Université de Strasbourg.


Un engagement ecclésial :
Pasteur de l’Eglise Protestante Baptiste de Saint-Etienne (FEEBF). Je suis également le président de la pastorale CNEF de l'agglomération stéphanoise.
Je suis membre du Département Formation de ma famille d'églises (Fédération des Eglises Evangéliques Baptistes de France).
Pourquoi un doctorat en théologie ?
J'ai le désir de me former au plus haut niveau théologique, afin de participer à l'enseignement théologique au service des églises évangéliques.
Je suis particulièrement convaincu de la nécessité d'une formation théologique évangélique de haut niveau au sein des pays les plus pauvres de la francophonie. Le protestantisme évangélique est  souvent bien développé dans ces pays. Pourtant, peu nombreux sont ceux qui bénéficient d'une formation théologique évangélique de niveau universitaire. 
Depuis 2011, j'ai développé un partenariat avec l'Institut Supérieur de Théologie Evangélique (ISTE), à Madagascar. J'ai pu m'y rendre à deux reprises pour y donner des cours groupés. L'ISTE souhaiterait que je puisse venir enseigner de façon permanente à Madagascar. Avec un doctorat en poche, je pourrais notamment suivre des doctorants, et éviter ainsi aux étudiants malgaches de devoir aller à l'étranger pour réaliser leur doctorat.
 
Mon sujet de thèse
Mes recherches doctorales ont pour titre : "La dimension communautaire de la prophétie dans le Nouveau Testament, et ses antécédents éventuels".
Le Nouveau Testament évoque l’existence de prophètes au sein du christianisme naissant. Ces prophètes chrétiens interagissent avec l’Église naissante, mais aussi avec la société de leur temps : ils sont parfois écoutés, mais aussi dénoncés, rejetés ou persécutés, à l’image de leur maître, Jésus-Christ. Au-delà de ces figures prophétiques individuelles, plusieurs textes présentent la communauté chrétienne comme ayant une fonction prophétique collective au sein de son environnement.
Mes recherches ont pour but de mettre en évidence la fonction prophétique de la communauté et dans la communauté, à partir des données du Nouveau Testament[1]. En quoi consiste exactement cette fonction prophétique ? Quels en sont les enjeux ? Quelles en sont les racines éventuelles, dans l’Ancien Testament[2] ou dans le judaïsme intertestamentaire[3] ?
Intérêt académique :
Dans le domaine des sciences bibliques, le prophétisme néotestamentaire n’a été que peu étudié. Aucune étude majeure francophone sur le sujet n’a été produite depuis près de quarante ans. De plus, les études existantes – en français, anglais ou allemand – s’intéressent généralement aux prophètes en tant qu’individus. Au cours de mes recherches de Master sur la question du prophétisme néotestamentair, je n’ai pas rencontré de travaux académiques majeurs sur la dimension communautaire du prophétisme néotestamentaire. J’espère que mes recherches pourront contribuer à réparer cet oubli.
D’un point de vue méthodologique, il existe actuellement un débat parmi les exégètes bibliques sur la manière de mettre en rapport les divers écrits bibliques. La Bible chrétienne est un corpus d’écrits rédigés par divers auteurs, dans divers contextes. En même temps, pour le croyant chrétien, la Bible est bien plus qu’une banale anthologie. Il la lit comme un unique canon pour sa foi, comme LA parole de Dieu. Comment donc répondre de manière honnête à la question : « que dit la Bible sur tel sujet » ? En choisissant d’étudier un thème au sein du corpus biblique, j’espère ainsi contribuer au débat méthodologique concernant l’intertextualité – ou l’intratextualité ? – biblique.




[1] Je pense notamment aux textes suivants : Matthieu 7.15-23 ; 10.40-42 ; 23-24 ; Actes 1-4 à mettre en parallèle avec Luc 1-4 ;      1 Corinthiens 11-14 ; Ephésiens 2.20-3.6 ; 4.11-16 ; 1 Jean 4.1-6 ; Apocalypse 2-3 ; 11 ; 19-20.



[2] Je pense par exemple à Nombres 11-12 ; Joël 3.1-2 ; au rôle de la communauté prophétique chez Esaïe ou aux interactions entre Jérémie et ses compatriotes.



[3] Je pense par exemple à la manière dont la communauté de Qumrân s’ « auto-comprend ».


Me lire ou m'écouter :
Mes recherches de Master sur la prophétie dans le Nouveau Testament ont abouties à la publication de plusieurs articles :

“L’inspiration de la prophétie dans l’Église : les données de la 1ère aux Corinthiens”, Théologie Évangélique, 10.2 (2011), p. 115-132.
“La pratique de la prophétie dans l’Église d’aujourd’hui face aux données bibliques”, Les Cahiers de l’École Pastorale, 80 (2011), p. 3-19.
"Discernement des prophéties dans l'Eglise face aux données bibliques", Les Cahiers de l'Ecole Pastorale, 87 (2013), p. 39-60.
"La prophétie chrétienne d'après le Nouveau Testament : l'état de la question", Théologie Evangélique, 12.1 (2013), p. 23-41.

Retrouvez quelques réflexions personnelles sur mon blog Bible & Breakfast.
Téléchargez un canevas d'études bibliques sur Romains 12-15, que j'ai réalisé pour ma Fédération d'Eglises.Ecoutez quelques unes de mes prédications sur le site de mon église.

story:
My name is Alex McGilvery. I'm an author working on the last stages of releasing my second book Playing on Yggdrasil. Yggdrasil is the story of a young girl who makes friends with a tree. The tree, whom she calls Drasil takes her to visit another country where hospitality is the primary virtue. Her experience there is very different from her life dealing with bullies and the remaining grief of her mother's death. This book is a book about faith, grief, love and hope.

I am planning to hire an editor to go through the book to give it a final polish. I've had it through two sets of beta readers already. The editor will cost approximately 1.5 cents per word. That is $1050.

I would also like to hire a professional designer to do my cover. I expect to pay $750 for the cover.

I've put in $500 to cover Indiegogo fees and other cost associated with the campaign.

The remaining $1200 dollars will pay for a first print run of one hundred copies of my book. Any money over the goal will pay for more physical copies of the book and allow me to put them in more stores throughout my region.

My first book sold out its initial run and sold a large number of electronic copies, but it didn't have a large reach. I am hoping to reach more people with this campaign and bring my writing to more people.

Any amount of donation is welcomed. If you can't donate, consider spreading the word to your friends who love books and reading.

I've added a scratch cover and an excerpt to the gallery. Have a look.

Thanks for your time and generosity.

story:
UPDATE: Assisi Media Launched!

Thanks to your support, we were able to successfully raise the money needed to launch Assisi Media.  For more information, go to the Assisi Media website, or follow the link to find out more about the Waking Up Catholic eBook and paperback.

 

Waking Up Catholic: The Book

From Assisi Media

Evangelization is a common topic in the Catholic Church, but what's the next step?  What are we doing once we have convinced someone to learn more about the Catholic faith?

Enter: Waking Up Catholic.

Just over two years ago, I started a website called WakingUpCatholic.com which covered the basic topics of the Catholic faith.  Now, it's time to take that to the next level with 'Waking Up Catholic' - the book.

My Journey

When I first decided to go through RCIA, the formal process for entering the Catholic Church, I had a lot of questions.  When I searched online for answers, I did not know how well I could trust the sources.  When I read Catholic books, many of them read like college-level textbooks.  Where can someone new to Catholicism find resources they can trust in language they can understand?

I made it my goal to provide the resources other Catholic converts would need in their first steps toward the Catholic faith.  It began with WakingUpCatholic.com, and now, I am looking to publish a book on the same subject.

More About the Book

When teaching kids about math, we do not start with Algebra, Trigonometry, or Calculus; we begin with basic Arithmetic.  We teach our children how to count and that 1 + 1 = 2.  We build a solid foundation for their knowledge of mathematics.

'Waking Up Catholic' strives to do the same thing for Catholicism.  Before we can cover the more advanced topics of faith, we need to begin with the basics.

Each chapter begins with my own background, but instead of simply giving my conversion story, it will highlight specific questions and issues I had with Catholicism - allowing me to connect with the reader.

Next, the chapter continues by sharing what I learned about Catholicism that helped me to overcome my objections.  The goal is to provide these concepts in a way that readers of all levels can understand.

Finally, it is important to take this information and apply it in the real world, and each chapter closes with ways the reader can apply what they've learned in their daily life.

The Audience

Who should read 'Waking Up Catholic'?  Who was it written for?

First, it was written for those who have questions about basic Catholic teaching.  Whether they are new to Catholicism, or someone looking to come home again, they can benefit from this book.

For established Catholics, 'Waking Up Catholic' can be a great evangelistic tool.  You will learn how to answer common objections to the Catholic faith - down to their root cause, and you can share this book with anyone you know who may be having questions.

My Qualifications

For the past couple of years, I have worked in and near the Catholic publishing industry.  Using that knowledge, I feel that we can successfully launch a new publishing company aimed at providing resources for adults.

My writing ventures include my own site, Waking Up Catholic, as well as regular posts on the New Evangelizers and Catholic Mom's Tech Talk blogs.  Also, I have written articles for other sites, including Catholic Lane.

On the social media front, I have gained a large number of fans on Facebook, Twitter, and Google+, and I was even nominated for Best Catholic Facebook Page by About.com.

Our Goal

Publishing a book, unfortunately, is not cheap.  My wife and I are starting our own publishing company, Assisi Media, and our first book will be 'Waking Up Catholic.'  We have already spent a great deal of money on this venture, but we need your help.

The goal is to raise funds for the following:

  • Editing
  • Publishing
  • Distribution

With funds to cover these costs, we feel that we can produce a quality book that will spread the Catholic faith to mainstream society.

What We Need & What You Get

Unfortunately, we cannot offer any tax incentives; however, we can offer:

  • Autographed copies of the book
  • YOUR NAME mentioned in the acknowledgements
  • Advertising on WakingUpCatholic.com
  • The chance to host the book launch

For more information about perks, and how much they cost, see the sidebar to the right, or contact me at WakingUpCatholic.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can make a financial donation or not, please help spread the word by telling your friends about AssisiMedia.com.

Of course, don't forget to share this with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, and Google+.

 

Thank you and God bless!

Chad R. Torgerson

Author of 'Waking Up Catholic'

Co-founder of Assisi Media
story_txt:
UPDATE: Assisi Media Launched!
Thanks to your support, we were able to successfully raise the money needed to launch Assisi Media.  For more information, go to the Assisi Media website, or follow the link to find out more about the Waking Up Catholic eBook and paperback.

 
Waking Up Catholic: The Book
From Assisi Media
Evangelization is a common topic in the Catholic Church, but what's the next step?  What are we doing once we have convinced someone to learn more about the Catholic faith?
Enter: Waking Up Catholic.
Just over two years ago, I started a website called WakingUpCatholic.com which covered the basic topics of the Catholic faith.  Now, it's time to take that to the next level with 'Waking Up Catholic' - the book.
My Journey
When I first decided to go through RCIA, the formal process for entering the Catholic Church, I had a lot of questions.  When I searched online for answers, I did not know how well I could trust the sources.  When I read Catholic books, many of them read like college-level textbooks.  Where can someone new to Catholicism find resources they can trust in language they can understand?
I made it my goal to provide the resources other Catholic converts would need in their first steps toward the Catholic faith.  It began with WakingUpCatholic.com, and now, I am looking to publish a book on the same subject.
More About the Book
When teaching kids about math, we do not start with Algebra, Trigonometry, or Calculus; we begin with basic Arithmetic.  We teach our children how to count and that 1 + 1 = 2.  We build a solid foundation for their knowledge of mathematics.
'Waking Up Catholic' strives to do the same thing for Catholicism.  Before we can cover the more advanced topics of faith, we need to begin with the basics.
Each chapter begins with my own background, but instead of simply giving my conversion story, it will highlight specific questions and issues I had with Catholicism - allowing me to connect with the reader.
Next, the chapter continues by sharing what I learned about Catholicism that helped me to overcome my objections.  The goal is to provide these concepts in a way that readers of all levels can understand.
Finally, it is important to take this information and apply it in the real world, and each chapter closes with ways the reader can apply what they've learned in their daily life.
The Audience
Who should read 'Waking Up Catholic'?  Who was it written for?
First, it was written for those who have questions about basic Catholic teaching.  Whether they are new to Catholicism, or someone looking to come home again, they can benefit from this book.
For established Catholics, 'Waking Up Catholic' can be a great evangelistic tool.  You will learn how to answer common objections to the Catholic faith - down to their root cause, and you can share this book with anyone you know who may be having questions.
My Qualifications
For the past couple of years, I have worked in and near the Catholic publishing industry.  Using that knowledge, I feel that we can successfully launch a new publishing company aimed at providing resources for adults.
My writing ventures include my own site, Waking Up Catholic, as well as regular posts on the New Evangelizers and Catholic Mom's Tech Talk blogs.  Also, I have written articles for other sites, including Catholic Lane.
On the social media front, I have gained a large number of fans on Facebook, Twitter, and Google+, and I was even nominated for Best Catholic Facebook Page by About.com.
Our Goal
Publishing a book, unfortunately, is not cheap.  My wife and I are starting our own publishing company, Assisi Media, and our first book will be 'Waking Up Catholic.'  We have already spent a great deal of money on this venture, but we need your help.
The goal is to raise funds for the following:

Editing
Publishing
Distribution
With funds to cover these costs, we feel that we can produce a quality book that will spread the Catholic faith to mainstream society.

What We Need & What You Get
Unfortunately, we cannot offer any tax incentives; however, we can offer:

Autographed copies of the book

YOUR NAME mentioned in the acknowledgements
Advertising on WakingUpCatholic.com
The chance to host the book launch

For more information about perks, and how much they cost, see the sidebar to the right, or contact me at WakingUpCatholic.com.


Other Ways You Can Help


Whether you can make a financial donation or not, please help spread the word by telling your friends about AssisiMedia.com.
Of course, don't forget to share this with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, and Google+.
 
Thank you and God bless!
Chad R. Torgerson
Author of 'Waking Up Catholic'
Co-founder of Assisi Media

story:
For a Free Venezuela!

Por una Venezuela Libre!

As you read these words, Venezuela is immersed in a struggle between two opposing forces, where one of them has sophisticated weapons and economic authority issued by the squandering of natural resources, which, despite being of all Venezuelans, have been used to buy consciences and the complicit silence of international governments. The other of these two forces, still seeks to awaken the consciousness and support of the peoples of the world and has only the strength of its convictions, its courage and value.

Mientras lees estas palabras, Venezuela se encuentra inmersa en una lucha entre dos fuerzas antagónicas, donde una de ellas cuenta con sofisticadas armas y el poder económico otorgado por la dilapidación de sus recursos naturales, los cuales, pese a ser de todos los venezolanos, han sido utilizados para comprar las consciencias y el silencio cómplice de gobiernos internacionales. La otra de esas dos fuerzas, aún busca despertar las consciencias y el apoyo de los pueblos del mundo y cuenta unicamente con la fuerza de sus convicciones, de su coraje y su valor.

In this scenario, Venezuela today suffers the worst shortages of food and medicine in its history, one of the highest inflation rates in the world and overwhelmed violence, the balance was over 24,000 murders just in 2013. An incomprehensible situation considering the country rests on the largest oil reserves on the planet, As a result of this serious situation, the people of Venezuela, true to their republican tradition and has decided to adhere to Article 350 of the Constitution and disavow the regime of Nicholas Maduro for going against the values, principles and democratic safeguards and undermine human rights.

En este escenario, Venezuela sufre hoy en día la peor escasez de alimentos y medicinas de su historia, una de las mayores inflaciones del mundo e índices de violencia desbordados, cuyo saldo fue de 24.000 asesinatos sólo en 2013. Una situación incomprensible teniendo en cuenta que el país descansa sobre las mayores reservas de petróleo del planeta. Como consecuencia de esta grave situación, el pueblo de Venezuela, fiel a su tradición republicana, ha decidido apegarse al artículo 350 de la Constitución y desconocer al régimen de Nicolás Maduro por contrariar los valores, principios y garantías democráticos y por menoscabar los derechos humanos.

As a Venezuelan, is your civic duty to contribute your bit no matter where in the world where you at. To our friends of other nationalities, your contribution will be highly appreciated in this fight. For the purchase of medical supplies and support protesters struggling to regain their freedom, sovereignty and democracy in Venezuela, this contribution is much needed by all of us.

Como venezolano, es tu deber ciudadano aportar tu granito de arena sin importar el lugar del planeta en el que te encuentres. A nuestros amigos de otras nacionalidades,tu aporte sera altamente apreciado a esta lucha. Para la adquisicion de  insumos medicos y brindar apoyo a los manifestantes que luchan por recobrar la libertad, la soberanía y la democracia en Venezuela, es muy  necesario este aporte de parte de todos nosotros.

Thank you very much indeed.

story:
True Son of the Empire

My name is Joey Stadelmann, and I've been writing and telling stories for most of my life.  I've always done it for fun, but now I want to take a bigger step.  I'm looking at publishing my first novel, True Son of the Empire.  I've written scripts, poems, and short stories in the past, but never anything of this magnitude.  I have a degree in English from the University of Lethbridge, and have been running weekly role-playing games for the past twenty years.

The first few chapters of the book are available here, free of charge.

In publishing this novel, I'll be fulfilling a lifelong dream.  This campaign will raise the money to publish the novel as an eBook and print-on-demand copy of this story. 

The book itself is the story of Gabriel Durihan, an officer in the army of the Solarian Empire.  He comes to realize that his commanding officer is possessed by a demon, and his fellow officers are too afraid of the consequences to stand against the monster.  So he needs to figure out how to protect the Empire from the monster on his own.

The Book is Out!  Find True Son Of The Empire below:

Physical copy of the book: https://www.createspace.com/5695963
Amazon Kindle: http://www.amazon.com/True-Son-Empire-J-Stadelmann/dp/0994884109/
Kobo eReader: https://store.kobobooks.com/en-ca/ebook/true-son-of-the-empire
Apple iTunes: Coming Soon!

story:
Short Summary

www.keywrites.com

My name is Key Ballah, I am a self proclaimed writer/poet. I am currently a student at York University in Toronto, Ontario working towards a degree in Women's and Gender Studies, with a specific interest in the plight of immigrant and refugee women, relocating and seeking asylum in North America.

My poetry book "Preparing My Daughter For Rain", has been in the works since I was 12 years old. It is my dream to become a published author to share the experiences I've had in my life. At 23, my passion is writing and my wish is to share everything I've learned about Love, Healing and Surviving with other self identified women. 

This book of poetry is dedicated and written to and for my future daughter. It is for her and other women as a means of helping them heal, helping them cope, helping them survive, and helping them learn to trust and love themselves.

  • a collection of short stories
  • a collection of poems
  • a collection of do to lists

Your donation is imperative in helping me accomplish my ultimate goal of publishing "Preparing My Daughter For Rain" in June 2014. It is the last part of this 12 year journey. Every donation is met with immense gratitude and with all of the love I can possibly give. In the end, this book of poetry, that was written with so much love, hurt and honesty, that it has taken everything out of me to write, will be a collection of words that will sit with anyone and everyone.

What I Need & What You Get

I believe that I will only need $1500.00 to publish "Preparing My Daughter For Rain"

With $1500.00 I plan to:

  • Pay a graphic designer to design the front and back cover of my book. I am hoping to pay between $200-$300 for the front/back covers.
  • I intend to self publish this book. I hope to budget $900.00 for book printing and e-book versions.
  • The remaining $300-$400 will be used on editing, a promotional short film/poetry video to promote "Preparing My Daughter for Rain".

You get constant updates on my website about the progress my book.
Every time a dollar of donated money is spent it will be accounted for on a publicly accessible spreadsheet.
Depending on your donation, you will receive gifts of gratitude.

If I am not able to raise the full $1500.00, I will re-evaluate and redistribute the available funds to different parts of the budget. I will still make the information and spending log available on my website: www.keywrites.com and I will be no less grateful, no less in love with you all for the donations you were able to give.
 

The Impact

Your specific donation will help me to focus more on formatting and writing and less on looking for a publisher to fund my project. It will allow me to have full creative control over my work, it will allow me to pay a graphic design artists for their work. It will help produce another piece of literature that empowers women and girls through story telling and experience sharing. Your donation helps me achieve my dreams, it validates my work, it validates my experience and it contributes positively to the art of writing.  

You can access some of my work, and see my passion through my website. I want to give you a book of works, that have come to define me. Work that I have shared with women all over the world, whom I've received amazing feedback and commentary from.

This project is like water to me, it is essential to who I am, it has helped me heal and love and be, and I am grateful for the opportunity to share it with you, so that it may do the same thing.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone can donate. But I hope that reading through this proposal, or my website has convinced you in someway of the importance of this work, and the love I have for this book. Please, if it is possible share either the link for this campaign page or my website: www.keywrites.com with my work. Tell your friends, your family, your bus driver. Share, share, share.

And if you can't do that, please just send me and this project good vibes.

But if you can, donate, share AND send me good vibes it will help me inexplicably.

With love, and all of the peace in this world,


Key Ballah
