story:
Summary

'The name HeadSpace was motivated by the idea that in culture and society, we are not given the time or capacity to express, create and think, that time is money and that you need to buy some 'headspace' you need to be able to afford reflection and reflection and time are essentials to maintaining positive mental health.' 
HeadSpace is a contributor based magazine focused on the theme of mental health, It is hoped that HeadSpace is broadening the discussion for mental health issues in Ireland and abroad by publishing works of poetry, art, personal experience stories, creative writing and photography on matters of mental health. It is then being distributed to psychiatric hospitals, mental health support centres and colleges throughout Ireland.

It was founded in February 2013 by a group of young individuals who had spent time coping and struggling with mental health difficulties. Some of the founding members had spent time in psychiatric hospitals where they found it evident that there was a significant lack of reading material to which they could relate. HeadSpace was formed and  the creative magazine currently provides an outlet in times of illness and recovery, helping to promote positive mental health while not ignoring times of extreme pain and difficulty.  The magazine has successfully published three issues, with circulation of 1200 copies to psychiatric hospitals and mental health support centres throughout Ireland and the UK. 

Feedback on HeadSpace:

‘HeadSpace does exactly what it says on the tin - as well as being an outrageously welcoming avenue where aspiring artists can come and ply their trait in an often heartbreaking, always necessary manner, first and foremost it offers supreme solace to people suffering with mental health issues, eagerly handing they and their network of support the absolute right tools for combat.’ 


To keep HeadSpace alive and keep it funded for a further issue we are asking for €1000.  It costs €899 excluding VAT to publish 400 copies of the magazine at 36 pages per copy. Should there be a remainder after VAT it will go towards the launch of issue four.

    If we don't reach our goal, then we will continue fundraising for issue four regardless and all funds will go towards the fourth issue.
    Your contribution can keep this magazine alive and continue the invaluable work we are doing! HeadSpace has circulated over 1200 copies throughout Ireland and the UK so far with submissions coming in from all over the world. It has genuinely helped people express themselves in a creative manner in an avenue that was founded just last year. It has received media attention from the Irish Times, Newstalk FM, Near FM, Dublin City FM, Spirit Radio and West Dublin Access Radio as well as regional newspapers, The Laois Nationalist and The Carlow Nationalist. But remember we are a non profit organisation who are asking for your help to keep this venture going!

    If you can't contribute, please help raise our profile regardless, share this page and find us on facebook:

    https://www.facebook.com/HeadSpaceForAll

    or our website:

    https://www.headspace-magazine.com

    And contact us at:
    headspacezine@gmail.com 

    Create, Express, Solidarity and Support, help keep our work going with continued distribution to psychiatric hospitals, mental health support centres and colleges throughout Ireland. Helping to keep the discussion of mental health alive. 


    Excerpt from HeadSpace (1st Issue):

    The Glassy Diver

    Unbelievable… just unbelievable

    Don’t know how she does it

    One day she’s terribly down

    The next she does this!!

    Looking at ‘The Glassy Diver’

    You’d be hard-pressed to believe this is a

    Girl suffering from depression

    I remember it

    Remember the time she cried on the bus

    All the way back to hospital

    I told her that everything was alright

    That she would be alright

    And I was right

    In the artistic sense anyway

    It’s the most perfect piece of art

    I may ever see

    I go to watch her do it too

    Inside the craft room

    In a far corner of the hospital

    She concentrated… concentrated

    ‘Til the glass splinters fused

    Teacher blown away

    ‘’How are you able to create that when

    You’re supposed to be depressed?’’

    Good question, thought I

    But we let her get on with it

    I made a vase for my sister

    But as good as it may have been

    Paled in significance to ‘’The Glassy Diver’’

    It does seem there are crazy creative streaks running the core

    Inside hospital doors

    I just don’t get it

    Don’t get what part of her asked to be troubled

    Here’s hoping she gets the balance just right

    Then maybe there’ll be a pool full of glassy divers

    She the lifeguard

     - Brian O'Driscoll

Inside the craft
room
In a far corner
of the hospital
She
concentrated… concentrated
‘Til the glass
splinters fused
Teacher blown
away
‘’How are you
able to create that when
You’re supposed
to be depressed?’’
Good question,
thought I
But we let her
get on with it
I made a vase
for my sister
But as good as
it may have been
Paled in
significance to ‘’The Glassy Diver’’
It does seem
there are crazy creative streaks running the core
Inside hospital
doors
I just don’t get
it
Don’t get what
part of her asked to be troubled
Here’s hoping
she gets the balance just right
Then maybe
there’ll be a pool full of glassy divers

She the lifeguard


 - Brian O'Driscoll

story:
Le français suit

Invest in research,
Invest in the lives of Canadian women and girls  

We want issues of gender justice to be a campaign issue for the 2015 federal election.  With your support, the Gender Justice For All! / Pour la justice de genre! research initiative will help make this happen. 

‘We’ are CRIAW-ICREF, the Canadian Research Institute for the Advancement of Women, a research institute focusing exclusively on creating feminist research and making it accessible for public advocacy and education. Our mission is to provide tools that help advocacy organizations take action on advancing social justice and equality for all women. “Gender justice” means creating laws and policies that support equity for all genders across social positions, including race, class, sexuality, ability and citizenship status. 

In Canada, women continue to comprise the majority of people living in poverty.  The gender gap in employment, wages, and workplace promotion continues, despite our increasing levels of training and education.  Rape culture persists on campuses across the country.  And violence against women, including intimate partner violence, sexual assault, and femicide, impact women from across the social spectrum, with a devastating toll being taken on Aboriginal women and girls. 

Our goal is to produce a publicly available research report that documents Canadians' perspectives, particularly those of women and our feminist allies, on these issues and the progressive policy changes needed to redress the inequities faced by women and girls across the nation. 

To gather this information, we will be holding focus groups with Canadian women's organizations and allied community associations, including feminist, LGBTQ, indigenous, and anti-racism groups. The focus groups will be facilitated by student moderators trained by faculty from Women's and Gender Studies and other social sciences programs across Canada.  

Our objectives include: 
  • listening to a diverse range of women and allied groups in each province/territory, including rural and reserve communities;
  • learning what they identify as the key issues currently inhibiting women's and girls' security and success in Canadian society;
  • identifying themes common to these diverse testimonies, as well as the ideas and experiences that are specific to certain affinity groups; 
  • building advocacy networks between affinity groups (a solidarity index);
  • writing and distributing a report based on these conversations to advocacy groups and policy-makers.

Fundraising Goal

We need to raise $35 000 (Cdn) to make this research project happen.  Your donations will allow us to:
  • hire project assistants, including the researchers who will collect, analyze, and store the data and draft the report;
  • hire essential office support staff, to manage the daily operation of the project; 
  • pay for communications and technical expenses of the project, including the production, promotion, and distribution of the final report.  

To thank you for your contribution, we've included some cool and useful eco-friendly perks. Donations of $50 or more receive free membership to CRIAW!  

If we don't reach our goal, the money raised will still be used to off-set the costs of the research project.  

This research initiative flips the script – instead of asking politicians, we’re asking Canadian women and our allies what is needed to make a real and positive change in our lives. Your support, through donations and “Shares,” will remind Canada’s political leadership that women’s knowledge and well being matters to everyone! 

    Many ways to help... 

    • Please donate!  We appreciate all financial contributions, no matter the amount. 
    • Please share!  You can spread the word about Gender Justice For All! / Pour la justice de genre! with your friends, community, and online network through Facebook, Twitter, and email.  
    • If you're an instructor and would like your students to participate in the project, please contact: genderjustice@criaw-icref.ca

    For all other inquiries, please contact: genderjustice@criaw-icref.ca 

    Thank you for supporting Gender Justice For All! / Pour la justice de genre!  


    Investissez dans la recherche, investissez dans la vie des femmes et des filles au Canada

    Nous voulons que les enjeux d’équité entre les genres en matière de justice sociale soient un enjeu de la campagne électorale fédérale 2015. Grâce à votre appui, l’initiative de recherche « Gender Justice For All! / Pour la justice de genre ! » nous permettra d’atteindre ce but.

    L’Institut canadien de recherches sur les femmes (ICREF) est axé exclusivement sur la création et la diffusion de recherche féministe pouvant aider à sensibiliser le public. Notre mission consiste à outiller les organismes de défense de droits pour leur permettre de mieux promouvoir la justice sociale et l’égalité pour toutes les femmes. La «Justice de genre» c’est la création de lois et de politiques qui renforcent l’équité pour tous les genres et toutes les couches sociales, sans égard à la race, la classe, la sexualité, la capacité et le statut de citoyenneté.

    Encore aujourd’hui, la majorité des personnes vivant dans la pauvreté au Canada sont des femmes. Le fossé entre les genres en matière d’emploi, de salaires et de promotions persiste – malgré une hausse générale du niveau de formation et d’éducation. La culture du viol perdure sur les campus universitaires de toutes les régions du pays.De plus, la violence envers les femmes, y compris la violence conjugale, les agressions sexuelles et les féminicides, continue d’avoir un impact négatif sur la vie de femmes dans toutes les couches de la société, particulièrement chez les femmes et les filles autochtones.

    Nous visons à produire un rapport de recherche accessible au public qui documenterait les perspectives canadiennes, plus particulièrement celles des femmes et de nos supporters féministes, à propos de ces enjeux ainsi que des changements politiques progressistes qui pourraient remédier aux inégalités documentées et persistantes que doivent affronter les femmes et les filles partout au Canada.

    Pour prévoyons recueillir ces informations en organisant des groupes de discussion avec des organisations de femmes et des groupes communautaires, notamment des groupes féministes, LGBT, autochtones et antiracistes. Les groupes de discussion seront animés par des personnes formées comme modératrices dans des programmes de sciences sociales, notamment en études sur les femmes et le genre.

    Nos objectifs incluent :

    • écouter des femmes et des groupes de femmes issus de multiples horizons dans chaque province et territoire, y compris dans les régions rurales et sur les réserves ;
    • déterminer ce qu’elles identifient comme étant les principaux enjeux qui empêchent les femmes et les filles dans la société canadienne et menacent leur sécurité;
    • faire ressortir des tendances à partir des témoignages et isoler des thèmes communs à certains groupes d’affinité ;
    • créer des réseaux de plaidoyer entre les groupes d’affinité (un indice de solidarité) ;
    • distribuer le rapport final aux groupes de défense et aux décisionnaires politiques.

    Objectif de financement

    Pour réaliser ce projet de recherche, nous devons réussir à amasser 35 000$. Votre don nous permettra:

    • d’embaucher des assistantes de projet, dont notamment les chercheuses qui auront la tâche de recueillir, d’analyser, et d’enregistrer les données, puis de rédiger le rapport;
    • d’embaucher le personnel de bureau nécessaire, de gérer les affaires courantes du projet;
    • de défrayer les communications et les dépenses techniques liées au projet, dont la correspondance, la promotion et la production du rapport final.

    Pour vous remercier de votre contribution, vous recevrez des cadeaux et avantages à la fois utiles et bons pour l’environnement. Les dons de 50$ ou plus vous donneront droit à une adhésion gratuite à l’ICREF!

    Par ailleurs, même si nous n’atteignons pas notre objectif de collecte de fonds, l’argent récolté servira quand même à réduire les coûts du projet.

    Ce projet de recherche va, en quelque sorte, à contre-courant car, plutôt que d’interroger la classe politique, nous demandons directement aux femmes du Canada et à nos supporters de nous faire des suggestions de changements politiques qui feraient une vraie différence dans nos vies Votre appui, grâce à des dons et à des partages (facebook et autres), va rappeler aux leaders politiques de tout le pays que les savoirs et le bien-être des femmes sont importants pour tout le monde!

    Vous pouvez aider:

    • En faisant un don !
    • En partageant ! Vous pouvez passer le mot, à propos de la campagne «Gender Justice For All! / Pour la justice de genre !», à vos proches, dans votre communauté et dans vos réseaux internet, en utilisant les outils de partage sur Indiegogo.
    • En exprimant votre soutien pour le travail de l’ICREF en cliquant sur «j’aime» sur notre page Facebook, ainsi qu’en rediffusant l’information concernant la campagne «Gender Justice For All! / Pour la justice de genre ! ».
    • En invitant les gens à participer au projet, si vous enseignez dans une école et aimeriez impliquer vos élèves par exemple. Dans ce cas, veuillez contacter : genderjustice@criaw-icref.ca

    Pour toute demande d’information, contacter genderjustice@criaw-icref.ca

    Merci de votre soutien à la campagne « Gender Justice For All! / Pour la justice de genre ! »

story:
Are you ready to join the revolution?

My name is Stephanie Shar and I run a blog called The Loudmouth Lifestyle.  But it isn’t just a blog, and I’m not the only Loudmouth.  And this isn’t just a campaign, it’s a movement.

When I released my first e-book, 7 Steps to Living Loudly: Discover Who You Are, Decide What You Need and Create the Life You Want, it was only a preview of what's to come.  We live in an exciting time where anything is possible, and it's time to take advantage of it.  Women have more power than ever, and I'm ready to use that power for good.  Aren't you?

My goal is to provide others with the inspiration and motivation to live and love themselves and their lives to the fullest.  I want to continue helping people, but I need your help in doing so.

Your contribution will assist in funding more e-books, e-courses and resources to bring women closer to their dreams; an opportunity to hire a team, which will allow for more unique, killer content; and a kick-ass clothing line so you can show the world how loud you are.  But want to know EXACTLY where your cash is going?  Read on for a breakdown.

What We Need & What You Get

If we reach our goal of $3000, here's where the money will go:

  • 50% towards the hiring of a blog photographer, videographer, office assistant and staff writer
  • 25% towards a Dress Loudly clothing line, starting with hoodies and t-shirts for both women and children
  • 10% towards a second e-book, an interactive e-course, and one-on-one consultations
  • 10% towards website design and maintenance costs
  • 5% towards RAINN, the nation's largest anti-sexual assault organization

On this small budget, we hope to accomplish all of these things by September of next year.  Here's what's in it for you, depending on how much you donate:

  • A shout-out in my follow-up post about this campaign, linking to your blog or website
  • A personalized hand-written card in the mail from me
  • A copy of my first and/or upcoming e-book
  • A secondhand item from my shop
  • A t-shirt or hoodie from the new line
  • A one-on-one consultation focusing on your blog and brand
  • Free access to the new, interactive e-course

If our goal is not met, we will not be able to accomplish all of the above.  You will still receive the perks that are available.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate, you can still support the Loudmouth movement in other ways!  Here are a few ideas:

  • Post about this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest or Instagram.
  • Visit my blogroll and say hi to other gals who are following their dreams.  Stay active in the blogging community and continue to be an encouraging voice to those around you.
  • Share your own inspiring story on my blog by shooting a guest post to my email.
  • If you're going after what you want, don't stop.  And if you're not, why not?

Dream big. Live loud. Start something. You're capable of so much more than you think... Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
I Need Your Help...

But you probably already knew that I needed help. No seriously I need your help to make this book a reality. I am really close, but need you. In faith, knowing you would come through, I have cleared my schedule so that I can finally finish this book and release it before the end of the year. Here are few things that your contribution will help make a reality for this project: 

  • Allows me to take the time off from speaking to dedicate the majority of my time to this book.
  • Hire someone to format and layout the book
  • Allow for a professional copyeditor to fix my spelling and grammar. No one wants to read a book from someone who don't spell reel guud. ;)
  • Bring a publicist on board to help let people know about the book, get interviews, and reviews. 
  • If we exceed the goal by 5000, it will allow us to create a mini life plan manual to give away to students at our school assemblies. 
  • Have the book converted to ebook format for Apple's iBookstore and Amazon's Kindle

Making Elephants What?

I think everyone has heard the statement "the elephant in the room," but what I don't think you know is there is a probably an elephant in your room. As I travel around the country speaking I have learned that everyone has a dream. More than half the people I meet wish they had a different job or just wish they could do something that matters. Living in Nashville, every coffee shop you go to you can get your coffee served from someone waiting for their big break. Sadly though, most people have this big dream that they have adopted like a pet elephant and rather than unleash their elephant, they allow it sit around and not do anything. I have seen elephants go to the bathroom. Trust me, you don't want an elephant as a pet! 

This book is for anyone with a dream that they wish they could get off the coach and get it soaring high.   

Just because you are awesome enough to come to this page, I want you to see how the book will start in Chapter Zero. 

A Little from Chapter Zero

I remember, growing up, that every time something significant was happening, my Mom had to sign a permission slip for me to participate. Whether it was Summer Camp, a field trip to the zoo, or just going to the neighborhood pool alone. This book is here to be your permission slip. You have to sign it though. Your Mom can't help you with this one. This is your permission slip to do that one thing you have always wanted to do. To chase that dream that you have always had. To make that idea on the back of a napkin a reality. To do that one thing that "they" always told you was impossible.

For centuries people have had those kinds of ideas. If you are reading this at a coffee shop, chances are everyone around you has one of those ideas. Sadly, most of them will never act on them. Every one of us has had that "ah-ha" moment where we said things like "I wonder", "what if", "if I could only."  

I know what you are asking now. What do elephants have to do with all of this? Well I am glad you asked. 

DOWNLOAD The 1st TWO pages of Chapter Zero HERE

 

Terry Weaver is a speaker, author, creative, and life coach who's passion is to see others live life alive; whether through helping others see their dreams become reality, traveling around the world challenging thousands of students in Middle Schools, High Schools, and Colleges to change the world, or leading teams of people to do more together than they could alone. He is the founder of Fuselage, an organization taking people to the next level, and Activate Assemblies, a program challenging students to stop waiting for permission to chase their dreams.  Based outside of Nashville, Terry has helped artists and creatives navigate the process of turning their dreams into goals, and making them a reality. He has given his clients the tools to move from selling albums out of their garage to selling millions of records, having hit radio singles, and being recognized by the Grammy Awards for their gifts. When he’s not traveling around the country hanging with students or with Mickey Mouse, he is at home outside of Franklin, TN with his wife Leslie and their dog.

What people are saying about Terry

"I love working with Terry Weaver. He is a dreamer and a doer - he brings vision to reality. Additionally, he "gets" it - he's down to earth and realistic, and works hard to make sure people are served well." -Leigh Holt, Vice President of Strategic Partnerships, Warner Music Nashville

"Thank you so much for the gift of your time and talent which you brought to our school I was reminded that I must persevere, that I am here for a purpose and must dare to be different and never give up hope.  Since your visit here, I have found renewed inspiration and have redirected my perspective.  Thank you for your sacrifice and your effort to make a difference.  You truly were used to make a difference in me!!" Sandy Adams, High School Teacher

"Terry Weaver loves students and leaders. He passionately works to make them successful by pouring value into them and by supporting their work in the field." -Kerry Bural, Principal at The Resonate Group, Inc.

“Terry is an outstanding communicator who does an amazing job of relating to youth. He displays a passion for young people that translates into changed lives.”–Rob Myers, Youth Pastor, First Baptist Church, Newport, TN

 

 
 

The story for this Orange Country native began with humble beginnings selling art door to door as a teenager on a bicycle. Noah Elias aka Noah is a renown artist, clothing designer, speaker, author, and creator based in Costa Mesa, California where he lives with his wife and two children. Quickly, word of his talent spread and his work caught the eye of such companies as Lexus, Alpine Electronics, Metal Mulisha, Disney, Hart and Huntington, Nordstrom, Toyota, Famous Stars and Straps, and Scion.  Noah's work has been featured in the "Fast and Furious" movie franchise, and TV networks such as TLC, VH1, CBS, MTV, and Fox. His celebrity work includes recording artist Pink, Tom Cruise, Travis Barker, and Ted Danson. An amazing day came when Noah partnered with The Walt Disney Company™ to create a line of Noah versions of the characters. His creations are featured on all four Disney Cruise Line Ships, at Walt Disney World in Orlando, FL, and Disneyland Resort in Anaheim, CA. He also empowers other creatives helping them harness their unique gifts to impact and influence on their world. Noah recently launched "The Kid in Me" telling life stories through eyes of a child.

Noah's Halos

You can learn about Halos here and see how they are created. 

T-Shirt Perk

 

Digital Album Download Perk

 

Share these images on Social Media

 

Pinterest, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr and Facebook
story_txt:
I Need Your Help...
But you probably already knew that I needed help. No seriously I need your help to make this book a reality. I am really close, but need you. In faith, knowing you would come through, I have cleared my schedule so that I can finally finish this book and release it before the end of the year. Here are few things that your contribution will help make a reality for this project: 

Allows me to take the time off from speaking to dedicate the majority of my time to this book.
Hire someone to format and layout the book
Allow for a professional copyeditor to fix my spelling and grammar. No one wants to read a book from someone who don't spell reel guud. ;)
Bring a publicist on board to help let people know about the book, get interviews, and reviews. 
If we exceed the goal by 5000, it will allow us to create a mini life plan manual to give away to students at our school assemblies. 
Have the book converted to ebook format for Apple's iBookstore and Amazon's Kindle



Making Elephants What?
I think everyone has heard the statement "the elephant in the room," but what I don't think you know is there is a probably an elephant in your room. As I travel around the country speaking I have learned that everyone has a dream. More than half the people I meet wish they had a different job or just wish they could do something that matters. Living in Nashville, every coffee shop you go to you can get your coffee served from someone waiting for their big break. Sadly though, most people have this big dream that they have adopted like a pet elephant and rather than unleash their elephant, they allow it sit around and not do anything. I have seen elephants go to the bathroom. Trust me, you don't want an elephant as a pet! 
This book is for anyone with a dream that they wish they could get off the coach and get it soaring high.   
Just because you are awesome enough to come to this page, I want you to see how the book will start in Chapter Zero. 

A Little from Chapter Zero
I remember, growing up, that every time something significant was happening, my Mom had to sign a permission slip for me to participate. Whether it was Summer Camp, a field trip to the zoo, or just going to the neighborhood pool alone. This book is here to be your permission slip. You have to sign it though. Your Mom can't help you with this one. This is your permission slip to do that one thing you have always wanted to do. To chase that dream that you have always had. To make that idea on the back of a napkin a reality. To do that one thing that "they" always told you was impossible.
For centuries people have had those kinds of ideas. If you are reading this at a coffee shop, chances are everyone around you has one of those ideas. Sadly, most of them will never act on them. Every one of us has had that "ah-ha" moment where we said things like "I wonder", "what if", "if I could only."  
I know what you are asking now. What do elephants have to do with all of this? Well I am glad you asked. 

DOWNLOAD The 1st TWO pages of Chapter Zero HERE



 

Terry Weaver is a speaker, author, creative, and life coach who's passion is to see others live life alive; whether through helping others see their dreams become reality, traveling around the world challenging thousands of students in Middle Schools, High Schools, and Colleges to change the world, or leading teams of people to do more together than they could alone. He is the founder of Fuselage, an organization taking people to the next level, and Activate Assemblies, a program challenging students to stop waiting for permission to chase their dreams.  Based outside of Nashville, Terry has helped artists and creatives navigate the process of turning their dreams into goals, and making them a reality. He has given his clients the tools to move from selling albums out of their garage to selling millions of records, having hit radio singles, and being recognized by the Grammy Awards for their gifts. When he’s not traveling around the country hanging with students or with Mickey Mouse, he is at home outside of Franklin, TN with his wife Leslie and their dog.
What people are saying about Terry
"I love working with Terry Weaver. He is a dreamer and a doer - he brings vision to reality. Additionally, he "gets" it - he's down to earth and realistic, and works hard to make sure people are served well." -Leigh Holt, Vice President of Strategic Partnerships, Warner Music Nashville
"Thank you so much for the gift of your time and talent which you brought to our school I was reminded that I must persevere, that I am here for a purpose and must dare to be different and never give up hope.  Since your visit here, I have found renewed inspiration and have redirected my perspective.  Thank you for your sacrifice and your effort to make a difference.  You truly were used to make a difference in me!!" Sandy Adams, High School Teacher
"Terry Weaver loves students and leaders. He passionately works to make them successful by pouring value into them and by supporting their work in the field." -Kerry Bural, Principal at The Resonate Group, Inc.
“Terry is an outstanding communicator who does an amazing job of relating to youth. He displays a passion for young people that translates into changed lives.”–Rob Myers, Youth Pastor, First Baptist Church, Newport, TN
 
 

 
The story for this Orange Country native began with humble beginnings selling art door to door as a teenager on a bicycle. story:
Who is Gail Saunders? As a person that was leveled by the death of their loved one I am not unique. But when my husband Frank died at 51, I was determined to not let grief become my new identity. I held to the lifeline Frank gave me when he make me promise to use his death to help others. That vow inspired me to do the deep and painful work of recalibrating myself and my life. I had to reweave the torn tapestry of what was, into a new fabric of being. I tried everything I could find to transform my profound pain into meaningful purpose. Marilyn Grosboll, my grief coach said,

"Gail is a trailblazer in the transformation of grief. I've worked with grievers for more than twenty-five years and no one has mourned more creatively, soulfully, and completely. I encouraged her to write a book to inspire others." 

Marilyn even took out her purse and paid for the first copy long before the writing began. I made my second promise to her that I would write this book to help others with death and mourning. 

I have written RESILIENT HEART: Transcending the Death of Your Loved One and now I need your help to get it into the hands and hearts of those dealing with the devastating loss of their loved one. You can contribute to this important and needed mission. Your gift will touch so many lives and give hope and guidance. You can donate in honor of a loved one you have lost. This book and online grief course that will be part of this project will empower people to engage in life again and do it wholeheartedly. I have combined not only my own experiences with Frank’s, my parents, and close friend’s deaths but also many other grievers’ stories. I have been a hospice volunteer for more than six years helping patients and their families cope with dying and grief. RESILIENT HEART shares creative and enlightened ways to mourn and reconnect with the part of us that is unbreakable, invincible, and resilient. That unshatterable part of you is your resilient heart. It is your heart that knows the way to get up and keep going when your mind hasn’t a clue. In RESILIENT HEART I give you support, comfort and hope when you are tossed into the wilderness of grief. It is a rare individual that is left unscathed by loss of a beloved. Unfortunately most don’t understand grief. I saw a study where people were asked how long it takes to grief the death of a close loved one. I was shocked to read that the average answer was two weeks! I and most are still in shock longer than that. This book is needed. The proposal of Resilient Heart won an award in a writing competition. I have also coauthored two other books that are on Amazon. My heart and soul are in this book. I promise you that you will be proud to be a part of this mission and you will be making a real difference in many lives.

Who is Gail? I am a person that KNOWS I am fulfilling my purpose in life. The two most important things I have done in my life are helping Frank die with as much dignity and grace as possible and this mission: writing this book and creating the online course to mentor individuals as they take the Resilient Heart Journey of grief. I want to share a poem with you which I wrote a few months after Frank died.


Phoenix Rising

Death is a midwife for my new life.

I’ve been stretched to extreme by her.

My heart exploded, shattered,

Leaving a deep gaping wound

In the center of my being.

Suffering is the catalyst

To the challenge;

The challenge to birth my expanded self

Through the openness

This sacred space.

Meanwhile, I’ll dance in the

Darkness of my sadness,

Swim in the ocean of my tears,

Give voice to my screaming feelings,

And purify through fire.

For the birth of my new existence,

I surrender and await the Phoenix’s rising.

I eventually did rise like the Phoenix and I can inspire and mentor you and others to do the same. It is possible to live a fulfilling and joyful life after the death of someone you love. Please help me touch lives in a profound way. Thank you from my whole heart!

Here is my favorite photo of Frank and I.


Frank had a huge heart, too large to be contained in his six foot six frame. Here’s Frank with Scruffy who we rescued from the dump.


My Gifts to You

Check out the perks I'm offering you tied to the financial contribution you make to this campaign. Perks include ways to honor and remember your loved ones who have died, autographed books, books donated to a hospice or church library or other facility of your choice. A coaching session with me, enrollment in the online course, or a week stay in my Greek Island home with sea view.

How will the Money be Used?

Your generous contributions will go toward:

·  Professional Copy Editing 

·  Professional Content Editing

·  Professional Proofreading

·  Cover Design

·  Internal Format Designer

·  Publishing

·  Marketing and Publicity

·  Book Launch

·  Book Tour

·  Online Course Development and Implementation

What I want YOU to do:

1.  Financially support this campaign to help me publish my book and create an interactive online Resilient Heart Journey Grief Course to teach others an enlightened way to mourn.

2.  Invite your family and friends to visit this site and financially support this effort.

3.  Visit my website at www.GailSaunders.com

4.  "Like" my Facebook page at www.facebook.com/pages/Resilient-Heart/675750779173687

5.  Send me good thoughts, energy, light, love and keep me and my work in your prayers.

What Others Are Saying

“Gail has the ability to express all sides of life and death. Through tears and laughter, her grace, spirituality, and courage shine through. She is quite remarkable in how she grew through her own mourning experience after the death of her beloved husband, Frank. Now she sensitively guides others to do the same. This book is both inspirational and transformational.” ~ Russell L. McIntyre, Th.D., Professor of Medical Ethics and Health Law, Robert Wood Johnson Medical School, Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, Ordained Lutheran Clergyman

“As a Funeral Celebrant I witness much grief, but also much glory. This topic is so profound and needed. Saunders offers so much of her heart along with inspiration and good sound advice. I am sure that Resilient Heart will be very helpful to folks in mourning.” ~ Donna Henes, Urban Shaman and author of Celestial Auspicious Occasions

THANK YOU  For Making a difference while honoring your departed loved ones!

story:
The universe places you in the position to thrive. Even when we feel weakest or ugliest, I need to hold onto a love supreme that guides my belief to continue in spite of adversity. VONA has provided a space to feel affirmed, valuable and necessary in a world that seeks to silence our stories. 2014 taught me that the work must evolve, mature and develop to capture the beauty of our lives.

Because of you, last year, I attended the 2014 VONA workshop with Willie Perdomo at UC, Berkeley. I have spoken to many of my family and friends about how vital this experience was for me. I had the chance to build community with other writers of color, be challenged by my peers, and be inspired by the best faculty in the world. I can go on forever about the magic of last summer. I've carried the love and strength from VONA with me ever since. 

This year I have gotten into Ruth Forman's workshop in Miami! I am excited to continue to have a place within the VONA community to further develop my poetry. In the last year, I have performed at various venues such as the Nuyorican Poets Cafee and Bowery Poetry Club, as well as sharing my work with various poetry houses in NYC like Capicu! and Good Vibes Creative Minds. This is due to the confidence I built while at VONA. The response to the work has been motivating me to push the boundaries of performance and the page. 

This is where mi familia and friends come to the rescue! Any contribution will be greatly appreciated to extend the magic of VONA. I need your help to raise funds for the flight (about $400) workshop fees ($600) and incidentals (about $100).  I even have a few perks to thank you! I have a newborn daughter, Naima Asha Morales. My family has expanded as have my financial responsibilities. Your help will be crucial to make this adventure a reality. 

Last year, I wrote "this will be the beginning of the rest of my artistic career. I hope along this path, I will publish, I will perform, I will share, I will cry, I will evolve." With your help, I have progressed greatly on this life path and look forward to continuing. Thank all of you in advance for your assistance. Let's keep moving! Pa'lante mi gente y gracias.
